line: Sorry about your car, by the way.

name: Penny
line: Oh, no, it's fine, you got most of it out the window.

name: Leonard
line: The poor guy on the bike. I had a nice time.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, me too. Um, good night.  Leonard?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah.

name: Penny
line: Was this supposed to be a date?

name: Leonard
line: This? No. No, of course not, this was just you and me hanging out with a bunch of guys who didn't show up, because of work and a colonoscopy.

name: Penny
line: Okay, I was just checking.

name: Leonard
line: When I take a girl out on a date, and I do, she knows she's been dated. Capital D. Bold face, underline, like Day-ted. I think I might have a little concussion, I'm going to go lay down for a while, good night.

name: Sheldon
line: So, how was your date?

name: Leonard
line: Awesome!

name: Sheldon
line: Score one for liquor and poor judgement.

name: Sheldon
line: I've been thinking about time travel again.

name: Leonard
line: Why, did you hit a roadblock with invisibility?

name: Sheldon
line: Put it on the back burner. Anyway, it occurs to me, if I ever did perfect a time machine, I'd just go into the past and give it to myself, thus eliminating the need for me to invent it in the first place.

name: Leonard
line: Interesting.

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, it really takes the pressure off.

name: Leonard
line: Sounds like a breakthrough, should I call the science magazines and tell them to hold the front cover?

name: Sheldon
line: It's time travel, Leonard, I will have already done that.

name: Leonard
line: Then I guess congratulations are in order.

name: Sheldon
line: No, congratulations will have been in order. You know, I'm not going to enjoy this party.

name: Leonard
line: I know, I'm familiar with you.

name: Sheldon
line: At the last department party, Dr Finkleday cornered me and talked about spelunking for 45 minutes.

name: Leonard
line: Yes, I was there.

name: Sheldon
line: You know what's interesting about caves, Leonard?

name: Leonard
line: What?

name: Sheldon
line: Nothing.

name: Leonard
line: Well then we'll avoid Finkleday, we'll meet the new department head, congratulate him, shake his hand and go.

name: Sheldon
line: How's this? Pleased to meet you, Dr Gablehouser. How fortunate for you that the University has chosen to hire you, despite the fact that you've done no original research in 25 years, and instead have written a series of popular books that reduce the great concepts of science to a series of anecdotes, each one dumbed down to accommodate the duration of an average bowel movement. Mahalo.

name: Leonard
line: Mahalo's a nice touch.

name: Sheldon
line: Do you know there are only eight consonants in the Hawaiian language.

name: Leonard
line: Interesting, you should lead with that.

name: Raj
line: Oh, God, Look at this buffet. I love America.

name: Leonard
line: You don't have buffets in India?

name: Raj
line: Of course, but it's all Indian food. You can't find a bagel in Mumbai to save your life. Schmear me.

name: Sheldon
line: Well here's an interesting turn of events.

name: Leonard
line: What.  Howard brought a date?

name: Sheldon
line: A more plausible explanation is that his work in robotics has made an amazing leap forward.

name: Howard
line: Hey, what up, science bitches? May I introduce my special lady friend, Summer.

name: Summer
line: I already told you, touching's extra.

name: Howard
line: Right. Sorry.

name: Leonard
line: Here comes our new boss, be polite.

name: Gablehouser
line: Hi fellas, Eric Gablehouser.

name: Howard
line: Howard Wolowitz.

name: Gablehouser
line: Howard, nice to meet you, and you are?

name: Sheldon
line: An actual real scientist.  How was that?

name: Sheldon
line: I can't believe he fired me.

name: Leonard
line: Well, you did call him a glorified high-school science teacher whose last successful experiment was lighting his own farts.

name: Sheldon
line: In my defence, I prefaced that by saying “with all due respect.”

name: Leonard
line: Morning

name: Sheldon
line: Morning.

name: Leonard
line: You're making eggs for breakfast?

name: Sheldon
line: This isn't breakfast, it's an experiment.

name: Leonard
line: Huh? Cos it looks a lot like breakfast.

name: Sheldon
line: I finally have the time to test my hypothesis, about the separation of the water molecules from the egg proteins, and its impact vis-a-vis taste.

name: Leonard
line: Sounds yummy. I look forward to your work with bacon.

name: Sheldon
line: As do I.

name: Leonard
line: You know, I'm sure if you just apologised to Gablehauser he would give you your job back.

name: Sheldon
line: I don't want my job back. I've spent the last three and a half years staring at greaseboards full of equations. Before that I spent four years working on my thesis. Before that I was in college, and before that, I was in the fifth grade. This is my first day off in decades, and I'm going to savour it.

name: Leonard
line: Okay. I'll let you get back to fixing your eggs.

name: Sheldon
line: I'm not just fixing my eggs, I'm fixing everyone's eggs.

name: Leonard
line: And we all thank you.

name: Sheldon
line: Use new eggs. .

name: Penny
line: Hi, hey. I'm running out to the market, do you guys need anything?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, well this would be one of those circumstances that people unfamiliar with the law of large numbers would call a coincidence.

name: Penny
line: I'm sorry?

name: Sheldon
line: I need eggs. Four dozen should suffice.

name: Penny
line: Four dozen?

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, and evenly distributed amongst brown, white, free range, large, extra-large and jumbo.

name: Penny
line: Okay, one more time?

name: Sheldon
line: Never mind, you won't get it right, I'd better come with you.

name: Penny
line: Oh, yay!

name: Penny
line: How come you didn't go into work today.

name: Sheldon
line: I'm taking a sabbatical, because I won't kow-tow to mediocre minds.

name: Penny
line: So you got canned, huh?

name: Sheldon
line: Theoretical physicists do not get canned. But yeah.

name: Penny
line: Well, maybe it's all for the best, you know I always say, when one door closes, another one opens.

name: Sheldon
line: No it doesn't. Not unless the two doors are connected by relays, or there are motion sensors involved.

name: Penny
line: No, no, I meant...

name: Sheldon
line: Or the first door closing causes a change of air pressure that acts upon the second door.

name: Penny
line: Never mind.

name: Sheldon
line: Slow down. Slow down, please slow down.

name: Penny
line: We're fine.

name: Sheldon
line: Look, you're not leaving yourself enough space between cars.

name: Penny
line: Oh, sure I am.

name: Sheldon
line: No, no. Let me do the math for you, this car weighs let's say 4,000lb, now add say 140 for me, 120 for you.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, I'm sorry, did I insult you? Is your body mass somehow tied into your self worth?

name: Penny
line: Well, yeah.

name: Sheldon
line: Interesting. Anyway, that gives us a total weight of, let's say, 4,400lb.

name: Penny
line: Let's say 4,390.

name: Sheldon
line: Fine. We're travelling forward at, good Lord, 51 miles an hour. Now let's assume that your brakes are new and the callipers are aligned, still, by the time we come to a stop, we'll be occupying the same space as that Buick in front of us, an impossibility that nature will quickly resolve into death, mutilation and... oh look, they built a new put-put course.

name: Sheldon
line: This is great. Look at me, out in the real world of ordinary people, just living their ordinary, colourless, workaday lives.

name: Penny
line: Thank you.

name: Sheldon
line: No, thank you. And thank you, ordinary person. Hey, you want to hear an interesting thing about tomatoes.

name: Penny
line: Uh, no, no not really. Listen, didn't you say you needed some eggs.

name: Sheldon
line: Uh, yes, but anyone who knows anything about the dynamics of bacterial growth knows to pick up their refrigerated foods on the way out of the supermarket.

name: Penny
line: Oh, okay, well maybe you should start heading on out then.

name: Sheldon
line: No, this is fun. Oh, the thing about tomatoes, and I think you'll really enjoy this, is, they're shelved with the vegetables, but they're technically a fruit.

name: Penny
line: Interesting.

name: Sheldon
line: Isn't it?

name: Penny
line: No, I mean what you find enjoyable.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh boy.

name: Penny
line: What now?

name: Sheldon
line: Well, there's some value to taking a multivitamin, but the human body can only absorb so much, what you're buying here are the ingredients for very expensive urine.

name: Penny
line: Well, maybe that's what I was going for.

name: Sheldon
line: Well then you'll want some manganese.

name: Sheldon
line: That was fun. Maybe tomorrow we can go to one of those big warehouse stores.

name: Penny
line: Oh, I don't know Sheldon, it's going to take me a while to recover from all the fun I had today.

name: Sheldon
line: Are you sure. There are a lot of advantages to buying in bulk. For example, I noticed that you purchase your tampons one month's supply at a time.

name: Penny
line: What?

name: Sheldon
line: Well think about it, it's a product that doesn't spoil, and you're going to be needing them for at least the next thirty years.

name: Penny
line: You want me to buy thirty years worth of tampons?

name: Sheldon
line: Well, thirty, thirty five, hey, when did your mother go into menopause?

name: Penny
line: Okay, I'm not talking about this with you.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, Penny, this is a natural human process, and we're talking about statistically significant savings. Now, if you assume 15 tampons per cycle and a 28 day cycle, are you fairly regular?  Okay, no warehouse store, but we're still on for put-put golf, right?

name: Leonard
line: Hey, I just ran into Penny, she seemed upset about something.

name: Sheldon
line: I think it's her time of the month. I marked the calendar for future reference.

name: Leonard
line: What's with the fish?

name: Sheldon
line: It's an experiment.

name: Leonard
line: What happened to your scrambled egg research?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, that was a dead end. Scrambled eggs are as good as they're ever going to be.

name: Leonard
line: So... fish.

name: Sheldon
line: I read an article about Japanese scientists, who inserted DNA from luminous jellyfish into other animals, and I thought hey, fish nightlights.

name: Leonard
line: Fish nightlights.

name: Sheldon
line: It's a billion dollar idea. Shhhhh!

name: Leonard
line: Mum's the word. Sheldon, are you sure you don't want to just apologise to Gablehauser and get your job back.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, no, no, no. No, I've too much to do.

name: Leonard
line: Like luminous fish.

name: Sheldon
line: Shhhhh!

name: Leonard
line: Right... I didn't....

name: Sheldon
line: That's just the beginning. I also have an idea for a bulk mail-order feminine hygiene company. Oh, glow in the dark tampons! Leonard, we're going to be rich.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you for coming on such short notice.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: You did the right thing calling.

name: Leonard
line: I didn't know what else to do, he's lost all focus, every day he's got a new obsession.  This is a particularly disturbing one.

name: Sheldon
line: Mommy.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Hi baby.

name: Sheldon
line: You called my mother?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Oh, you got yourself a loom, how nice.

name: Sheldon
line: Thank you.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Honey, why did you get a loom?

name: Sheldon
line: I was working with luminous fish, and I thought, hey, loom! Mom, what are you doing here?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Leonard called me.

name: Sheldon
line: I know, but why?

name: Leonard
line: Because one of the great minds of the twenty-first century is raising glow-in-the-dark fish and weaving sarapes.

name: Sheldon
line: This is not a sarape. This is a poncho. A sarape is open at the sides, a poncho is closed, this is a poncho, and neither is a reason to call someone's mother.

name: Leonard
line: Really, when was the last time you left the house.

name: Sheldon
line: I went to the market with Penny.

name: Leonard
line: That was three weeks ago.

name: Sheldon
line: Well then buckle up, in the next four to eight days she's going to get very crabby.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Sweetheart, your little friend is concerned about you.

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, well I'm not a child, I'm a grown man capable of living my life as I see fit. And I certainly don't need someone telling on me to my mother.

name: Leonard
line: Where are you going?

name: Sheldon
line: To my room, and no-one's allowed in.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: He gets his temper from his daddy.

name: Leonard
line: Oh.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: He's got my eyes.

name: Leonard
line: I see.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: All that science stuff, that comes from Jesus.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon? Your mum made dinner.

name: Sheldon
line: I'm not hungry.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Oh, Leonard, don't trouble yourself, he's stubborn. He may stay in there ‘til the Rapture.

name: Penny
line: Are we so sure that's a bad thing?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: I'll tell ya, I love the boy to death, but he has been difficult since he fell out of me at the K-Mart.

name: Howard
line: Excuse me for being so bold, but I now see where Sheldon gets his smouldering good looks.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Oh, honey that ain't going to work, but you keep trying.  I made chicken, I hope that isn't one of the animals that you people think is magic? You know, we have an Indian gentleman at our church, a Dr Patel, it's a beautiful story, the lord spoke to him, and moved him to give us all 20% off on lasic, you know, those that needed it.

name: Leonard
line: That is a lovely story, um, are we going to do anything about Sheldon?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Oh, we will, you have to take your time with Sheldon. His father, God rest his soul, used to say to me, Mary, you have to take your time with Sheldon.

name: Leonard
line: Sounds like a wise man.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Oh, not so wise, he was trying to fight a bobcat for some licquorish. So, everybody grab a plate, and a pretty place mat that Shelly wove.

name: Penny
line: Has Shelly ever freaked out like this before.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Oh, all the time, I remember one summer when he was thirteen, he built a small nuclear reactor in the shed and told everybody he was going to provide free electricity for the whole town, well the only problem was he had no, whatchacall, fissionable materials. Anyway, when he went on the internets to get some, a man from the government came by and sat him down real gentle and told him it's against the law to have yellow cake uranium in a shed.

name: Penny
line: What happened?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Well, the poor boy had a fit, locked himself in his room and built a sonic death ray.

name: Leonard
line: A death ray?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Well, that's what he called it, didn't even slow down the neighbour kids. It pissed our dog off to no end. You know, you two make a cute couple.

name: Leonard
line: No, we're not, we're not, not a couple, two singles, like those individually wrapped slices of cheese that.... are friends.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Did I pluck a nerve there?

name: Howard
line: Oh yeah.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Okay. Alright everybody, it's time to eat.  Oh Lord, we thank you for this meal, all your bounty, and we pray that you help Sheldon get back on his rocker.  Now after a moment of silent meditation I'm going to end with “In Jesus' Name” but you two don't feel any obligation to join in. Unless, of course, the holy spirit moves you.

name: Penny
line: Oh my God, this is the best cobbler I've ever had.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: It was always Sheldon' s favourite. You know what the secret ingredient is?

name: Penny
line: Love?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Lard.

name: Howard
line: Hey, look who's come out....

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Shhh! You'll spook him. He's like a baby deer, you gotta let him come to you.

name: Leonard
line: This is ridiculous. Dammit, Sheldon, snap out of it. You're a physicist, you belong at the University doing research, not hiding in your room.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: You don't hunt, do you?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Good morning, snicker-doodle.

name: Sheldon
line: Morning.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Oh, well that looks awful fancy, what is that?

name: Sheldon
line: It's my idea of what DNA would look like in a silicon based life form.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: But intelligently designed by a creator, right?

name: Sheldon
line: What do you want, mom?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: You know how your daddy used to say that you can only fish for so long before you got to throw a stick of dynamite in the water?

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Well, I'm done fishing.  You put those on.

name: Sheldon
line: What for?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Because you're going to go down to your office, you're going to apologise to your boss, and get your job back.

name: Sheldon
line: No.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: I'm sorry, did I start that sentence with the words “if it please your highness?”

name: Sheldon
line: I'm not going to apologise, I didn't say anything that wasn't true.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Now you listen here, I have been telling you since you were four years old, it's okay to be smarter than everybody but you can't go around pointing it out.

name: Sheldon
line: Why not?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Because people don't like it. Remember all the ass-kickings you got from the neighbour kids? Now let's get cracking. Shower, shirt, shoes, and let's shove off.

name: Sheldon
line: Wouldn't have been any ass-kickings if that stupid death ray had worked.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Problem solved.

name: Leonard
line: Really? That's impressive.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Leonard, the Lord never gives us more than we can handle. Thankfully he blessed me with two other children who are dumb as soup.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Excuse me, Dr Gablehouser, are you busy?

name: Gablehouser
line: Well, actually....

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Sheldon, he's just doodling, get in here.

name: Sheldon
line: Dr Gablehouser.

name: Gablehouser
line: Dr Cooper.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Let's go, baby, we're losing daylight.

name: Sheldon
line: Um, as you know, several weeks ago in our first encounter we may have gotten off on the wrong foot, when I called you an idiot. And I just wanted to say that I was wrong. To point it out.

name: Gablehouser
line: I'm sorry, we haven't been introduced. Dr Eric Gablehouser.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Mary Cooper, Sheldon's mom.

name: Gablehouser
line: Now that's impossible, you must have had him when you were a teenager.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Oh, aren't you sweet, his father's dead.

name: Gablehouser
line: Recently?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Long enough.

name: Gablehouser
line: Please. Sheldon, shouldn't you be working?

name: Sheldon
line: Okay.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, how did it go?

name: Sheldon
line: I got my job back.

name: Leonard
line: Really? What happened?

name: Sheldon
line: I'm not quite sure. It involves a part of the human experience that has always eluded me.

name: Leonard
line: That narrows it down.

name: Mrs Cooper
line: I'm very proud of you honey, you showed a lot of courage today.

name: Sheldon
line: Thanks, mom. Mom?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: Mmm-hmm?

name: Sheldon
line: Is Dr Gablehouser going to be my new daddy?

name: Mrs Cooper
line: We'll see. Sleep tight.

name: Sheldon
line: Alright, I'm moving my infantry division, augmented by a battalion of Orcs from Lord of the Rings, we flank the Tennessee Volunteers, and the North once again wins the Battle of Gettysburg.

name: Howard
line: Not so fast, remember the South still has two infantry divisions, plus Superman and Godzilla.

name: Leonard
line: No, no, no, no, Orcs are magic, Superman is vulnerable to magic, not to mention, you already lost Godzilla to the Illinois Cavalry and Hulk.

name: Raj
line: Why don't you just have Robert E. Lee charge the line with Shiva and Ganesh.

name: Penny
line: Hi, you guys ready to order?

name: Howard
line: Hang on, honey. Shiva and Ganesh? The Hindu Gods against the entire Union army?

name: Leonard
line: And Orcs!

name: Penny
line: I'll be back.

name: Raj
line: Excuse me, Ganesh is the remover of obstacles, and Shiva is the destroyer. When the smoke clears, Abraham Lincoln will be speaking Hindi and drinking mint juleps.

name: Penny
line: Alright, my boss says you either have to order, or leave and never come back.

name: Howard
line: What do you recommend for someone who worked up a man-sized appetite from a morning of weight training and cardio-funk?

name: Penny
line: A shower.

name: Howard
line: I'll take the heart smart platter.

name: Penny
line: Alright, thank you, and Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: We don't eat here, I don't know what's good.

name: Penny
line: Well, it's all good.

name: Sheldon
line: Statistically unlikely.

name: Leonard
line: Just get a hamburger, you like hamburgers.

name: Sheldon
line: I like the hamburgers where we usually have hamburgers, you can't make the assumption that I'll like the hamburgers here.

name: Leonard
line: I'm sorry. Give him a hamburger.

name: Penny
line: Uh, which one, the Classic Burger, the Ranch House Burger, the Barbecue Burger or the Kobe burger?

name: Sheldon
line: Can't we just go to Big Boy? They only have one burger. The Big Boy.

name: Penny
line: The Barbecue Burger is like the Big Boy.

name: Sheldon
line: Excuse me, in a world that already includes the Big Boy, why would I settle for something like a Big Boy?

name: Penny
line: Because you are not at Big Boy!

name: Sheldon
line: Fine, I'll have the Barbecue Burger.

name: Leonard
line: Make it two.

name: Sheldon
line: Waitresses don't yell at you at Big Boy.

name: Lesley
line: Hey Leonard, hi guys.

name: Leonard
line: Hey Lesley.

name: Lesley
line: I didn't know you ate here.

name: Sheldon
line: We don't. This is a disturbing aberration.

name: Leonard
line: Lesley, this is Penny, she lives across the hall from Sheldon and me.

name: Howard
line: And walks in quiet beauty like the night.

name: Penny
line: Howard, I've asked you not to do that.

name: Leonard
line: Lesley and I do research together at the University.

name: Penny
line: Oh, wow, a girl scientist.

name: Lesley
line: Yep, come for the breasts, stay for the brains. So, I'm glad I ran into you, the physics department string quartet needs a new cellist.

name: Leonard
line: What happened to Elliot Wong?

name: Lesley
line: He switched over to high energy radiation research, had a little mishap, and now the other guys are uncomfortable sitting next to him. So, are you in?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, sure, why not.

name: Lesley
line: Great, we rehearse on Tuesdays at your place.

name: Leonard
line: Why at my place?

name: Lesley
line: Yeah, the department of energy said our regular space is kind of a hot zone. Nice meeting you.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, you too. Leonard, I didn't know you played the cello?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, my parents felt that naming me Leonard and putting me in advanced placement classes wasn't getting me beaten up enough.

name: Howard
line: If you're into music, I happen to be a human beatbox.

name: Penny
line: Really?  I'm actually not that into music. So hey, your friend's really cute, anything going on with you two.

name: Leonard
line: Lesley? No, no-oh, what are you kidding?

name: Sheldon
line: He asked her out once, it was an embarrassing failure.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, I'm sorry, was that supposed to be a secret?

name: Penny
line: Oh, that's too bad, you guys would make a cute couple.

name: Raj
line: Oh dear.

name: Howard
line: What's the matter?

name: Raj
line: She didn't take my order.

name: Howard
line: How can she take your order when you're too neurotic to talk to her.

name: Raj
line: Nevertheless, this will be reflected in her tip.

name: Leonard
line: What did Penny mean, you'd make a cute couple?

name: Sheldon
line: Well I assume she meant that the two of you together would constitute a couple that others might consider cute. An alternate, and somewhat less likely interpretation, is that you could manufacture one. As in, oh look, Leonard and Lesley made Mr and Mrs Goldfarb, aren't they adorable.

name: Leonard
line: If Penny didn't know that Lesley had already turned me down then that would unambiguously mean that she, Penny, thought that I should her, Lesley, out, indicating that she, Penny, had no interest in me asking her, Penny, out. But because she did know that I had asked Lesley out and that she, Lesley, had turned me down then she, Penny, could be offering consolation. That's too bad, you would have made a cute couple. But while thinking, good, Leonard remains available.

name: Sheldon
line: You're a lucky man, Leonard.

name: Leonard
line: How so?

name: Sheldon
line: You're talking to one of the three men in the Western hemisphere capable of following that train of thought.

name: Leonard
line: Well, what do you think.

name: Sheldon
line: I said I could follow it, I didn't say I cared.

name: Lesley
line: I admire your fingering.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you.

name: Lesley
line: Maybe some time you can try that on my instrument.

name: Lesley
line: Goodnight guys, good job.

name: Male string quartettist
line: Thanks.

name: Female string quartettist
line: See you next week.

name: Leonard
line: That was fun, Lesley, thanks for including me.

name: Lesley
line: You're welcome. If you're up for it we could practise that middle section again.

name: Leonard
line: Uh, sure, why not.

name: Lesley
line: Just so we're clear, you understand that me hanging back to practise with you is a pretext for letting you know that I'm sexually available.

name: Leonard
line: Really?

name: Lesley
line: Yeah, I'm good to go.

name: Leonard
line: I thought you weren't interested in me.

name: Lesley
line: That was before I saw you handling that beautiful piece of wood between your legs.

name: Leonard
line: You mean my cello?

name: Lesley
line: No, I mean the obvious crude double entendre. I'm seducing you.

name: Leonard
line: No kidding?

name: Lesley
line: What can I say, I'm a passionate and impulsive woman. So how about it?

name: Leonard
line: Gee, uh...

name: Lesley
line: Is it the waitress?

name: Leonard
line: Penny? What about her?

name: Lesley
line: Well, I thought I saw your pupils dilate when you looked at her, which, unless you're a heroin addict, points to sexual attraction.

name: Leonard
line: Well, I did have a poppy seed bagel for breakfast, which could give a positive urine test for opiates but certainly not dilate my pupils, so I guess there's no point in bringing it up.

name: Lesley
line: You and the waitress then?

name: Leonard
line: No. No, there's nothing going on between Penny and me.

name: Lesley
line: So, you're open to a sexual relationship?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah. Yeah, I guess I am.

name: Lesley
line: Good.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, yeah it is good. Did you want to start now?

name: Lesley
line: Why don't we finish the section first.

name: Leonard
line: Oh. Okay. A little musical foreplay. Terrific.

name: Leonard
line: I'm good, I'm good to go.

name: Lesley
line: Me too.

name: Penny
line: Oh, hey Sheldon, what's going on?

name: Sheldon
line: I need your opinion on a matter of semiotics.

name: Penny
line: I'm sorry?

name: Sheldon
line: Semiotics. The study of signs and symbols, it's a branch of philosophy related to linguistics.

name: Penny
line: Okay, sweetie, I know you think you're explaining yourself, but you're really not.

name: Sheldon
line: Just come with me.

name: Sheldon
line: Well?

name: Penny
line: Well what?

name: Sheldon
line: What does it mean?

name: Penny
line: Oh, come on, you went to college.

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, but I was eleven.

name: Penny
line: Alright, look, a tie on the doorknob usually means someone doesn't want to be disturbed because they're, you know, getting busy.

name: Sheldon
line: So you're saying Leonard has a girl in there.

name: Penny
line: Well, either that or he's lost his tie rack and gotten really into Bryan Adams.

name: Lesley
line: Oh Leonard, you magnificent beast.

name: Penny
line: We really shouldn't be standing here.

name: Sheldon
line: This is very awkward.

name: Penny
line: Oh, come on, you know, Leonard's had girls over before, right?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, yes, but there's usually planning, courtship and advance notice. Last time I was able to book a cruise to the Arctic to see a solar eclipse.

name: Penny
line: Wait, you had to leave the state because your roommate was having sex?

name: Sheldon
line: I didn't have to, the dates just happened to coincide.

name: Penny
line: So, do you know who's in there?

name: Sheldon
line: Well, there's Leonard.  And he's either with Lesley Winkle or a 1930's gangster.

name: Penny
line: Hmmm. Good for him. Good for Leonard. Okay, night.

name: Sheldon
line: No, no, wait, hold on.

name: Penny
line: What's the matter?

name: Sheldon
line: I don't know what the protocol is here. Do I stay, do I leave? Do I wait to greet them with a refreshing beverage?

name: Penny
line: Gee, Sheldon, you're asking the wrong girl. I'm usually on the other side of the tie.

name: Sheldon
line: Hi, Leonard. It's me, Sheldon. In the living room. I just, I wanted you to know I saw the tie. Message received. You're welcome. You carry on. Give my best to Lesley.

name: Sheldon
line: Big boy!  Someone touched my board. Oh God, my board. Leonard! Leonard!

name: Leonard
line: Hey, what's the matter?

name: Sheldon
line: My equations, someone's tampered with my equations.

name: Leonard
line: Are you sure?

name: Sheldon
line: Of course I'm sure. Look at the beta-function of quantum chrono-dynamics, the sign's been changed.

name: Leonard
line: Oh yeah. But doesn't that fix the problem you've been having?

name: Sheldon
line: Are you insane? Are you out of your mind? Are you.... hey look, that fixes the problem I've been having.

name: Lesley
line: You're welcome.

name: Sheldon
line: You did this?

name: Lesley
line: Yeah, I noticed it when I got up to get a glass of water, so I fixed it, now you can show that quarks are asymptotically free at high energies. Pretty cool, huh?

name: Sheldon
line: Cool?

name: Lesley
line: Listen, I got to hit the lab. Thanks for a great night.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you, I'll see you at work.

name: Sheldon
line: Uh-duh, hold on, hold on!

name: Lesley
line: What?

name: Sheldon
line: Who told you you could touch my board?

name: Lesley
line: No-one.

name: Sheldon
line: I don't come into your house and touch your board.

name: Lesley
line: There are no incorrect equations on my board.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, that is so... so...

name: Lesley
line: I'm sorry, I've got to run, if you come up with an adjective, text me. .

name: Sheldon
line: Inconsiderate, that is the adjective, inconsiderate.

name: Leonard
line: You can stare at your board all day Sheldon, she's still going to be right.

name: Sheldon
line: I'm not staring, I'm mulling.

name: Penny
line: Oh, hey Leonard.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, hi.

name: Penny
line: So, how's it going?

name: Leonard
line: Pretty good.

name: Penny
line: Just pretty good, I'd think you were doing very good.

name: Leonard
line: Pretty, very, there's really no objective scale for delineating variations of good, why do you ask?

name: Penny
line: Well, a little bird told me that you and Lesley hooked up last night.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon!

name: Sheldon
line: I'm coming.

name: Penny
line: So, is it serious, do you like her?

name: Leonard
line: Wuh, I don't.... th-th-th-that's really two different questions, uh, I'm not.... Sheldon, we have to go!

name: Sheldon
line: Boy, you're wound awfully tight for a man who just had sexual intercourse.

name: Penny
line: Alright, well, I'll talk to you later, but, I am so happy for you Leonard.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you. What did she mean, she's happy for me? Is she happy because I'm seeing someone, or is she happy because she thinks that I'm happy, because anyone who cared for someone would want them to be happy, even if the reason for their happiness made the first person unhappy. You know, because the second person, though happy, is now romantically unavailable to the first person.

name: Sheldon
line: Do you realise I may have to share a Nobel Prize with your booty call?

name: Leonard
line: You know what, I'm being ridiculous. But who cares what Penny thinks, Lesley is a terrific girl, she's attractive, we like each other, she's extremely intelligent.

name: Sheldon
line: She's not that intelligent.

name: Leonard
line: She fixed your equation.

name: Sheldon
line: She got lucky.

name: Leonard
line: You don't believe in luck.

name: Sheldon
line: I don't have to believe in it for her to be lucky.

name: Leonard
line: Regardless, I have a chance at a real relationship with Lesley, I'm not going to pass that up for some hypothetical future happiness with a woman who may or may not want me to be happy with a woman who is currently making me happy.

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah.

name: Sheldon
line: I still don't care.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, Lesley.

name: Lesley
line: Careful  Leonard, liquid nitrogen, 320 degrees below zero.

name: Leonard
line: Brrrr. Why are you smashing a flash frozen banana.

name: Lesley
line: Because I've got a bowl of Cheerios and I couldn't find a knife.

name: Leonard
line: So anyway  Hello.

name: Lesley
line: Uh, what are you doing?

name: Leonard
line: Just extending the intimacy. Do you want to slip over to the radiation lab and share a decontamination shower?

name: Lesley
line: Okay, uh, what exactly do you think's going on between us?

name: Leonard
line: I'm not sure, but I think I'm about to discover how the banana felt.

name: Lesley
line: Listen, Leonard, neither of us are neuroscientists but we both understand the biochemistry of sex, I mean, dopamine in our brains is released across synapses causing pleasure. You stick electrodes in a rat's brain, give him an orgasm button, he'll push that thing until he starves to death.

name: Leonard
line: Who wouldn't?

name: Lesley
line: Well, the only difference between us and a rat is that you can't stick an electrode in our hypothalamus. That's where you come in.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, well, I'm just glad to be a part of it. So what happens now?

name: Lesley
line: Well, I don't know about your sex drive, but I'm probably good till New Years.

name: Leonard
line: Oh. Okay. Thank you.

name: Lesley
line: Thank you!

name: Leonard
line: You want to make plans for New Years.

name: Lesley
line: Woah, Leonard, please, you're smothering me.

name: Leonard
line: Sorry.

name: Howard
line: Hey, look, it's Doctor Stud!

name: Leonard
line: Doctor what?

name: Howard
line: The blogosphere is a-buzzing with news of you and Lesley Winkle making eine kleine bang-bang music.

name: Leonard

name: Howard
line: I put it there.

name: Leonard
line: Well, how did you know about it?

name: Raj
line: A little bird told us. Apparently you are a magnificent beast.

name: Leonard
line: Well, that part's true!

name: Sheldon
line: You know, I think I may have misjudged this restaurant.

name: Leonard
line: No kidding.

name: Sheldon
line: I won't go out on a limb, but I think we may be looking at my new Tuesday hamburger.

name: Leonard
line: Your old Tuesday hamburger will be so broken hearted.

name: Sheldon
line: Way ahead of you. I was thinking of moving Big Boy to Thursdays, and just dropping Soup Plantation.

name: Leonard
line: Really?

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, the name always confused me anyway, Soup Plantation. You can't grow soup.

name: Penny
line: So, how's everything.

name: Sheldon
line: Terrific, you'll be happy to know that I plan to come here every Tuesday night for the foreseeable future.

name: Penny
line: Really, oh yay!

name: Sheldon
line: Who do I speak to about permanently reserving this table?

name: Penny
line: Um, I don't know, a psychiatrist? So hey, how are things with you and Lesley?

name: Leonard
line: Oh, to be honest, I don't think it's going to work out.

name: Penny
line: Oh, oh that's too bad. Well hey, don't worry, I'm sure there is someone out there who is just right for you. .

name: Leonard
line: Well what did she mean by that? Was that just a generic platitude or was that a subtle bid for attention?

name: Sheldon
line: You know why this hamburger surpasses the Big Boy? This is a single decker hamburger whereas the Big Boy is a double decker. This has a much more satisfying meat to bun to condiment ratio.

name: Leonard
line: Are you even listening to me?

name: Sheldon
line: Of course I'm listening. Blah blah, hopeless Penny delusion, blah blah blah.

name: Leonard
line: Okay then. You know, you can grow the ingredients for soup. .

name: Raj
line: Okay, if no-one else will say it, I will. We really suck at paintball.

name: Howard
line: That was absolutely humiliating.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, come on, some battles you win, some battles you lose.

name: Howard
line: Yes, but you don't have to lose to Kyle Bernstein's Bar-Mitzvah party.

name: Leonard
line: I think we have to acknowledge, those were some fairly savage pre-adolescent Jews.

name: Sheldon
line: You know, we were annihilated by our own incompetence and the inability of some people to follow the chain of command.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, let it go.

name: Sheldon
line: No, I want to talk about the fact that Wolowitz shot me in the back.

name: Howard
line: I shot you for good reason, you were leading us into disaster.

name: Sheldon
line: I was giving clear, concise orders.

name: Leonard
line: You hid behind a tree yelling “get the kid in the yarmulkah, get the kid in the yarmulkah.”

name: Penny
line: Oh, hey guys.

name: Leonard

name: Howard
line: Morning ma'am.

name: Penny
line: So, how was paintball, did you have fun?

line: Sure, if you consider being fragged by your own troops fun.  You clear space on your calendar, there will be an enquiry.

line: Okay, um, oh hey, I'm having a party on Saturday so if you guys are around you should come by.

name: Penny
line: Yeah.

line: Well, there will be boys, and there will be girls, and it is a party. So, it'll just be a bunch of my friends, we'll have some beer, do a little dancing...

name: Penny
line: Well, yeah.

name: Penny
line: Um, yeah, Halloween.

name: Penny

line: Bjow

name: Leonard

name: All
line: Agreed.

line: I call Frodo!

line: Hey. Sorry I'm late, but my hammer got stuck in the door on the bus.

line: What? Just because I'm Indian I can't be a Norse God? No, no, no, Raj has to be an Indian God. That's racism. I mean, look at Wolowitz, he's not English, but he's dressed like Peter Pan. Sheldon is neither sound nor light, but he's obviously the Doppler Effect.

line: I'm not Peter Pan, I'm Robin Hood.

line: Really, because I saw Peter Pan, and you're dressed exactly like Cathy Rigby. She was a little bigger than you, but it's basically the same look, man.

line: Terrific. Um, this party is my first chance for Penny to see me in the context of her social group, and I need you not to embarrass me tonight.

line: All I'm saying is that this party is the perfect opportunity for Penny to see me as a member of her peer group. A potential close friend and... perhaps more. I don't want to look like a dork.

name: Howard
line: Just a heads up fellas, if anyone gets lucky I've got a dozen condoms in my quiver.

name: Penny
line: Oh, hey guys.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, sorry we're late.

name: Sheldon
line: And you said the party starts at seven.

name: Penny
line: Well, yeah, when you start a party at seven, no-one shows up at, you know, seven.

name: Penny
line: Yes. Yes it is. Okay, well, um, come on in.

name: Howard
line: What, are all the girls in the bathroom?

name: Penny
line: Probably, but in their own homes.

name: Sheldon
line: So what time does the costume parade start?

name: Penny
line: The parade?

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, so the judges can give out the prizes for best costume, you know, most frightening, most authentic, most accurate visual representation of a scientific principle.

name: Sheldon
line: This party is just going to suck.

name: Penny
line: No, come on, it's going to be fun, and you all look great, I mean, look at you, Thor, and, oh, Peter Pan, that's so cute.

line: Actually, Penny, he's Rob...

line: I'm Peter Pan! And I've got a handful of pixie dust with your name on it.

line: Yes. It's the apparent change in the frequency of a wave caused by relative motion between the source of the wave and the observer.

line: Okay.

name: Sheldon
line: Telepathically?

name: Penny
line: Oh hey, when did you get here, Hi!

line: Penny is wearing the worst Catwoman costume I have ever seen, and that includes Halle Berry's.

line: She's not Catwoman, she's just a generic cat.

line: Hey guys, check out the sexy nurse. I believe it's time for me to turn my head and cough.

line: Where do you get this stuff?

name: Howard

line: Oh, if only I had his confidence. I have such difficulty speaking to women. Or around women. Or at times, even effeminate men.

name: Howard
line: If that's a working stethoscope, maybe you'd like to hear my heart skip a beat.

name: Nurse Costume Girl
line: No thanks.

name: Howard
line: No, seriously, you can, I have transient idiopathic arrhythmia.

name: Leonard
line: I  want to get to know Penny's friends, I just, I don't know how to talk to these people.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, I actually might be able to help.

name: Leonard

name: Sheldon
line: Like Jane Goodall observing the apes, I initially saw their interactions as confusing and unstructured, but patterns emerge, they have their own language if you will.

name: Leonard
line: Go on.

line: Well, it seems that the newcomer approaches the existing group with the greeting “How wasted am I?” which is met with an approving chorus of “Dude.”

line: Hi.

line: Hello.

name: Sheldon
line: Neeeeeooooowwwwww!

name: Sheldon
line: I'm the Doppler Effect.

line: Okay, if that is some sort of learning disability, I think it's very insensitive.

line: Why don't you just tell people you're a zebra?

line: Well, why don't you just tell people you're one of the seven dwarves.

name: Leonard
line: Because I'm Frodo.

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, well, I'm the Doppler Effect.

name: Leonard
line: Oh no.

name: Sheldon
line: What?

name: Leonard
line: That's Penny's ex-boyfriend.

name: Sheldon
line: What do you suppose he's doing here? Besides disrupting the local gravity field.

name: Leonard
line: If he were any bigger, he'd have moons orbiting him.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, snap. So I guess we'll be leaving now.

name: Leonard
line: Why should we leave? For all we know, he crashed the party and Penny doesn't even want him here. .

name: Sheldon
line: You have a back-up hypothesis.

name: Leonard
line: Maybe they just want to be friends.

name: Sheldon
line: Or maybe she wants to be friends, and he wants something more.

name: Leonard
line: Then he and I are on equal ground.

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, but you're much closer to it than he is.

name: Leonard
line: Look, if this was 15,000 years ago, by virtue of his size and strength, Kurt would be entitled to his choice of female partners.

line: And male partners. Animal partners. Large primordial eggplants, pretty much whatever tickled his fancy.

name: Leonard
line: Yes, but our society has undergone a paradigm shift, in the information age, Sheldon, you and I are the alpha males. We shouldn't have to back down.

line: True. Why don't you text him that and see if he backs down?

name: Leonard
line: No. I'm going to assert my dominance face to face.

name: Sheldon
line: Face to face? Are you going to wait for him to sit down, or are you going to stand on a coffee table?

name: Leonard
line: Hello Penny. Hello Kurt.

name: Penny
line: Oh, hey guys. You having a good time?

name: Sheldon
line: Given the reaction to my costume, this party is a scathing indictment of the American education system.

name: Kurt
line: What, you're a zebra, right?

line: No, I'm a Hobbit.

name: Kurt

line: Uh, a Hobbit is a mortal Halfling inhabitant of Middle Earth, whereas an Elf is an immortal tall warrior.

line: So why the hell would you want to be a Hobbit?

line: Because he is neither tall nor immortal, and none of us could be The Flash.

name: Kurt
line: Well, whatever, why don't you go hop off on a quest, I'm talking to Penny here.

line: I think we're all talking to Penny here.

line: I'm not. No offence.

name: Kurt
line: Okay, maybe you didn't hear me, go away.

line: Alright Kurt, be nice.

line: Aw, I am being nice. Right little buddy.

name: Penny
line: Kurt!

name: Leonard
line: Okay, I understand your impulse to try to physically intimidate me. I mean, you can't compete with me on an intellectual level and so you're driven to animalistic puffery.

line: Of course not, no, he's not, you're not, right Leonard?

line: No, I said animalistic. Of course we're all animals, but some of us have climbed a little higher on the evolutionary tree.

name: Kurt

name: Sheldon
line: You're in trouble.

line: You know, you use a lot of big words for such a little dwarf.

line: Okay, Kurt, please.

name: Leonard
line: No, Penny, it's okay, I can handle this. I'm not a dwarf, I'm a Hobbit. A Hobbit. Are misfiring neurons in your hippocampus preventing the conversion from short-term to long-term memory?

name: Kurt
line: Okay, now you're starting to make me mad.

name: Leonard
line: A homo-habilus discovering his opposable thumbs says what?

name: Kurt
line: What?

name: Leonard
line: I think I've made my point.

name: Kurt
line: Yeah, how about I make a point out of your pointy little head.

name: Sheldon
line: Let me remind you, while my moral support is absolute, in a physical confrontation I will be less than useless.

line: There's not going to be a confrontation, in fact I doubt if he can even spell confrontation.

name: Kurt
line: C - O - N... frontation!

name: Penny
line: Kurt, put him down this instant.

name: Kurt
line: He started it.

name: Penny
line: I don't care, I'm finishing it, put him down.

name: Kurt
line: Fine. You're one lucky little leprechaun.

name: Sheldon
line: He's a Hobbit! I've got your back.

name: Penny
line: Leonard, are you okay.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, no, I'm fine. It's good, it's a good party, thanks for having us, it's just getting a little late so....

name: Penny
line: Oh, okay, alright, well thank you for coming.

name: Sheldon
line: Happy Halloween.  If it's any consolation, I thought that homo-habilus line really put him in his place.

line: Ooh, I don't think so. No, anecdotal evidence suggests that in the game of rock-paper-scissors, players familiar with each other will tie 75 to 80% of the time due to the limited number of outcomes. I suggest rock-paper-scissors- lizard-Spock.

line: Hello. Hey, Howard. What's wrong? Okay. Okay, we'll be right there.

name: Sheldon
line: What happened?

name: Leonard
line: Howard's at the Mars Rover lab. He says he's in trouble. Defcon 5.

name: Sheldon
line: Defcon 5? Well, there's no need to rush.

name: Leonard
line: What?

name: Sheldon
line: Defcon 5 means no danger. Defcon 1 is a crisis.

name: Leonard
line: How can 5 not be worse than 1?

name: Raj
line: Yeah, Star Trek V, worse than I.

name: Sheldon
line: Okay, first of all, that's a comparison of quality, not intensity. Secondly, Star Trek I is orders-of-magnitude worse than Star Trek V.

name: Raj
line: Are you joking? Star Trek V is the standard against which all badness is measured.

name: Sheldon
line: No, no, no. Star Trek V has specific failures in writing and direction, while Star Trek I fails across the board, art direction, costuming, music, sound editing.

name: Leonard
line: Can we just forget I said Defcon and go?

name: Raj
line: Star Trek V!

name: Raj
line: I have three words for you. Wrath of Khan.

name: Howard
line: Oh, thank God, you're here.

name: Leonard
line: What's the emergency?

name: Howard
line: I got the Mars Rover stuck in a ditch.

name: Sheldon
line: Where?

name: Howard
line: On a dusty highway just outside Bakersfield. Where do you think? On Mars!

name: Woman
line: Howard, is everything okay?

name: Howard
line: Yeah, baby, I'll be right in.

name: Sheldon
line: You brought a girl to the Mars Rover control room?

name: Howard
line: Yeah, I picked her up in the bar. She's a doctor. One free barium enema and my mother won't care she's not Jewish.

name: Leonard
line: Wait a minute, so the eye patch and the insults worked?

name: Howard
line: No, there were three other guys with eye patches, iIt was a fiasco. What did work was, “How'd you like to visit a secret government facility?”

name: Sheldon
line: So what exactly do you want us to do?

name: Howard
line: I need you and Raj to help me get the Rover out of the ditch, and I need you to get Stephanie out before somebody notices she's here. She doesn't exactly have clearance.

name: Sheldon
line: Really? They don't let strange women from honky-tonks come in and play with $200million government projects on distant planets?

name: Howard
line: Yes, I was bad. Maybe she'll spank me. Can we please move on?

name: Girl
line: Hey, Howard, you know, it's getting late, so do I get to drive this thing or what?

name: Howard
line: Yeah. No. I'm sorry, but something's come up. Kind of a Mars Rover, Mars Rover, can Howard come over, situation. So my friend Leonard is gonna take you home.

name: Girl
line: Oh, okay. Let's go, friend Leonard.

name: Leonard
line: Okay.

name: Howard
line: I'll call ya.

name: Girl
line: Yeah. So are you a scientist like Howard?

name: Leonard
line: No one's a scientist like Howard.

name: Howard
line: My mother is so gonna love her.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, how nice. Maybe they can carpool when they visit you in federal prison.

name: Girl
line: I'm sorry. I totally interrupted you. What, what, what were you saying?

name: Leonard
line: Just said Howard's a terrific guy. He's got a great sense of humour, he loves his mother, a lot, some people say too much.

name: Girl
line: I really like that you're such a loyal friend.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, I am loyal. You know, if you look at the big picture. Just, out of curiosity, did he ever have a shot with you?

name: Girl
line: Are you insane? The guy was wearing an eye patch.

name: Leonard
line: Then why did you?

name: Girl
line: He said that I could drive a car on Mars.

name: Leonard
line: Got it. So, can I see you again?

name: Girl
line: You're not gonna see me now.

name: Leonard
line: Ooh. Cool.

name: Howard
line: Anything?

name: Raj
line: Actually, I was just checking my e-mail. But, uh, no, the Rover is not responding.

name: Sheldon
line: I believe the appropriate metaphor here involves a river of excrement and a Native American water vessel without any means of propulsion.

name: Howard
line: Hang on, there's got to be other options.

name: Raj
line: You could try calling Triple-A, but based on NASA's latest timetable, they won't get there for 35 years.

name: Sheldon
line: Plus I understand you have to be standing next to the vehicle with your card when they arrive.

name: Raj
line: Oh, snap.

name: Sheldon
line: Snap what?

name: Howard
line: OK, I guess we have to turn to Plan B.

name: Raj
line: What's Plan B?

name: Howard
line: Erase all the hard drives, scrap the surveillance tapes, wipe our fingerprints off every surface and run.

name: Sheldon
line: Why wasn't that Plan A?

name: Howard
line: Thank God for Plan B.

name: Penny
line: Howard, didn't you say you worked on the Mars Rover?

name: Howard
line: No, you're mistaken.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, when we first met, you said that if I went out with you, I could drive a car on Mars.

name: Howard
line: I don't know what you're talking about.

name: Leonard
line: Psst! Psst!

name: Sheldon
line: Will you all excuse me? Leonard is subtly signalling that he'd like to talk to me in private.

name: Penny
line: No. Yeah, I remember specifically. You started by asking if I was from Mars because my ass was out of this world.

name: Howard
line: Well, that does sound like me, but no.

name: Sheldon
line: Is there some problem?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah. Listen, I have to kinda sneak out for a while.

name: Sheldon
line: All right, goodbye.

name: Leonard
line: No, wait! If anyone asks you where I went, you don't know.

name: Sheldon
line: Where are you going?

name: Leonard
line: I can't tell you that.

name: Sheldon
line: Who would ask me?

name: Leonard
line: I can't tell you that, either.

name: Sheldon
line: So you brought me in here to inform me that you can't tell me where you're going and you can't tell me who might ask?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, I really didn't think this through.

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard, a moment.

name: Leonard
line: What?

name: Sheldon
line: If someone, and of course, we don't know who this would be, does ask where you've gone, what should I say?

name: Leonard
line: I don't know. Just tell them I went to the office.

name: Sheldon
line: Are you going to the office?

name: Leonard
line: No.

name: Sheldon
line: Then how can I say it convincingly?

name: Leonard
line: Just say, Leonard went to the office.

name: Sheldon
line: All right. Leonard went to  the office.

name: Leonard
line: What is? No, not like that! Just, Leonard went to the office.

name: Sheldon
line: This would have worked out a lot better if you'd just told me you were going the office.

name: Leonard
line: I'm going to the office.

name: Sheldon
line: See? Why don't I believe you?

name: Leonard
line: I'm going out for a while.

name: Howard
line: Okay.

name: Sheldon
line: Doesn't anyone want to know where he's going?

name: Penny
line: Okay, where is he going?

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard is going to  the office.

name: Leonard
line: So how was work today?

name: Girl
line: Busy. I removed an appendix, a gall bladder and about a foot and a half of bowel.

name: Leonard
line: I'm hoping that's three different guys.

name: Girl
line: No, just the one. He didn't make it. So, how was your day?

name: Leonard
line: Oh, you know, I'm a physicist, so, I thought about stuff.

name: Girl
line: That's it?

name: Leonard
line: Well, I wrote some of it down.

name: Girl
line: Are you done eating?

name: Leonard
line: Uh, yeah.

name: Girl
line: Oh, good.

name: Leonard
line: If I knew you were waiting, I would've swallowed that lasagna whole.

name: Phone rings. Answering machine
line: You've reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message. Beep.

name: Howard
line: Hey, Steph, it's me again, Howard. Listen, if you're free Friday, maybe we could have a little something to eat at my place. My mom cooks a hell of a brisket. Let me know. It's Howard.

name: Leonard
line: I've had her brisket. Melts in your mouth.

name: Steph
line: Maybe we should think about going to the bedroom.

name: Leonard
line: That's a good idea. There's a bed in there, and I'm very, very, very pro-bed.

name: Phone rings. Answering machine
line: You've reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message. Beep.

name: Howard
line: Hey, it's me again. Just want to let you know the head count for dinner Friday has gone up. My Aunt Betty and Uncle Elliot are coming in from Palm Springs. Oh, and if anybody should ask, you're half-Jewish on your mother's side. Okay, call me. It's Howard.

name: Leonard
line: Don't you think we should tell him you're not interested?

name: Steph
line: Do you want me to stop and call him back right now?

name: Leonard
line: Dear God, no!

name: Steph
line: Oh, Leonard...

name: Phone rings. Answering machine
line: You've reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message. Beep.

name: Howard
line: Hey, it's me again. Howard. Listen, my cousins from Fort Lauderdale are flying in to meet you so that means we're gonna have to move the dinner to a restaurant.

name: Howard's Mother
line: Tell her we're going to the Olive Garden! I have a coupon from the paper.

name: Howard
line: We're not going to the Olive Garden, Mom!

name: Howard's Mother
line: Oh, Mr. Bigshot with his Red Lobster.

name: Howard
line: I'll call you back when we firm up the details. It's Howard.

name: Penny
line: Oh, hey.

name: Leonard
line: Hey.

name: Penny
line: New shirts?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, a couple.

name: Penny
line: Nice.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you.

name: Penny
line: So, who's the girl?

name: Leonard
line: I'm sorry?

name: Penny
line: Well, last time you bought a new shirt was when we were dating.

name: Leonard
line: So, uh, what we did was in fact dating?

name: Penny
line: Well, yeah, we did have a date.

name: Leonard
line: Exactly. Thank you. Do me a favour, tell Koothrappali that next time you see him.

name: Penny
line: So, who is she?

name: Leonard
line: Oh, she's a doctor.

name: Penny
line: Oh, nice. A doctor doctor, or a you kind of doctor?

name: Leonard
line: Doctor doctor. Surgical resident. Smart, pretty. Let me ask you something. If your friend thinks he's dating someone, but he's not because, in fact, you're dating her, does that make you a bad person?

name: Penny
line: Well, that depends.

name: Leonard
line: On what?

name: Penny
line: Is that friend Wolowitz?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah.

name: Penny
line: Screw him. You're fine.

name: Leonard
line: Are you sure?

name: Penny
line: Well, have you slept with her yet? You dog! Good for you.

name: Leonard
line: Does that change things?

name: Penny
line: No.

name: Leonard
line: So why'd you ask?

name: Penny
line: I'm nosy. See ya.

name: Howard's Mother
line: Howard, get the door!

name: Howard
line: Really? Is that what you do when someone knocks? Thank you. I had no idea!  Hey, buddy. What brings you to my little slice of hell?

name: Howard's Mother
line: Who is it?!

name: Howard
line: It's Leonard!

name: Howard's Mother
line: You're gonna have to play outside! I'm not dressed to receive!

name: Howard
line: No one cares, Ma! So, what's up?

name: Leonard
line: Listen, I need to talk to you about something.

name: Howard
line: Momentito. Yello. Oh, Stephanie, thanks for calling me back. I was worried... Oh... Uh-huh... Uh-huh... Uh-huh... No, I understand... Sure, we can be friends. Absolutely. Thanks for calling. Yeah, you have a nice day, too.  You are dead to me.

name: Raj
line: Okay, who gets the extra dumpling?

name: All
line: Rock-paper-scissors- lizard-Spock.

name: Sheldon
line: Okay, one of us is going to have to stop putting up Spock.

name: Howard
line: How do we decide that?

name: All
line: Rock-paper-scissors-lizard-Spock. Oh!

name: Leonard
line: Oh, hey, guys.

name: Sheldon
line: Hello.

name: Raj
line: Hey.

name: Leonard
line: Hi, Howard. Howard?

name: Howard
line: Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Howard is employing a schoolyard paradigm in which you are, for all intents and purposes, deceased. He intends to act on this by not speaking to you, feigning an inability to hear you when you speak and otherwise refusing to acknowledge your existence.

name: Leonard
line: That's just ridiculous. Why are you cooperating with him?

name: Sheldon
line: I don't make the rules, Leonard.

name: Leonard
line: Howard, come on, I didn't plan on this. These things just happen. Usually not to me, but they do happen.

name: Howard
line: Did someone just feel a cold breeze?

name: Sheldon
line: I believe this is an extension of the death metaphor. The cold breeze is the so-called ectoplasmic issue of a disembodied soul passing by.

name: Raj
line: You know, screw it, I'm just gonna eat the dumpling.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, hi, Steph, come on in.

name: Steph
line: Is this a bad time?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, but I don't see a better one on the horizon, so...

name: Howard
line: Oh, if it isn't Mrs. Dead to Me.

name: Steph
line: Hello, Howard.

name: Howard
line: Sheldon?

name: Sheldon
line: Look I'm sorry, you violated the terms of your metaphor by acknowledging her existence. I'm out.

name: Leonard
line: He just won't listen to me.

name: Steph
line: Okay, I guess it'll just be the three of us then.

name: Leonard
line: Hmm. Lisa's gonna be disappointed.

name: Steph
line: Yeah.

name: Howard
line: Lisa?

name: Steph
line: Yeah, my roommate. She just went through a really bad breakup and I thought she might like to meet somebody fun like you.

name: Howard
line: Leonard, Stephanie, you're alive, it's a miracle!

name: Howard
line: So, anyway, Lisa, I just wanted to tell you again how much I enjoyed the other night, and again, I'm sorry for how it ended. But again, if you could let me know about Friday. My mother needs a head count so she can know how big a brisket to get.

name: Leonard
line: Howard, Howard, look at this.

name: Howard
line: Anyway, call me. It's Howard.

name: Voice from TV
line: The possibility of life on Mars has long fascinated scientists and laypersons alike. It's unclear how the Mars Rover got into the crevice, but one thing's certain, the data which it has sent back contain the first clear indications that there may have been life on Mars. It's a scientific discovery that has staggering implications for all mankind. Unfortunately, we'll never know who's responsible.

name: Howard
line: Son of a bitch.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, the X10s are online.

name: Howard
line: Gentlemen, I am now about to send a signal from this laptop through our local ISP, racing down fibre-optic cable at the speed of light to San Francisco, bouncing off a satellite in geosynchronous orbit to Lisbon, Portugal, where the data packets will be handed off to submerged transatlantic cables terminating in Halifax, Nova-Scotia, and transferred across the continent via microwave relays back to our ISP and the X10 receiver attached to this  lamp. .

name: Sheldon
line: Look at me, look at me, I've got goosebumps.

name: Howard
line: Are we ready on the stereo?

name: Raj
line: Go for stereo.

name: Penny
line: Hey guys.

name: All
line: Hello.

name: Penny
line: It's a little loud.

name: Howard
line: No problem, turning it down.  San Francisco, Lisbon, Halifax  et voila.

name: Penny
line: Okay, thanks.

name: Leonard
line: Hang on, hang on, do you not realise what we just did.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, you turned your stereo down with your laptop.

name: Sheldon
line: No, we turned our stereo down by sending a signal around the world via the internet.

name: Penny
line: Oh. You know you can just get one of those universal remotes at Radio Shack, they're really cheap.

name: Leonard
line: No, no, no, you don't get it, um, Howard, enable public access.

name: Howard
line: Public access enabled.

name: Penny
line: Boy, that's brilliant, but I'll see you.

name: Leonard
line: No, hang on, hang on.  See!

name: Penny
line: No.

name: Sheldon
line: Someone in Sezchuan province, China is using his computer to turn our lights on and off.

name: Penny
line: Huh, well that's handy. Um, here's a question, why?

name: All together
line: Because we can.

name: Sheldon
line: They found the remote controlled cars.

name: Penny
line: Well, wait, wait, what's on top of them.

name: Leonard
line: Wireless webcams, wave hello.

name: Howard
line: The monster truck is out of Austin, Texas, and the blue Viper is being operated from suburban Tel Aviv.

name: Sheldon
line: You may want to put on slacks.

name: Penny
line: What?  Ew, stop it, no, leave me alone.

name: Leonard
line: Who's running the red Corvette?

name: Howard
line: That would be me.

name: Sheldon
line: You know, in the future, when we're disembodied brains in jars, we're going to look back on this as eight hours well wasted.

name: Raj
line: I don't want to be in a jar. I want my brain in an android body. Eight feet tall and ripped.

name: Howard
line: I'm with you. I just have to make sure if I'm a synthetic human I'd still be Jewish. I promised my mother.

name: Raj
line: I suppose you could have your android penis circumcised. But that's something your Rabbi would have to discuss with the manufacturers.

name: Sheldon
line: Not to mention you'd have to power down on Saturdays.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, why is this letter in the trash?

name: Sheldon
line: Well, there's always the possibility that a trash can spontaneously formed around the letter, but Occam's Razor would suggest that someone threw it out.

name: Leonard
line: It's from the Institute for Experimental Physics. They want us to present our paper on the properties of super solids at the topical conference on Bowes-Einstein condensates.

name: Sheldon
line: I know. I read it before I threw it out.

name: Leonard
line: Okay... if I may drill down to the bedrock of my question, why did you throw it out.

name: Sheldon
line: Because I have no interest in standing in the Rose Room of the Pasadena Marriott in front of a group of judgemental strangers, who wouldn't recognise true genius if it were standing in front of them giving a speech. Which, if I were there, it would be.

name: Howard
line: I don't know, Sheldon, those topical conferences on Bowes-Einstein condensates parties are legendary.

name: Leonard
line: Forget the parties.

name: Howard
line: Forget the parties? What a nerd.

name: Leonard
line: Are there any other honours I've gotten that I don't know about? Did UPS drop off a Nobel Prize with my name on it?

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard, please don't take this the wrong way, but the day you win a Nobel Prize, is the day I begin my research on the drag co-efficient of tassles on flying carpets.

name: Raj
line: Hoo-hoo-hoo. The only thing missing from that insult was “yo mamma.”

name: Howard
line: I've got one, hey Leonard, your mamma's research methodology is so flawed....

name: Leonard
line: Shut up, Howard. Sheldon, we have to do this.

name: Sheldon
line: No we don't. We have to take in nourishment, expel waste, and inhale enough oxygen to keep ourselves from dying, everything else is optional.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, let me put it this way, I'm doing it.

name: Sheldon
line: You can't. I'm the lead author.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, come on. The only reason you're the lead author is because we went alphabetically.

name: Sheldon
line: I let you think we went alphabetically to spare you the humiliation of dealing with the fact that it was my idea. Not to put too fine a point on it, but I was throwing you a bone. You're welcome.

name: Leonard
line: Excuse me, I designed the experiment that proved the hypothesis.

name: Sheldon
line: It doesn't need proving.

name: Leonard
line: So the entire scientific community is just supposed to take your word?

name: Sheldon
line: They're not supposed to, but they should.

name: Leonard
line: Alright, I don't care what you say, I'm going to the conference and I'm presenting our findings.

name: Sheldon
line: And I forbid it.

name: Leonard
line: You forbid it?

name: Sheldon
line: If I'm not taking credit for our work then nobody is.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, you admit that it's our work.

name: Sheldon
line: No, once again, I'm throwing you a bone. And once again, you are welcome.

name: Leonard
line: Ah!

name: Howard
line: Oh no he dit'nt!

name: Penny
line: So, how's it going with Sheldon, are you guys still not talking to each other?

name: Leonard
line: Not only is he still not talking to me, but there's this thing he does where he stares at you and tries to get your brain to explode. You know, like in the classic sci-fi movie Scanners?  You know, bzzz-pchew! Never mind. How about this one. It says, “I know my physics, but I'm still a fun guy!”

name: Penny
line: Oh, hey, I didn't know they still made corduroy suits!

name: Leonard
line: They don't, that's why I saved this one.

name: Penny
line: Okay, well, let's just see what else you have. Okay, here, take this, and this, and this, and these.

name: Leonard
line: Is this all stuff you want me to try on?

name: Penny
line: No, this is stuff I want you to throw out.

name: Leonard
line: Oh.

name: Penny
line: Seriously, don't even give it to charity, you won't be helping anyone. What's this.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, that's the bottled city of Kandor.

name: Penny
line: Uh-huh.

name: Leonard
line: You see, Kandor was the capital city of the planet Krypton, it was miniaturised by Brainiac before Krypton exploded and then rescued by Superman.

name: Penny
line: Oh, nice.

name: Leonard
line: It's a lot cooler when girls aren't looking at it.

name: Penny
line: Here, why don't you put these on while I find a shirt and sport-coat to match.

name: Leonard
line: Great, be right back.

name: Penny
line: Well, where you going, just put them on.

name: Leonard
line: Here?

name: Penny
line: Oh, are you shy?

name: Leonard
line: No, I'm not shy.

name: Penny
line: Don't worry, I won't look.

name: Leonard
line: I know you won't look, why would you look, there's nothing to see, well, not nothing....

name: Penny
line: Sweetie, put the pants on.

name: Leonard
line: Putting them on.

name: Penny
line: So, you know, isn't there maybe some way you and Sheldon could compromise on this whole presentation thing.

name: Leonard
line: No. No. Scientists do not compromise. Our minds are trained to synthesise facts and come to inarguable conclusions. Not to mention, Sheldon is batcrap crazy.

name: Penny
line: What is this?

name: Leonard
line: Oh, careful. That's my original series Battlestar Galactica flight suit.

name: Penny
line: Oh, why didn't you wear it at Halloween?

name: Leonard
line: Because it's not a costume, it's a flight suit.

name: Penny
line: Okay, alright, moving on, oh, wow, a paisley shirt.

name: Leonard
line: Uh-huh, it goes with my corduroy suit.

name: Penny
line: If you mean it should end up in the same place then, I agree. Is this your... your only tie?

name: Leonard
line: Ah. Technically yes, but, if you'll notice, it's reversible. So it works as two.

name: Penny
line: Oh, sweetie, I don't think it even works as one. Is this all your clothes?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah. Everything since the eighth grade.

name: Penny
line: The... the eighth grade?

name: Leonard
line: My last growth spurt.

name: Penny
line: Okay, well, I guess we're back to the corduroy suit.

name: Leonard
line: Great.

name: Penny
line: Yup.  I said no, put it down.

name: Penny
line: Hey Sheldon!

name: Sheldon
line: Hello Penny.

name: Penny
line: Get anything good?

name: Sheldon
line: Uh, just the latest copy of Applied Particle Physics Quarterly.

name: Penny
line: Oh, you know, that is so weird that yours came and mine didn't. . It was a joke.  Yup, tip your waitresses, I'm here all week.

name: Sheldon
line: Penny, just to save you from further awkwardness know that I'm perfectly comfortable with the two of us climbing the stairs in silence.

name: Penny
line: Oh yeah, me too. Zip it, lock it.  Put it in your pocket. So you and Leonard...

name: Sheldon
line: Oh dear God!

name: Penny
line: Little misunderstanding, huh.

name: Sheldon
line: A little misunder.... Galileo and the Pope had a little misunderstanding.

name: Penny
line: Anyway, I was talking to Leonard this morning and I think he feels really bad about it.

name: Sheldon
line: Huh.

name: Penny
line: Well how do you feel?

name: Sheldon
line: I don't understand the question.

name: Penny
line: Well I'm just asking if it's difficult to be fighting with your best friend.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh. I hadn't thought about it like that. I wonder if I've been experiencing physiological manifestations of some sort of unconscious emotional turmoil.

name: Penny
line: Wait... what?

name: Sheldon
line: I couldn't poop this morning.

name: Penny
line: You should just talk to him, I'm sure you guys can work this out.

name: Sheldon
line: It's certainly preferable to my plan.

name: Penny
line: Which was?

name: Sheldon
line: A powerful laxative.

name: Penny
line: Okay, so you absolutely should talk to him, look, I know Leonard values you as a friend, and he told me himself that without your little idea there's no way he could have come up with this whole experiment thing.

name: Sheldon
line: Excuse me, little idea?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, I mean he tried to explain it to me, I didn't really understand it but...

name: Sheldon
line: Of course you didn't, he said little idea?

name: Penny
line: Uh, well no, no, not in... not in those words.

name: Sheldon
line: In what words then, exactly

name: Penny
line: Um, gee, the exact words aren't written... it's more the spirit in which it's

line: What did he say?

line: You had a lucky hunch.

line: Hey, Sheldon, I've been thinking, instead of arguing about this why don't....

line: Don't you ever speak to me again.

name: Leonard
line: What... .

name: Penny
line: Uh, he... .

line: Okay, I'm leaving for the conference.

name: Sheldon
line: Have fun presenting my lucky hunch.

line: Sheldon I didn't mean it like that.

line: So, in conclusion, the data show that at temperatures approaching absolute zero, the moment of inertia changes, and the solid becomes a super-solid, which clearly appears to be a previously unknown state of matter.  Thank you.  Are there any questions?

name: Sheldon
line: Doctor Sheldon Cooper here, I am the lead author of this particular paper.  Thank you. And you, sir, you have completely skipped over the part where I was walking through the park, and I saw these children on a merry-go-round, which started me thinking about the moment of inertia in gasses like helium at temperatures approaching absolute zero.

line: I've had enough of your condescension. Maybe I didn't go to college when I was eleven like you, maybe I got my doctorate at 24 instead of 16, but you are not the only person who is smarter than everyone else in this room. No offense. And I am clearly not the only person who is tormented by insecurity and has an ego in need of constant validation.

line: Secret keeping is a complicated endeavour. line: Your argument is lacking in all scientific merit. It is well established Superman cleans his uniform by flying into Earth's yellow sun, which incinerates any contaminate matter and leaves the invulnerable Kryptonian fabric unharmed and daisy fresh.
