name: Raj
line: He almost made it to the top this time.

name: Leonard
line: Hmmm.

name: Sheldon
line: The problem appears to be unsolvable.

name: Raj
line: Maybe you could run some computer simulations.

name: Howard
line: There are too many variables. It would take forever.

name: Sheldon
line: Right, these theatres have to be eliminated.

name: Leonard
line: Why? They're state-of-the-art digital projection, 20-channel surround sound.

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, but they have no Icee machines. Despite my aggressive letter-writing campaign, I might add.

name: Raj
line: What about the multiplex here? The seats are terrific.

name: Sheldon
line: They have Twizzlers instead of Red Vines. No amount of lumbar support can compensate for that.

name: Leonard
line: Well, it's gonna take at least an hour to eat, and I don't see a Sheldon-approved restaurant proximate to a Sheldon-approved theatre.

name: Raj
line: We could eat after the movie.

name: Sheldon
line: Unacceptable, the delay would result in tomorrow morning's bowel movement occurring at work.

name: Raj
line: Hang on, hang on. There's a 7-Eleven here. We smuggle Slurpies, which are essentially Icees, in under our coats, after having a pleasant meal either here, here or here.

name: Howard
line: Wow. I don't see how we missed that.

name: Sheldon
line: Excuse me, in what universe are Slurpies Icees?

name: Raj
line: That's how we missed it.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, would you be prepared, on a non-precedential basis, to create an emergency ad-hoc Slurpie-Icee equivalency?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, Leonard, you know I can't do that.

name: Howard
line: Okay, I guess we only have one option.

name: Raj
line: Yep, I don't see any way around it.

name: Leonard
line: Bye, Sheldon.

name: Howard
line: See ya.

name: Raj
line: Later, dude.

name: Sheldon
line: They're right, it was the only option.

name: Penny
line: Ooh, ooh, shut the door, shut the door.

name: Sheldon
line: Why?

name: Penny
line: Just do it!  Get inside and shut the door.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, you didn't specify.

name: Penny
line: Is Leonard around?

name: Sheldon
line: He went to the movies without me. It was the only option. I'm sorry, I don't understand which social situation this is. Could you give me some guidance as to how to proceed?

name: Penny
line: The building manager's showing an apartment downstairs, and I haven't paid my rent.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, I see. Penny, I'm not sure I'm comfortable harbouring a fugitive from the 2311 North Los Robles Corporation.

name: Penny
line: It's no big deal. I'm just a little behind on my bills because they cut back my hours at the restaurant and my car broke down.

name: Sheldon
line: If you recall, I pointed out the “check engine” light to you several months ago.

name: Penny
line: Well the “check engine” light is fine. It's still blinking away. It's the stupid engine that stopped working. It cost me like twelve hundred dollars to fix it.

name: Sheldon
line: You know, it occurs to me you could solve all your problems by obtaining more money.

name: Penny
line: Yes, it occurs to me, too.

name: Sheldon
line: Hang on a moment.  Here. Take some. Pay me back when you can.

name: Penny
line: Wow, you got a lot of money in there.

name: Sheldon
line: That's why it's guarded by snakes. Take some.

name: Penny
line: Don't be silly.

name: Sheldon
line: I'm never silly. Here.

name: Penny
line: No, I can't.

name: Sheldon
line: Don't you need money?

name: Penny
line: Well, yeah, but...

name: Sheldon
line: This is money I'm not using.

name: Penny
line: But what if you need it?

name: Sheldon
line: My expenses account for 46.9% of my after-tax income. The rest is divvied up between a small savings account, this deceptive container of peanut brittle and the hollowed-out buttocks of a superhero action figure who shall remain nameless for his own protection. Or her own protection. Take some.

name: Penny
line: Really? I mean, are you sure?

name: Sheldon
line: I see no large upcoming expenditures unless they develop an affordable technology to fuse my skeleton with adamantium like Wolverine.

name: Penny
line: Are they working on that?

name: Sheldon
line: I sincerely hope so.

name: Penny
line: Okay. Well, thank you. Oh, God, no, I can't. Sheldon honey, I don't want things to be weird between us.

name: Sheldon
line: Won't it also be weird if I have to say hello to you every morning on my way to work and you're living in a refrigerator box and washing your hair with rain water?

name: Penny
line: I'll pay you back as soon as I can.

name: Sheldon
line: Of course you will. It's impossible to pay me back sooner than you can. Assuming you subscribe to a linear understanding of time and causality.

name: Penny
line: I'm regretting this already.

name: Sheldon
line: You know, I've given the matter some thought, and I think I'd be willing to be a house pet to a race of super-intelligent aliens.

name: Leonard
line: Interesting.

name: Sheldon
line: Ask me why.

name: Leonard
line: Do I have to?

name: Sheldon
line: Of course. That's how you move a conversation forward.

name: Leonard
line: Why?

name: Sheldon
line: The learning opportunities would be abundant. Additionally, I like having my belly scratched.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, Penny. How was work?

name: Penny
line: Great. I hope I'm a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory for my whole life.

name: Sheldon
line: Was that sarcasm?

name: Penny
line: No.

name: Sheldon
line: Was that sarcasm?

name: Penny
line: Yes.

name: Sheldon
line: Was that sarca..

name: Leonard
line: Stop it!

name: Sheldon
line: Penny, you appear to have a package here.

name: Penny
line: Oh, thanks. This must be the beret I ordered. A couple of months ago. It was back-ordered.

name: Sheldon
line: Did you know the beret is an example of piece of women's fashion adapted from male military uniforms? Another fascinating example is the epaulet.

name: Leonard
line: He's not lying, he does find that fascinating.

name: Penny
line: Okay, whatever. It's not like I'm running up and down the streets just buying myself berets. I bought one, like, a month ago, and it was back-ordered, look, it finally arrived, all right?

name: Sheldon
line: All right.

name: Penny
line: Oh, my God, would you just get off my case?

name: Leonard
line: Weird.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, good, that was an unusual interaction. I wasn't sure.

name: Leonard
line: Did you guys have an argument?

name: Sheldon
line: No.

name: Leonard
line: Well, you clearly did something to aggravate her.

name: Sheldon
line: I'm at a loss. If you like, you can review my daily log of social interactions and see if there's a blunder I overlooked.

name: Leonard
line: Here you go. Oh, you owe me another two dollars. The price of mu-shu pork went up.

name: Howard
line: It's getting tougher and tougher to be a bad Jew.

name: Leonard
line: Here you go, Penny. Shrimp with lobster sauce.

name: Penny
line: Thank you, Leonard. What's my share?

name: Leonard
line: Don't worry about it. It's my treat.

name: Penny
line: No, really, how much?

name: Leonard
line: It's, whatever. Ten, eleven dollars.

name: Penny
line: Well, which is it, ten or eleven?

name: Leonard
line: Fourteen fifty, but it's no biggie, you'll get the next one.

name: Penny
line: What?

name: Howard
line: He was just wondering if he wore skintight jeans and a tank top if he'd get his shrimp lo mein for free.

name: Penny
line: What are you saying? That I'm using my body to get dinner? That I'm some kind of Chinese food prostitute?

name: Howard
line: Yeah, Raj, what are you saying?

name: Penny
line: ‘Cause let me tell you something, buddy, I pay my own way in this world, okay? I don't rely on anybody!  What was that about?

name: Howard
line: He has a nervous bladder when he's stressed out. Kind of like a puppy.

name: Penny
line: Here, Leonard, ten, eleven, twelve, uh, fourteen dollars.

name: Leonard
line: It was fourteen fifty, but it's okay.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, good. Dinner's here.

name: Penny
line: Yes, dinner's here, and I'm having some. I'm having takeout food.

name: Sheldon
line: Okay.

name: Penny
line: You're damn right it's okay. I've been having leftovers at the restaurant for like four days, and I wanted something different. So sue me.

name: Sheldon
line: Forgive me, Penny, but that would be the very definition of a frivolous lawsuit.

name: Penny
line: Sheldon, look, I will pay you back as soon as I can. You just have to give me more time.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, wait, you lent her money?

name: Penny
line: She needed money. You seem under pressure. Did I not lend you a sufficient amount? Because I can give you more.

name: Penny
line: Oh, you know, you would just love that, wouldn't you? Yeah. You would just love to open up your little snake can and throw some money at the girl who can't pay her bills.

name: Leonard
line: Where are you going?

name: Penny
line: Going home, where I won't be interrogated like a criminal. I forgot my fortune cookie.

name: Sheldon
line: In case either of you have larceny in your heart, you should know that I've moved my money out of the snake can.

name: Leonard
line: But if you're ever short, there's always a couple of fifties in Green Lantern's ass.

name: Leonard
line: Hey.

name: Penny
line: Hey.

name: Leonard
line: A little mood lighting, huh?

name: Penny
line: Yeah. When I didn't pay my bill, the Department of Water and Power thought I would enjoy the ambience.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, they're very considerate that way.

name: Penny
line: I used Sheldon's money to pay my rent, then I had like fourteen dollars left over.

name: Leonard
line: Fourteen dollars, huh?

name: Penny
line: Put it back in your pocket, or I'll find some other place to put it.

name: Leonard
line: Back in the pocket it goes. Look, you do understand that Sheldon really doesn't care when he gets the money back. It's actually one of the few idiosyncrasies that doesn't make you want to, you know, kill him.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, well, that's not really my big problem.

name: Leonard
line: So you're a little behind on your bills. Everybody gets behind on their bills.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, I know, it's just, this wasn't the plan, it wasn't supposed to go this way.

name: Leonard
line: Well, what was the plan?

name: Penny
line: Um, waitress for six months and then become a movie star.

name: Leonard
line: Was there a plan B?

name: Penny
line: TV star.

name: Leonard
line: It's probably not as bad as you think. Let's take a look. Maybe we can find some corners to cut. Oh, here's something, if you don't have electricity, then you probably don't need cable. Just a suggestion. 170 dollars for acting classes?

name: Penny
line: Oh, no, I can't give up my acting classes. I'm a professional actress.

name: Leonard
line: You've had an acting job where you got paid?

name: Penny
line: That is not the definition of professional.

name: Leonard
line: Actually, it kind of... let's keep looking. Whoa, what's eighteen hundred dollars to the Los Angeles County Superior Court?

name: Penny
line: Oh, that's nothing.

name: Leonard
line: Nothing? It sounds like you got caught speeding going 4,000 miles an hour.

name: Penny
line: Well, remember Kurt?

name: Leonard
line: Your ex-boyfriend?

name: Penny
line: Yeah. He got arrested for taking a whiz on a cop car.

name: Leonard
line: What?

name: Penny
line: He was drunk.

name: Leonard
line: I would hope so.

name: Penny
line: Anyway, he had a bunch of outstanding tickets and a bench warrant, so I, you know, I paid his fines.

name: Leonard
line: Did he pay you back?

name: Penny
line: No, but he will.

name: Leonard
line: And that's based on the inherent credit-worthiness of people who get drunk and urinate on police vehicles?

name: Penny
line: Leonard, I'm not gonna call up Kurt and ask him for money.

name: Leonard
line: Well what are you gonna do?

name: Penny
line: I don't know, but I may have to find a cheaper place to live.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, no. Oh, you don't want to do that.

name: Penny
line: Why not?

name: Leonard
line: Well, moving is a big deal. You have to go to the supermarket and get boxes, and if they're not clean, then your books smell like melons, and it's just, like... Why don't you just get a roommate and stay here?

name: Penny
line: Well, do you know anybody?

name: Leonard
line: Well, I'm sure the guy living with Sheldon wouldn't mind moving in with you.

name: Penny
line: Oh, Leonard, honey, if we started living together, I wouldn't be able to keep my hands off you.

name: Leonard
line: Really?

name: Penny
line: And you thought my acting lessons were a waste of money.

name: Howard
line: Ugh. This mu-shu pork's burning a hole through my duodenum.

name: Howard
line: Hey, do I mock you with the Bhagavad-Gita every time you scarf down a Whopper?

name: Leonard
line: Hey, what's going on?

name: Raj
line: We're on a quest through the Valley of Fire to acquire the sacred crown.

name: Howard
line: You want the Valley of Fire? It's right here.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, you guys want to go on a real live quest?

name: Sheldon
line: Outside? I just made cocoa.

name: Leonard
line: - Come on. It'll be fun.

name: Howard
line: What is it?

name: Leonard
line: Do you guys remember Penny's ex-boyfriend Kurt?  Yeah, that's him. It turns out he owes Penny a lot of money, and I'm gonna go get it from him.

name: Howard
line: Ooh, double sixes.

name: Leonard
line: Really? You're just gonna let me go by myself?

name: Raj
line: Oh, cool, I got a sword.

name: Leonard
line: I could use some help.

name: Raj
line: Here.

name: Leonard
line: You guys are unbelievable, you play a game to simulate adventure, but when there's real adventure out there in the real world, you just wimp out.

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard, do you not recall the last time we visited this gentleman, we returned home without pants?

name: Leonard
line: I do.

name: Sheldon
line: Are you sure? Because your proposal suggests that you don't.

name: Leonard
line: I'm not afraid of him.

name: Sheldon
line: All right. Leonard fairly calls the question, who is in favour of abandoning our game and confronting Penny's steroid-infused ex-boyfriend in a suicidal mission to extract money from him? Say hi to Kurt for us.

name: Leonard
line: Excuse me. When Frodo left the Shire to take the one ring to Mordor, didn't Samwise, Pippin and Merry go with him?

name: Sheldon
line: They did.

name: Leonard
line: Well?

name: Sheldon
line: They had a terrible time of it, Leonard.

name: Raj
line: Plus, no one stole their pants.

name: Leonard
line: Fine. Just enjoy your little game. I'll make this quest on my own.

name: Howard
line: Leonard, wait. Take a jacket, it's spritzing a little.

name: Leonard
line: You guys suck.  Come on, please? He's so big.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, is everyone clear on the plan?

name: Howard
line: Yes. Koothrappali's going to wet himself, I'm gonna throw up, Sheldon's gonna run away, and you're going to die. Shall we synchronize our watches?

name: Leonard
line: Guys, there are four of us and one of him.

name: Sheldon
line: Which means his triumph will be even larger. Minstrels will write songs about him.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, how about this? I'll do the talking, you just stand behind me and try to look formidable.

name: Raj
line: I should've peed before we left.

name: Kurt
line: Yeah?

name: Leonard
line: Hi, Kurt.

name: Kurt
line: Lenny, right?

name: Leonard
line: I don't really go by Lenny, but that's okay. Um, you remember Sheldon, Howard and Raj.

name: Kurt
line: No. What do you want?

name: Sheldon
line: You don't remember me? How could he not remember me?

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, not now.

name: Sheldon
line: I remember him.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, here it is. Penny's in kind of a financial jam, and the money that you owe her would go a long way to solving her problems.

name: Kurt
line: And she sent you to get it from me?

name: Leonard
line: No, no, she's too proud to ask for the money. I, on the other hand, feel you should honour your debt.

name: Kurt
line: You do?

name: Leonard
line: Feel is a kind of a... it's a strong word. Um, I just think it would be a nice gesture on your part.

name: Kurt
line: She'll get it when she gets it.

name: Howard
line: Well, there you go. Problem solved.

name: Raj
line: A successful quest. Now let's go find a gas station with a clean bathroom.

name: Leonard
line: No, the problem isn't solved. He just blew us off.

name: Sheldon
line: I've got it. He didn't remember me because the last time we met I was in a Halloween costume.

name: Howard
line: Come on, Leonard, let's go

name: Leonard
line: No. You can leave if you want to. I'm gonna see this through.

name: Howard
line: Okay.

name: Leonard
line: I guess, technically, that was my fault.  I'm not leaving here without Penny's money.

name: Kurt
line: What happened to your backup?

name: Leonard
line: I don't need backup. I have right on my side. And I'm wearing cargo shorts under my pants.

name: Sheldon
line: Congratulations. You may not have succeeded in getting cash, but you did secure a formal acknowledgment of the debt.

name: Howard
line: Maybe we should have your head notarized.

name: Raj
line: If anybody cares, I still have to pee.

name: Leonard
line: Hey.

name: Penny
line: Hey, is Sheldon here?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah. Hang on. Sheldon!

name: Penny
line: Nice hat.

name: Leonard
line: It's kind of a fashionable look these days.

name: Penny
line: Maybe if you're working on a tuna boat.

name: Sheldon
line: Hello, Penny.

name: Penny
line: Sheldon, here is your money. Thank you very much. It helped a lot.

name: Sheldon
line: Sarcasm?

name: Penny
line: No.

name: Sheldon
line: Darn. I can't seem to get the hang of that.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, I know it's none of my business, but where did the money come from?

name: Penny
line: Well, I cut back my expenses like you said and picked up a few more hours at the restaurant, but the biggest thing was, out of the blue, Kurt shows up and gives me the money he owes me.

name: Leonard
line: Really? Did he say why?

name: Penny
line: Yes, he said he was feeling guilty and wanted to do what was right.

name: Leonard
line: That's it? Did he give any reason as to why he came to this moral epiphany?

name: Penny
line: Nope. I just think he's really changed. We're having dinner tomorrow night, and I get to wear my new beret. Bye, guys.

name: Leonard
line: Bye.

name: Sheldon
line: Well done, Leonard. The true hero doesn't seek adulation, he fights for right and justice simply because it's his nature.

name: Leonard
line: Penny's hooking up with her jerk of an ex-boyfriend and I have indelible ink on my forehead!

name: Sheldon
line: That's your badge of honour, your warrior's wound, if you will. I was wrong, minstrels will write songs about you.

name: Leonard
line: Great.

name: Sheldon
line: There once was a brave lad named Leonard, with a fi-fi-fiddle-dee-dee. He faced a fearsome giant, while Raj just wanted to pee.

name: Penny
line: Fellas, please.

name: Howard
line: Penny, come on, we were just finding our sound.

name: Penny
line: You found it. It's the sound of a cat being run over by a lawn mower.

name: Leonard
line: I'm really very busy. Is there any way that we can put this off until I have more time to prepare? Of course. But, uh, you understand my trepidation.

name: Penny
line: What's that about?

name: Howard
line: Not a clue.

name: Leonard
line: Can't we just postpone it till the spring? Maybe next summer?

name: Sheldon
line: This should be fairly easy to deduce. He's holding the phone to his left ear. Ears do not cross hemispheres, so he's using the analytical rather than the emotional side of the brain, suggesting that he has no personal relationship with the caller.

name: Leonard
line: No, I didn't realize it had been so long. Sure, I guess there's no other choice but to just go ahead and do it.

name: Sheldon
line: He's referring to an activity he has done before. It's unpleasant and needs to be repeated. This suggests some sort of invasive medical test, like perhaps a colonoscopy.

name: Leonard
line: Aren't there any other options? There's not a lot of room, it's gonna be uncomfortable.

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, yes. Yeah, I'm definitely going with colonoscopy.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, bye. My mother's coming to visit.

name: Howard
line: How about that, you were right.

name: Penny
line: It's out of order.

name: Woman
line: Yes, I can read the sign, I'm just pondering the implications.

name: Penny
line: I think it implies that the elevator doesn't work.

name: Woman
line: Again, I can read the sign. But the sign and the tape are covered with a layer of dust, which indicates that the elevator has been non-functional for a significant amount of time. Which suggests either a remarkable passivity among the, I assume, 24 to 36 residents of this building based on the number of mailboxes and given typical urban population density or a shared delusion of functionality.

name: Penny
line: You must be Leonard's mother.

name: Leonard's Mother
line: Oh, I don't know if I must be, but yes.

name: Penny
line: Uh, I'm Penny. I'm his neighbour.

name: Leonard's Mother
line: Oh, Dr. Beverley Hofstadter.

name: Penny
line: Oh, nice to meet you.

name: Beverley
line: Oh, you're a hand shaker. Interesting.

name: Penny
line: Uh, why don't you come with me. I'll walk you to the apartment.

name: Beverley
line: Oh, all right. Would you like to exchange pleasantries on the way?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, sure, I guess.

name: Beverley
line: All right, you start.

name: Penny
line: Okay. You know, I've always been curious. What was Leonard like when he was little?

name: Beverley
line: Oh, I think you mean young. He's always been little.

name: Penny
line: Right, okay. What was he like when he was young?

name: Beverley
line: You'll have to be more specific.

name: Penny
line: Oh, um, okay, like, five or six. Five.

name: Beverley
line: Oh, well, at that age he was well enmeshed in what Freud would call the phallic stage of psychosexual development. An outmoded theory, of course, but the boy did spend most of his waking hours with a tight grasp on his penis.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, Leonard mentioned you were a psychiatrist.

name: Beverley
line: Well, that is one of my degrees. My primary field is neuroscience.

name: Penny
line: Oh, well, I'm an actress.

name: Beverley
line: Why?

name: Penny
line: What do you mean why?

name: Beverley
line: Well, there are studies that suggest that many who go into the performing arts suffer from an external locus of identity.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, I don't know what that means.

name: Beverley
line: Well, it means you value yourself only as others value you, which is often the result of unmet childhood emotional needs.

name: Penny
line: Oh, well, I had a wonderful childhood.

name: Beverley
line: Tell me about it.

name: Penny
line: I know my dad wanted a boy. I just, I tried being good at sports, but I hated getting dirty!

name: Beverley
line: And then, I'm assuming, you entered adolescence.

name: Penny
line: Uh-huh, he called me Slugger until I got my first training bra, and then he just stopped playing catch with me. I wasn't Slugger anymore. Your mother's here!

name: Beverley
line: If you want to have intercourse with that girl, find out what kind of cologne her father wore.

name: Leonard
line: Good to see you, Mother.

name: Leonard
line: Here's your tea, Mother.

name: Beverley
line: Oolong?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Beverley
line: Loose, not bagged?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Beverley
line: Steeped three minutes?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Beverley
line: Two-percent milk?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Beverley
line: Warmed separately?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Beverley
line: One teaspoon sugar?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Beverley
line: Raw sugar?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Beverley
line: It's cold.

name: Leonard
line: I'll start again.

name: Sheldon
line: I have the same problem with him. My theory is that his lack of focus stems from an over-developed sex drive.

name: Beverley
line: Oh, I don't know where he would've gotten that. Aside from a pro forma consummation of our marriage, his father and I only had intercourse for the purposes of reproduction.

name: Sheldon
line: That seems a fairly efficient arrangement.

name: Beverley
line: Yes, we think so. We've both done papers on it. Mine from the neuroscientific point of view and his from an anthropological. Mine, of course, was the only one worth reading.

name: Sheldon
line: Of course. I would very much like to read about your sex life.

name: Beverley
line: Well, it's all online or you can order it from the Princeton University Press.

name: Leonard
line: Here's your tea, Mother. So, what are you guys talking about?

name: Sheldon
line: The frequency with which your parents had intercourse.

name: Leonard
line: Swell. If you're lucky, maybe she'll show you the PowerPoint presentation.

name: Beverley
line: I'm sorry, it's on my other laptop.

name: Sheldon
line: Aw...

name: Leonard
line: So, Mother, what's new?

name: Beverley
line: You'll have to be more specific.

name: Leonard
line: All right. Uh, what's new with you?

name: Beverley
line: Oh, well, I've been having some fascinating menopausal symptoms recently.

name: Leonard
line: Maybe something less personal.

name: Beverley
line: Oh. Your Uncle Floyd died.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, my God. What happened?

name: Beverley
line: His heart stopped beating. I have to urinate.

name: Sheldon
line: What a remarkable woman.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah I, I thought you guys might hit it off.

name: Sheldon
line: I envy you your childhood.

name: Leonard
line: I hate to tell you, but the only warm memories I have of my childhood are of my Uncle Floyd.

name: Sheldon
line: You're clearly misremembering. Your mother is brilliant, analytical, insightful, and I'm betting she never hit you with a Bible because you wouldn't eat your Brussels sprouts.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, you don't give your mother enough credit. She's warm, she's loving, she doesn't glue electrodes to your head to measure your brain waves while potty training.

name: Sheldon
line: You were lucky. When I was a kid, if I wanted an EEG, I had to attach my own electrodes.

name: Howard
line: So, Dr. Hofstadter, Leonard rarely talks about his incredibly successful brother and sister.

name: Leonard
line: Please, don't go there, Howard.

name: Howard
line: I understand that unlike Leonard, they're at the top of their respective fields.

name: Leonard
line: Boy, you suck.

name: Beverley
line: Well, Leonard's younger brother, Michael, is a tenured law professor at Harvard, and his sister just successfully grew a human pancreas in an adolescent gibbon.

name: Howard
line: So, she's close to curing diabetes?

name: Beverley
line: Why else would you grow a pancreas in a teenaged gibbon?

name: Howard
line: Wow, you must be very proud.

name: Beverley
line: Why? They're not my accomplishments. I have to urinate.

name: Leonard
line: Why are you doing this?

name: Howard
line: You know the rules. You brought your mom to work, you must suffer.

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard, I had no idea your siblings were so much more successful than you.

name: Raj
line: Yeah, you're like the Jar Jar Binks of the Hofstadter family.

name: Howard
line: Oh, meesa think yousa lookin' so so sad.

name: Leonard
line: You know, rather than mock me, my friends might realize that this is difficult and try to help me through it.

name: Raj
line: Nope, I think mocking you is more fun.

name: Howard
line: Next time, don't yousa bring mama to work. Okee-day?

name: Leonard
line: That was fast.

name: Beverley
line: Oh, the middle stall was occupied. I'll have to try again later.

name: Sheldon
line: It's totally understandable. In bladder voiding, as in real estate, it's location, location, location.

name: Beverley
line: So, where were we?

name: Leonard
line: Howard lives with his mother and Raj can't speak to women unless he's drunk. Go.

name: Beverley
line: That's fascinating. Selective mutism is quite rare. On the other hand, an adult Jewish male living with his mother is so common it borders on sociological cliché.

name: Howard
line: It's just temporary, I pay rent.

name: Leonard
line: He lives in the same room where his bassinet was.

name: Beverley
line: You know, both selective mutism and an inability to separate from one's mother can stem from a pathological fear of women. It might explain why the two of you have created an ersatz homosexual marriage to satisfy your need for intimacy.

name: Howard
line: Say what?  That's basically what I just said.

name: Leonard
line: You brought your husband to work, you know the rules. Meesa thinking yousa looking pretty sad now too, betcha, betcha.

name: Beverley
line: Leonard, it's one o'clock, weren't you going to show me your laboratory at one o'clock?

name: Leonard
line: There's no hurry, Mother, tell them more about their secret love for each other.

name: Beverley
line: But it's one o'clock, you were going to show me your laboratory at one o'clock.

name: Sheldon
line: Her reasoning is unassailable. It is one o'clock.

name: Leonard
line: Fine. Let's go. I think you'll find my work pretty interesting. I'm attempting to replicate the dark matter signal found in sodium iodide crystals by the Italians.

name: Beverley
line: So, no original research?

name: Leonard
line: No.

name: Beverley
line: Well, what's the point of my seeing it? I could just read the paper the Italians wrote.

name: Howard
line: Just for the record, we're not in an ersatz homosexual relationship.

name: Raj
line: Well, then why didn't you say that to her?

name: Howard
line: Why is it always my responsibility?

name: Raj
line: It's not always your responsibility. I swear, this is the same thing you did at the comic book store last week.

name: Howard
line: I can't believe you're bringing that up.

name: Raj
line: I didn't bring it up. You did.

name: Howard
line: We'll talk about this later.

name: Raj
line: You always say that, but we never do.

name: Sheldon
line: You went to the comic book store without me.7

name: Penny
line: Hey.

name: Leonard
line: You got alcohol?

name: Penny
line: Your mom still here?

name: Leonard
line: Yep.

name: Penny
line: Come on in. Wait, wait, she's not gonna come here looking for you, is she?

name: Leonard
line: Oh, relax. She took Sheldon to the hospital to get a brain scan.

name: Penny
line: Oh, my God. What happened?

name: Leonard
line: Nothing. Mother likes looking at brains and Sheldon likes getting his brain scanned.

name: Penny
line: Geez, what a fun couple.

name: Leonard
line: She's only been here a day and a half and I'm seriously considering alcoholism as a new career path.

name: Penny
line: Hey, I talked to her for five minutes yesterday and I've been half bombed ever since.

name: Leonard
line: You can't let her get into your head.

name: Penny
line: My head, what about yours?

name: Leonard
line: It's too late for me. My head is her summer house.

name: Penny
line: She was right, you know. The locus of my identity is totally exterior to me.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, yeah, there she is. Hi, Mom.

name: Penny
line: I mean, do you know where I was all morning? Auditioning with 50 other blondes for some stupid antidepressant commercial. And for what? So I'll finally get my daddy's approval?

name: Leonard
line: Did you get the part?

name: Penny
line: No, they said I was too perky.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, you want to talk about not getting love from a parent. You know what I used to do when I was little to have some sensation of human contact?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, you grabbed your penis and wouldn't let go. Your mother told me.

name: Leonard
line: Of course she did. Anyway, that's not what I was gonna say. When I was ten years old, I built a hugging machine.

name: Penny
line: A hugging machine?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah. I got a dressmaker's mannequin, I stuffed it with an electric blanket so it would be warm, and built two radio-controlled arms that would hug me and pat my back.

name: Penny
line: Oh, that is so sad.

name: Leonard
line: You know what the saddest part was?

name: Penny
line: What?

name: Leonard
line: My father used to borrow it.

name: Beverley
line: Your scan data will be very elpful to my research. You have a remarkable brain.

name: Sheldon
line: I know. Although I've always hated how my right frontal lobe looks in pictures.

name: Beverley
line: Common complaint among men. Nothing's ever big enough, except when they get a tumour. Then you never hear the end of it.

name: Sheldon
line: I'd love to see a scan of your brain sometime.

name: Beverley
line: Oh, I'll send you a link, but its physiology is fairly unimpressive.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, I can't believe that.

name: Beverley
line: Your unwillingness to accept empirical evidence suggests an attempt at flattery.

name: Sheldon
line: My apologies. I've been living with your son too long. Gotten into some bad habits.

name: Beverley
line: Understandable.

name: Sheldon
line: Can I make you a cup of tea?

name: Beverley
line: I doubt it, but if anyone has a chance, it's probably you.

name: Sheldon
line: I feel very comfortable around you.

name: Beverley
line: I feel very comfortable around you, too.

name: Sheldon
line: It's surprising because I generally don't feel comfortable around, well, anyone.

name: Beverley
line: Nor I.

name: Sheldon
line: What are the odds that two individuals as unique as ourselves would be connected by someone as comparatively workaday as your son?

name: Beverley
line: Is that a rhetorical point or would you like to do the math?

name: Sheldon
line: I'd like to do the math.

name: Beverley
line: I'd like that, too.

name: Penny
line: Okay, now this time...

name: Leonard
line: Uh-huh.

name: Penny
line: You're gonna lick the salt off my neck, do the shot, and then bite the lime.

name: Leonard
line: I'm sorry, I didn't hear anything after lick.

name: Penny
line: Neck, shot, lime.  Okay, shot, lime.

name: Leonard
line: Right. Ah! Where's the lime?  Oh, okay, we're sharing.

name: Sheldon
line: So, what do you think?

name: Beverley
line: I'm very tempted. I'm just not sure it's appropriate with my son's roommate.

name: Sheldon
line: Normally, I'd feel the same way. But based on everything I've observed about us, I can't help but speculate we'd be very good together.

name: Beverley
line: True. I've had a similar observation. It's certainly something I could never do with my husband.

name: Sheldon
line: I was hesitant the first time I tried it, but I experienced an unanticipated and remarkable release of endorphins. It's quite satisfying.

name: Beverley
line: I see what you're doing. You're appealing to the neuroscientific researcher in me.

name: Sheldon
line: You see right through me, don't you?

name: Beverley
line: Only when you're in a CAT scanner.

name: Leonard
line: This is actually gonna happen.

name: Penny
line: Honey, shush, shush, shush, shush, shush.

name: Leonard
line: You shush, I'm happy, I want to talk about it. You know what my mother would say about this? She would say because you were not loved by your father and I was not loved by my mother, that having sex is our way of making up for the intimacy we didn't get as children.

name: Penny
line: Why would you bring that up right now?

name: Leonard
line: I don't know. Foreplay?

name: Penny
line: So you're saying you're not having sex with me, you're having sex with your mother?

name: Leonard
line: Ummm, I'm gonna go with “no.”

name: Penny
line: That is the sickest thing I've ever heard.

name: Leonard
line: Come on, you're trying to have sex with your father, and I'm okay with that.

name: Penny
line: Get out!

name: Leonard
line: She said shush. I should have shushed.

name: Leonard
line: All right, Mother. Um, have a nice flight.

name: Beverley
line: That's not really in my control, is it? Oh, uh, yes

name: Penny
line: Oh, good morning.

name: Leonard
line: Morning.

name: Penny
line: Look, I was just coming over to talk to you.

name: Leonard
line: You don't have to. Ever.

name: Penny
line: Gotcha.

name: Leonard
line: Good-bye, Mother.

name: Beverley
line: Good-bye, Leonard. So, Slugger, shall we pick up where we left off last time?

name: Penny
line: I mean, my mom could've just said, “Bob, get over it, she's a girl, move on.” But she didn't. Not one word.

name: Beverley
line: Interesting. Would you be willing to fly to New Jersey and discuss your relationship with your parents during a brain scan?

name: Penny
line: Would it help?

name: Beverley
line: Well, it would help me.

name: Howard
line: That was close.

name: Raj
line: God, I love the smell of paintballs in the morning.

name: Howard
line: Yeah, still funny, Raj.

name: Leonard
line: There's no way we can get to the ridge. The Chemistry Department has us completely cut off.

name: Howard
line: But what about the creek bed?

name: Sheldon
line: The Pharmacology Department controls that, and they're all hopped up on experimental steroids.

name: Raj
line: Well, that's it then, we're doomed.

name: Sheldon
line: I think the time has come to acknowledge that we are paying the price for some of us failing to attend my Physics Department paintball strategy meeting.

name: Howard
line: I told you my mom has spider veins, I had to take her to the laser clinic.

name: Sheldon
line: And I told you I wanted to see a doctor's note.

name: Raj
line: We need a plan. How about Operation Hammer of the Gods?

name: Leonard
line: I forget. Which one is Hammer of the Gods?

name: Raj
line: We hide behind the Dumpsters in the parking lot and ambush people when they come to pee.

name: Howard
line: No go. The Dumpsters are deep in Astronomy Department territory.

name: Leonard
line: No, that shouldn't be a problem, Venus is up during the day. They're probably just all staring at the sky.

name: Sheldon
line: All right, what we need now is a tactical retreat. Did you see the episode of Stargate where they found themselves on a planet with a culture based loosely on Earth's Athens and Sparta? Not important. Leonard, Raj and I are going to burst out the door and run away, Howard will cover us.

name: Howard
line: Why don't I run away and you cover me?

name: Sheldon
line: Because you chose your mother's veins over victory. On three. One, two, three, go!

name: Howard
line: I had to take her! It's almost bathing suit weather!

name: Leslie
line: Howard, I'm on your team.

name: Howard
line: Oh, Leslie, thank God.

name: Leslie
line: Where's the rest of your squad?

name: Howard
line: Ah, they left me here to die. What about yours?

name: Leslie
line: Dead, all of them.

name: Howard
line: Sorry.

name: Leslie
line: Don't be. It was friendly fire. They just wouldn't listen.

name: Howard
line: Well, we're surrounded, so I guess there's nothing for us to do but wait to be captured or killed.

name: Leslie
line: Hmm, that's the worst part, the waiting.

name: Howard
line: All the while knowing that there's a paint pellet out there with your name on it.

name: Leslie
line: Yeah, the big wet ball of death. Kind of makes you feel more alive, doesn't it?

name: Howard
line: It kind of does.

name: Leslie
line: I say we make every moment count.

name: Howard
line: I agree. How exactly do we do that?

name: Leonard
line: Howard, why aren't you covering us? We're getting slaughtered out here!

name: Howard
line: War is hell.

name: Raj
line: Did you guys see the new budget memo that went out this morning?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, more cutbacks.

name: Sheldon
line: Unacceptable. It baffles me why they don't simply let some of you go so that there's money available for my research.

name: Leonard
line: You know what baffles me, Sheldon?

name: Sheldon
line: Based on your academic record, any number of things, I would imagine.

name: Leslie
line: Hey, guys.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, Leslie.

name: Howard
line: Hey.

name: Leslie
line: Howard, I got the approval for the rapid prototyper you wanted.

name: Howard
line: That's great, Leslie. Thanks.

name: Leslie
line: You scratch my back, I scratch yours. Rawr.

name: Raj
line: What was all that about?

name: Howard
line: Oh, uh, no big deal. They gave Leslie control of some unrestricted grant money.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, okay, but what's with the back-scratching and the meow!

name: Sheldon
line: I believe the back-scratching metaphor generally describes a quid pro quo situation where one party provides goods or services to the second party in compensation for a similar action.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you.

name: Sheldon
line: The mrow, that sounded to me like an African civet cat.

name: Leonard
line: Are you done?

name: Sheldon
line: No. Despite what the name suggests, the civet cat is not a true cat. Now I'm done.

name: Raj
line: You know what I'm thinking? I'm thinking Howard wasn't making a back-scratching metaphor. I'm thinking there was some actual scratching involved.

name: Leonard
line: What about it, Howard?

name: Howard
line: Okay, I didn't want to say anything 'cause I know you and Leslie have a little history.

name: Leonard
line: I don't care about that.

name: Howard
line: Great, 'cause I've been dying to say something.

name: Leonard
line: You and Leslie?

name: Howard
line: In the paintball shed! Twice!

name: Sheldon
line: Is that why you didn't cover our escape and let us get cut down like animals?

name: Howard
line: Oh, yeah, sorry about that.

name: Sheldon
line: My good man, dereliction of duty in the face of the enemy is a court-martial offense.

name: Howard
line: Court-martial, schmort-martial, Leslie Winkle is the fifth girl I've ever had sex with. I mean, for free.

name: Raj
line: And plus, you got a rapid prototyper. That's an expensive piece of equipment, dude.

name: Leonard
line: And the rest of us have had our budgets cut to the bone.

name: Howard
line: Okay, one way to look at this is that I'm getting new equipment, and you're not, and that's unfair. But a better way to look at this is that I'm getting sex and you're not, and that's delightful.

name: Penny
line: The whole thing froze. I don't know what happened.

name: Leonard
line: Calm down. We'll figure it out.

name: Penny
line: How can I calm down? I'm gonna lose my whole shopping cart. That's three hours of picking out shoes just shot to hell.

name: Sheldon
line: Hello, Penny.

name: Penny
line: Hello, Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: You're in my spot.

name: Penny
line: Are you planning on sitting here?

name: Sheldon
line: No, I'm going to the comic book store.

name: Penny
line: Then what difference does it make?

name: Sheldon
line: What difference does it make?

name: Leonard
line: Here we go.

name: Sheldon
line: That is my spot. In an ever-changing world, it is a single point of consistency. If my life were expressed as a function on a four-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system, that spot at the moment I first sat on it would be zero-zero-zero-zero.

name: Penny
line: What?

name: Leonard
line: Don't sit in his spot.

name: Penny
line: Fine.   Happy?

name: Sheldon
line: I'm not unhappy.

name: Penny
line: Boy, I love him, but he is one serious wackadoodle.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, that should do it.

name: Penny
line: Oh, thank you. You are a lifesaver.

name: Leonard
line: That's a lot of shoes you ordered.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, you know the sad thing is, it's really not. Ooh, is this one of those paintball guns?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah. You ought to come out with us sometime.

name: Penny
line: Oh, no, thanks. I'm from Nebraska. When we shoot things, it's because we want to eat them or make them leave our boyfriends alone.

name: Leslie
line: Boy, your heart's racing. I must've really gotten you going.

name: Howard
line: Well, it's partly you, partly my transient idiopathic arrhythmia.

name: Leslie
line: Sexy.

name: Howard
line: Can I assume that you likewise found the experience...

name: Leslie
line: Satisfactory?

name: Howard
line: That wasn't quite the word I was looking for, but sure, I'll do this pass-fail.

name: Leslie
line: Hey, are you enjoying that prototyper I got you?

name: Howard
line: Oh, it's great. Everybody in the Engineering Department is eating their hearts out.

name: Leslie
line: Isn't it nice when your good fortune makes others miserable?

name: Howard
line: You know, most people don't get that.

name: Howard's Mother
line: Howard, I'm home!

name: Howard
line: Oh, great.

name: Howard's Mother
line: Book club was cancelled! That thing on Phyllis's neck opened up again!

name: Howard
line: I'm busy, Ma!

name: Howard's Mother
line: Too busy to help your mother with her zipper?

name: Howard
line: Don't come in, Ma!

name: Howard's Mother
line: Why not?

name: Leslie
line: He's got company!

name: Howard
line: Oh, there's the arrhythmia.

name: Howard's Mother
line: Is she Jewish?

name: Howard
line: Are you Jewish?

name: Leslie
line: No.

name: Howard
line: Yes!

name: Howard's Mother
line: Okay, then you kids have fun! Use protection!

name: Penny
line: You think he'll notice?

name: Leonard
line: There's a chance.

name: Penny
line: Oh, what are we gonna do?

name: Leonard
line: We? No, no, no, you had your chance to be we for, like, a year and a half now. Right now, you are you, and you are screwed.

name: Penny
line: Why do we have to tell him I did it?

name: Leonard
line: Well, we're not gonna tell him I did it.

name: Penny
line: Okay, okay, how about this? We tell him somebody broke in.

name: Leonard
line: Just to shoot the couch with a paintball gun?

name: Penny
line: I'm sorry, I buy it. All those people are on drugs.

name: Leonard
line: We could tell him they wanted the couch to stay away from their boyfriend.

name: Penny
line: Okay, fine. Well, what if we just flip it over? There. Looks fine, right?

name: Leonard
line: Mm, butt print. There's no discernible butt print.

name: Penny
line: Oh, come on.  There, butt print.

name: Leonard
line: It's too small and too perfect.

name: Penny
line: Thank you.

name: Leonard
line: You're welcome.

name: Penny
line: Shh! Act normal.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon! How was the comic book store?

name: Sheldon
line: Fine. The new issue of Flash is out.

name: Leonard
line: Great, great. Did you walk the whole way? It's a little chilly.

name: Sheldon
line: Koothrappali picked me up.

name: Leonard
line: Isn't that terrific? He is such a good friend. You know what the best thing about friends is?

name: Sheldon
line: They don't talk incessantly for no particular reason.

name: Leonard
line: No, no, friends forgive the little things.

name: Penny
line: You know, I gotta go home and wash my hair.

name: Leonard
line: Don't you dare, missy.

name: Sheldon
line: Hello, fastest man alive. Want to see me read your entire comic book? Want to see it again? Something's wrong.

name: Leonard
line: What do you mean?

name: Sheldon
line: I'm not sure. It doesn't feel right.

name: Leonard
line: I don't know what you're talking about. Oh, that. Penny did that.

name: Leonard
line: Why don't you just eat in your desk chair?

name: Sheldon
line: Why don't I just eat in my desk chair?

name: Penny
line: Here we go.

name: Sheldon
line: That is my desk chair, that is where I work. I don't eat in my desk chair and I don't work in my spot. I work in my desk chair and eat in my spot.

name: Leonard
line: Wackadoodle.

name: Howard
line: You know, there's kind of an obvious solution here.  Get up.  There. Problem solved.  Nobody cares where you're going to sit. You're not crazy.

name: Sheldon
line: Excuse me, but the problem is not solved. If your head had been accidentally amputated, and we transplanted a dog's head in its place, would that be “problem solved”?

name: Leonard
line: If it were your head, it would be.

name: Penny
line: Sheldon, I am really, really sorry, but it's only for a week. Can't you be a little bit flexible? Yeah, sorry. I didn't really think that through.

name: Sheldon
line: You claim it's going to be a week, but I have no faith in your dry cleaner.

name: Penny
line: Why not?

name: Sheldon
line: Did you notice the sign on his counter? He's not a full-time dry cleaner. He also makes keys.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, for God's sake, Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Focus is important. Was Michael DeBakey a wedding planner in between heart transplants? Did Alexander Fleming moonlight as a hairdresser? “Thanks for discovering penicillin, now how about we try a bouffant?”

name: Howard
line: Ooh, looks like I'm gonna have sex tonight. Hey, baby...

name: Penny
line: His right hand is calling him?

name: Leonard
line: No, it's Leslie Winkle. It's a long story.

name: Howard
line: I'll pick you up in ten minutes. Gentlemen, adieu.

name: Leonard
line: I thought we were going to play Halo tonight.

name: Howard
line: What am I supposed to do, Leonard? There's a woman out there anxious to have sex with me. You understand, right?

name: Penny
line: No. Not at all.

name: Howard
line: Nevertheless, I must depart. By the way, did I tell you? Leslie pulled some strings and got me on the research trip to Geneva to check out the CERN Supercollider.

name: Leonard
line: That's not fair. You're not even a physicist.

name: Howard
line: Okay, there are two ways of looking at this...

name: Leonard
line: Get out.

name: Howard
line: Bye.

name: Leslie
line: You're improving.

name: Howard
line: Thank you. It helps when I get to practice with a real woman.

name: Leslie
line: Hey, listen. Saturday my sister's getting married. I.. I want you to come with me. It's black tie.

name: Howard
line: Yeah, gee, I'd really rather not.

name: Leslie
line: Why not?

name: Howard
line: When I go to weddings, it's to scam on chunky bridesmaids. I don't know what I would do with a date.

name: Leslie
line: Oh, all right. I understand.

name: Howard
line: Thanks.

name: Leslie
line: Hey, I'm really sorry about that Geneva trip.

name: Howard
line: What about it?

name: Leslie
line: Oh, didn't you hear? I had to reduce the number of people going, and you didn't make the cut.

name: Howard
line: When did that happen?

name: Leslie
line: About 12 seconds ago.

name: Howard
line: Well, hold on. Are you saying if I don't go to the wedding, I can't go to Geneva?

name: Leslie
line: Actually, I'm trying not to say it.

name: Howard
line: Okay, I'm sorry, but that makes me a little uncomfortable.

name: Leslie
line: How so?

name: Howard
line: Because it's like you're controlling me with new equipment and research trips.

name: Leslie
line: Well, if I weren't controlling you with new equipment and research trips, then I'd be uncomfortable.

name: Howard
line: How so?

name: Leslie
line: ‘Cause then we'd be in, like, a real relationship with feelings and all that crap.

name: Howard
line: So, bottom line, I'm just a bought-and-paid-for sex toy.

name: Leslie
line: No. No, not at all. You're also arm candy. So? What do you think?

name: Howard
line: Hey, Ma, you got to rent me a tux!

name: Howard's Mother
line: Right now? What kind of sex are you having up there?

name: Leonard
line: Why are you crouching there?

name: Sheldon
line: This is my spot. Where else am I supposed to crouch?

name: Leonard
line: I don't know. Texas?

name: Penny
line: Here you go. Fresh from the cleaners, good as new.

name: Leonard
line: Really? Great. Sheldon, look. Good as new.

name: Sheldon
line: From that key maker, I highly doubt it.

name: Penny
line: Come on, Sheldon. Just give it a try.

name: Sheldon
line: All right.

name: Penny
line: There, nice and comfy cosy. Zero, zero, zero.

name: Sheldon
line: There's one more zero. You forgot the time parameter.

name: Penny
line: Sit on the damn couch.

name: Sheldon
line: Nope.

name: Penny
line: What do you mean, nope? What's wrong with it?

name: Leonard
line: Nothing, it's what's wrong with him.

name: Penny
line: It's exactly the same...

name: Leonard
line: Penny, Penny, I think I know what to do. Sheldon, I have some bad news.

name: Sheldon
line: More?

name: Leonard
line: I'm afraid so. You know the cashew chicken I get you Monday nights?

name: Sheldon
line: Yes. From Szechuan Palace.

name: Leonard
line: Szechuan Palace closed two years ago.

name: Sheldon
line: What? Wh-Where did my cashew chicken come from?

name: Leonard
line: Golden Dragon.

name: Sheldon

Anyway, so, this physicist goes into an ice cream parlour every week and orders an ice cream sundae for himself, and then offers one to the empty stool sitting next to him. This goes on for a while until the owner finally asks him what he's doing. The man says, “well, I'm a physicist, and quantum mechanics teaches us that it is possible for the matter above this stool to spontaneously turn into a beautiful woman who might accept my offer and fall in love with me.” The owner then says, “well, lots of single, beautiful women come in here every day, why don't you buy an ice cream for one of them, and they might fall in love with you?” And the physicist says, “yeah, but what are the odds of that happening?”

line: I just got a callback to audition for CSI to play a hooker who gets killed.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, I'd watch that.

name: Alicia
line: But my car is in the shop, and I have to be at Universal in forty-five minutes.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, well, I'll take you.

name: Alicia
line: Oh, you're a lifesaver.

name: Howard
line: I'll run lines with you in the car.

name: Alicia
line: Great. And afterward, I'll take you all out for Chinese.

name: Penny
line: Oh, actually, that's okay. we already have...

name: Howard
line: Yum. Starving.

name: Penny
line: ...chinese food right here.

name: Sheldon
line: They're gone, Penny. They can't hear you.

name: Penny
line: I cannot believe they're letting her just use them like that. I mean, anything she wants, they go panting after her like trained dogs. You know that just last week, she had Howard drive all the way to her uncle's house in Orange County to pick up her TV?

name: Sheldon
line: You once had Leonard and me get your television from your ex-boyfriend.

name: Penny
line: Apples and oranges here, Sheldon. I'm telling you, that girl is a user, iceskating through the life on her looks, taking advantage of innocent weak-willed men, getting auditions for stupid network shows. It creams my corn.

name: Sheldon
line: May I interject something here?

name: Penny
line: Please.

name: Sheldon
line: You got the wrong mustard.

name: Alicia
line: Hi.

name: Alicia
line: Guess what? I got the part on CSI.

name: Penny
line: Oh boy.

name: Alicia
line: Something wrong?

name: Penny
line: Uh, no. No, no, no, you know, congratulations, I think you'll make a great hooker.

name: Alicia
line: Thank you. Hey, I got to ask you something, how much do physicists make?

name: Penny
line: Um, I don't know, I don't think a lot.

name: Alicia
line: Yeah, that's what I figured. Well, got to run, the guys promised to set up my satellite dish and paint my bedroom. Yay!

name: Penny
line: Um, hey, hey, can I talk to you about that for a second?

name: Alicia
line: About what?

name: Penny
line: Well, you know, it's just that Leonard and Howard and Raj, they aren't like other guys. They're special.

name: Alicia
line: Okay, they're special, and?

name: Penny
line: Oh, let's see, how can I explain this, um, they don't know how to use their shields.

name: Alicia
line: Shields?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, you know, like in Star Trek, when you're in battle and you raise the shields? Where the hell did that come from? Anyways, um, you know how guys like this are, so, please don't take advantage of them.

name: Alicia
line: Who says I'm taking advantage of them?

name: Penny
line: Come on, they're doing everything for you, because you're leading them on.

name: Alicia
line: So I let them do stuff for me. They're happy. I get stuff. Who cares? And how's it any different from what you do?

name: Penny
line: Excuse me?

name: Alicia
line: I've seen you around them. Are you pretending like you don't do the exact same thing?

name: Penny
line: Okay, lady, you are way out of line.

name: Alicia
line: Oh, I'm out of line?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, you're out of line.

name: Alicia
line: Well, what are you going to do about it, bitch?

name: Raj
line: I like green lantern, I'm just saying it's pretty lame that He can be defeated by the colour yellow.

name: Sheldon
line: Only the modern green lantern is vulnerable to yellow.

name: Leonard
line: Golden age green lantern was vulnerable to wood.

name: Raj
line: Great, so I can take them both out with a number-two pencil?

name: Howard
line: Oh, my God! Girl fight!

name: Leonard
line: What are you doing?

name: Howard
line: I know you. you're stupid enough to break it up.

line: May I say you look very comely tonight?

name: Penny
line: Thank you.

name: Howard
line: You're right, this filly's been broken.

name: Sheldon
line: You set it on DTS, didn't you?

name: Leonard
line: I had to, she called me cutie.

name: Howard
line: According to Alicia's facebook page, she's hooking up with one of the producers on CSI.

name: Penny
line: Well, dead whore on TV, live one in real life.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, great now she's jumping up and down on the bed.

name: Sheldon
line: Worst Renaissance Fair ever.

name: Leonard
line: Please let it go, Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: It was rife with historical inaccuracies. For example, the tavern girl serving flagons of mead, now her costume was obviously Germanic, but in 1487 the Bavarian purity laws or Rhineheitsgebot severely limited the availability of mead. At best they would have had some sort of spiced wine.

name: Leonard
line: You're nitpicking.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh-ho! Really? Well here's another nit for you. The flagons would not have been made of polypropylene.

name: Howard
line: Renaissance fairs aren't about historical accuracy. They're about taking chubby girls who work at Kinko's and lacing them up in corsets so tight their bosom jumps out and says howdy.

name: Sheldon
line: Bosoms would not have said howdy in the fifteenth century. If anything they would have said “huzzah!”

name: Howard
line: I don't care what the bosoms say, Sheldon, I just want to be part of the conversation.

name: Penny
line: Hi guys. Looks like you've been to the Renaissance fair. I'm hoping.

name: Sheldon
line: Renaissance fair? More of a medieval slash age of enlightenment slash any excuse to wear a codpiece fair.

name: Penny
line: Okay, fine, whatever, um, you guys, this is my friend Eric.

name: Howard
line: Hello.

name: Leonard
line: Hi.

name: Eric
line: Hey.

name: Leonard
line: So, yeah, good to see you.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, yeah, it's good to see you too. We should really go.

name: Eric
line: Yeah.

name: Penny
line: Bye guys.

name: Eric
line: Like your hat.

name: Howard
line: Thanks, my mom made it. Penny with a new guy, tres awkward.

name: Leonard
line: It wasn't awkward. It wasn't fun. Besides, what's the big deal, we dated, we stopped dating, and now we're both moving on.

name: Raj
line: By moving on, do you mean, she's going out with other men and you spent the afternoon making fifteenth century soap with Wolowitz?

name: Sheldon
line: That was not fifteenth century soap, my God those people need to learn you can't just put “ye olde” in front of anything and expect to get away with it.

name: Leonard
line: Can we please just go in, my chain mail is stuck in my underwear.

name: Sheldon
line: You're wearing modern underwear?

name: Leonard
line: Relatively modern. Why, what are you wearing?

name: Sheldon
line: I fashioned historically accurate undergarments out of linen.

name: Leonard
line: You went out and bought linen?

name: Sheldon
line: Don't be silly, I borrowed one of your pillow cases.

name: Leonard
line: Borrowed?

name: Leonard
line: You know what, I'm happy that Penny's moving on. It gives me the freedom to move on myself.

name: Howard
line: Are you saying that you've been holding back?

name: Leonard
line: Of course. Out of respect.

name: Howard
line: So, how do you explain the ten years before Penny?

name: Raj
line: Who were you respecting then?

name: Leonard
line: What? I've dated plenty of women. There was Joyce Kim, Leslie Winkle.

name: Sheldon
line: Notify the editors of the Oxford English Dictionary, the word plenty has been redefined to mean two.

name: Leonard
line: Uh, what about that girl last year at Comic-con?

name: Raj
line: Doesn't count.

name: Leonard
line: Why not?

name: Raj
line: What happens in costume at Comic-con, stays at Comic-con.

name: Howard
line: You're only saying that because of what happened to you.

name: Leonard
line: What happened to you?

name: Raj
line: N-n-n-nothing happened to me.

name: Howard
line: It wasn't your fault, Raj, he was dressed as a green Orion slave girl.

name: Raj
line: H-h-h-how did we get on me, we were mocking Leonard for not moving on. Dude, you have totally not moved on.

name: Leonard
line: Yes I have, it's just a matter of actually making a date with someone.

name: Howard
line: Like who?

name: Leonard
line: Well, there's Joyce Kim, but she defected back to North Korea so it's a little geographically undesireable.

name: Raj
line: What about Leslie Winkle.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh no.

name: Raj
line: Why?

name: Sheldon
line: Her research methodology is sloppy, she's unjustifiably arrogant about loop quantum gravity, and to make matters worse she's often mean to me.

name: Raj
line: I think she's smoking hot.

name: Howard
line: I'd hit that.

name: Sheldon
line: You'd hit particulate soil on a colloidal suspension. Mud.

name: Leonard
line: Look, I like Leslie, but she's not interested in dating as much as using men as tools for stress release.

name: Howard
line: Yeah, so, be a tool. Go get yourself a little rebound stress release.

name: Raj
line: Technically it would only be rebound if he and Penny had actually engaged in physical intimacy.

name: Howard
line: You mean like you and Richard the slave girl?

name: Raj
line: I bought him dinner and we kissed once, that was it.  And he told me his name was Kimberley!

name: Sheldon
line: You know how I know we're not in The Matrix?

name: Leonard
line: How?

name: Sheldon
line: If we were, the food would be better.

name: Leslie
line: Hey, Leonard.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, Leslie.

name: Leslie
line: Hey, dummy.

name: Sheldon
line: Hello to you, insufficiently intelligent person.

name: Leslie
line: Ooh, rush me to the burn unit. Hey, Leonard, do you have a second, I need to ask you something.

name: Leonard
line: Uh, sure.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, if you'll excuse me, I'm going to go do work that promises significant results, as opposed to what you do, which does not. Yeah, you heard me.

name: Leslie
line: Wow. So, I heard your relationship with Penny crashed to the ground like blue ice falling out of an airplane lavatory.

name: Leonard
line: Where did you hear that?

name: Leslie
line: Actually I read it. Wolowitz texted me.

name: Leonard
line: Like blue ice falling out of an airplane lavatory. Yep.

name: Leslie
line: I thought it was a pretty good one, I gave him an L-O-L. Anyway, it got me thinking, now that you're unattached maybe we can revisit our previous attachment.

name: Leonard
line: Are you suggesting another bout of stress release.

name: Leslie
line: No, I'm all done with casual sex. From now on I'm fully committed to the traditional relationship paradigm.

name: Leonard
line: Really, what changed?

name: Leslie
line: It's hard to say, I guess there's just a time in every woman's life when she gets tired of waking up on a strange futon with a bunch of people she doesn't know.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, I can see how that would... a bunch of people?

name: Leslie
line: Anyway, I just figure it's time to slow things down and who better to slow things down with than you?

name: Leonard
line: Oh, I'm flattered. So, how do you suggest we proceed?

name: Leslie
line: Your place, we'll order Chinese, you'll rent a movie, artsy but accessible, then light petting, no coitus.

name: Leonard
line: Sounds fun.

name: Leslie
line: I'll leave the details up to you, I think it's better if you assume the male role.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you, that's very thoughtful.

name: Leslie
line: Great. Call me.

name: Sheldon
line: Great news. My mom sent me my old Nintendo 64.

name: Leonard
line: Terrific.

name: Sheldon
line: You know what this means, don't you? Break out the Red Bull, it's time to rock Mario old school.

name: Leonard
line: I kind of have other plans tonight.

name: Sheldon
line: But it's Friday. Friday's always vintage game night. Look, mom included the memory card, we can pick up where I left off in 1999 when I had pernicious anaemia.

name: Leonard
line: Well, the thing is, someone's coming over.

name: Sheldon
line: Well then, no problem, I have three controllers, the more the merrier.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, it's a date, I have a date coming over.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, well you can't blame me for not jumping to that conclusion.

name: Leonard
line: Why, what's so unusual about me having a date?

name: Sheldon
line: Well, statistically speaking...

name: Leonard
line: Alright, alright. Well, uh, nevertheless, I have one now and I would appreciate it if you would, you know, make yourself scarce.

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard, I am a published theoretical physicist with two doctorates and an IQ which can't be accurately measured by normal tests, how much scarcer could I be?

name: Leonard
line: You know what I mean, could you just give us a little privacy?

name: Sheldon
line: You want me to leave the apartment?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Sheldon
line: You mean just go someplace else and be... someplace else?

name: Leonard
line: Yes.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, why should I leave, this is my apartment too.

name: Leonard
line: I know it is, and if science ever discovers a second member of your species and you two would like some privacy I would be more than happy to get out of your way.

name: Sheldon
line: Well alright then.

name: Penny
line: Sheldon? What are you doing?

name: Sheldon
line: Playing Super Mario on a poorly coded Nintendo 64 emulator.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, but why are you doing it on the stairs?

name: Sheldon
line: I'm a modern day Napoleon exiled to the Elba of the staircase because Leonard, get this, has a date.

name: Penny
line: Oh. Oh, well, good for him. Yeah but, why are you sitting here, why don't you just go to a movie or something?

name: Sheldon
line: Alone?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, why not?

name: Sheldon
line: What if I choke on my popcorn, who will administer the Heimlich manoeuvre.

name: Penny

name: Sheldon
line: No popcorn at the mo... listen to yourself.

name: Penny

name: Sheldon
line: I don't drink coffee.

name: Penny
line: They have other things.

name: Sheldon
line: What do they have?

name: Penny
line: I don't know, you know, cookies, pastries...

name: Sheldon
line: Pastries such as bearclaws?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, sure.

name: Sheldon
line: I don't like bearclaws.

name: Leslie
line: Heya Penny. Dumbass.

name: Sheldon
line: Leslie Winkle. Of all the overrated physicists in all the labs in all the world, why does it have to be Leslie Winkle?

name: Penny
line: Well, they have a lot in common. I mean they're both scientists.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh please. The only way she could make a contribution to science would be if they resume sending chimps into space.

name: Penny
line: Okay, well I have a date too, so see ya.

name: Sheldon
line: Everybody has a date. Even you, Mario, going after Princess Peach. And what am I doing, I'm just enabling you.

name: Leslie
line: This is pretty good Orange Chicken.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, it's from Changs.

name: Leslie
line: Not Chows?

name: Leonard
line: No, Changs.

name: Leslie
line: What happened to Chows?

name: Leonard
line: It changed.

name: Leslie
line: Oh. So, how many children do you think we should have?  I'm sorry, that was a little abrupt.

name: Leonard
line: A little.

name: Leslie
line: I mean there are so many things to talk about before we discuss reproduction.

name: Leonard
line: I sure hope so.

name: Leslie
line: Besides shortness, what genetic weaknesses run in your family?

name: Sheldon
line: I'm sorry to interrupt, batteries dying continue.

name: Leslie
line: Uh, genetic weaknesses, right, um, there's the lactose intolerance.

name: Sheldon
line: Don't forget the male pattern baldness. When his uncles sit around the dinner table they look like a half carton of eggs.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, now my uncles are bald, but my Aunt Edna is one of the hairiest women you will ever meet. So... Sweet lady. It always tickles when she hugs me.  What now?

name: Sheldon
line: I have to make pee-pee.

name: Leonard
line: Listen, I'm sorry about all of Sheldon's interruptions, he can be a bit of an eccentric.

name: Leslie
line: If by eccentric you mean passive-aggressive East Texas blowhole, I agree.

name: Leonard
line: Well, I think tonight was a very good start.

name: Leslie
line: Me too. You're sure you're okay postponing intercourse until our relationship is past the initial viability test?

name: Leonard
line: No problem, I'm very skilled at postponing intercourse. So I guess I'll call you and we'll arrange another evening.

name: Leslie
line: Yes. I believe protocol dictates that you wait a minimum of 18 hours before you call so I'm not repulsed by your cloying eagerness.

name: Leonard
line: Sure.

name: Leslie
line: Again, it's your decision, you're the man.

name: Penny
line: No, it wasn't my cat, it was an experiment designed by this guy named Schrodinger.

line: From the Charlie Brown cartoons?

name: Penny
line: No, he was some kind of scientist, let me start again. Oh, hey Leonard.

line: Hello.

name: Penny

line: Hi.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, well, goodnight.

name: Penny
line: Okay, well, goodnight.

line: That ain't going to make your point.  Okay, that's enough.  Call me

name: Leonard
line: Right

name: Penny
line: Okay, goodnight.

name: Eric

name: Penny
line: Had a great time, ciao

name: Sheldon
line: I'm sorry, I am not going back to the Renaissance Fair.

name: Howard
line: Come on, Sheldon, there's so few places I can wear my jester costume.

name: Sheldon
line: I don't care. There are far too many historical anomalies for my comfort.

name: Raj
line: Oh, okay, how about this. You can go dressed as a Star Trek science officer exploring a planet similar to Earth in the 1500s.

name: Sheldon
line: You mean like Spock?

name: Raj
line: Sure.

name: Sheldon
line: Fascinating.

name: Leslie
line: Hey fellow scientists. Sheldon.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, why don't we all move over there so Leslie can join us.

name: Howard
line: Hmm, let's do it.

name: Sheldon
line: If you're having trouble deciding where to sit may I suggest one potato two potato, or as I call it the Leslie Winkle experimental methodology.

name: Leonard
line: Don't make this hard for me.

name: Sheldon
line: It's not hard. It's simple. You can either sit with me, your friend, colleague and roommate, or you can sit with an overrated scientist you might have sex with.

line: You're right, it is simple.

name: Penny
line: Hey, Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Penny.

name: Penny
line: Third floor tonight. Mixing it up?  Oh. You know, I still don't understand why you just don't go to dinner or something.

name: Sheldon
line: Alright, let's say I go to dinner alone. And during the meal I have to use the rest room. How do I know someone's not touching my food?

name: Penny
line: Goodnight Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Penny, hold on. Are you sure things can't work out with you and Leonard?

name: Penny
line: Excuse me?

name: Sheldon
line: I'm just wondering if you really gave it the old college try? Or in your case the old community college try?

name: Penny
line: Okay, where is this coming from?

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard is upstairs right now with my arch enemy.

name: Penny
line: Your arch enemy?

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, the Doctor Doom to my Mr Fantastic. The Doctor Octopus to my Spiderman. The Doctor Sivana to my Captain Marvel.

name: Penny
line: Okay, I get it, I get it, I get it.

name: Sheldon
line: Do you know, it's amazing how many supervillains have advanced degrees. Graduate school should probably do a better job of screening those people out.

name: Penny
line: Sheldon, come back, you're losing me.

name: Sheldon
line: Leslie Winkle, Penny. She belittles my research.

name: Penny
line: Oh, sweetie, I'm sorry.

name: Sheldon
line: She called me dumbass.

name: Penny
line: I know. I heard.

name: Sheldon
line: Given this situation, I have no choice but to withdraw my previous objections to your ill considered relationship with Leonard.

name: Penny
line: Oh, gee, well, thankyou for that. But, um, I think for now Leonard and I are just going to stay friends.

name: Sheldon
line: No, that response is unacceptable to me.

name: Penny
line: Sheldon, you are a smart guy, you must know...

name: Sheldon
line: Smart? I'd have to lose 60 IQ points to be classified as smart.

name: Penny
line: Are you going to let me talk?

name: Sheldon
line: I'm sorry.

name: Penny
line: You must know that if Leonard and Leslie want to be together, nothing you can do is going to stop it.

name: Sheldon
line: You continue to underestimate my abilities madam.

name: Penny
line: Okay, let me put it this way, if you're really Leonard's friend you will support him no matter who he wants to be with.

name: Sheldon
line: Wait a minute, why am I doing all the giving here? If Leonard's really my friend, why doesn't he have to support me in my hatred of Leslie Winkle?

name: Penny
line: Because love trumps hate.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh now you're just making stuff up.

name: Penny
line: Okay. Goodnight Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh Mario. If only I could control everyone the way I control you. Hop, you little plumber, hop, hop, hop.

name: Sheldon
line: When the two of you reach a natural stopping point I'd like to have a word.

name: Leonard
line: If the word is pee-pee, just do it.

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard, you are my friend. And friends support their friends, apparently. So I am withdrawing my objection to your desire to have a relationship with Leslie.

name: Leonard
line: Thank you.

name: Sheldon
line: I will graciously overlook the fact that she is an arrogant sub-par scientist, who actually believes loop quantum gravity better unites quantum mechanics with general relativity than does string theory. You kids have fun.

name: Leslie
line: Hang on a second. Loop quantum gravity clearly offers more testable predictions than string theory.

name: Sheldon
line: I'm listening, amuse me.

name: Leslie
line: Okay, well, for one thing we expect quantii space-time to manifest itself as minute differences in the speed of light for different colours.

name: Sheldon
line: Balderdash. Matter clearly consists of tiny strings.

name: Leslie
line: Are you going to let him talk to me like that?

name: Leonard
line: Okay, well, there is a lot of merit to both theories.

name: Leslie
line: No there isn't, only loop quantum gravity calculates the entropy of black holes.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, don't make that noise, it's disrespectful.

name: Sheldon
line: I hope so, it was a snort of derision.

name: Leslie
line: You agree with me, right, loop quantum gravity is the future of physics.

name: Leonard
line: Sorry Leslie, I guess I prefer my space stringy not loopy.

name: Leslie
line: Well, I'm glad I found out the truth about you before this went any further.

name: Leonard
line: Truth, what truth? We're talking about untested hypotheses, uh, it's no big deal.

name: Leslie
line: Oh, it isn't, really? Tell me Leonard, how would we raise the children?

name: Leonard
line: I guess we let them wait until they're old enough and let them choose their own theory.

name: Leslie
line: We can't let them choose, Leonard, they're children.

name: Leonard
line: Wait, where are you going?

name: Leslie
line: I'm sorry, I could have accepted our kids being genetically unable to eat ice-cream or ever get a good view of a parade, but this? This is a deal breaker.

name: Sheldon
line: Look on the bright side.

name: Leonard
line: What's the bright side?

name: Sheldon
line: Only nine more months to comic-con.

name: Leonard
line: Oh yeah.

name: Sheldon
line: Captain, I'm getting an unusual reading.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, that's great, you guys want corn dogs?

name: Howard
line: Yeah.

name: Sheldon
line: That's a temporal anomaly. Corn dogs didn't come into existence until the first half of the twentieth century.

name: Sheldon
line: Hu-u-u-uh.... Hu-u-u-uh!

name: Leonard
line: Problem?

name: Sheldon
line: This is Thai food.

name: Howard
line: Here we go.

name: Sheldon
line: We don't have Thai food on Thursday. We have pizza on Thursday.

name: Leonard
line: Yes, but we all agreed that the third Thursday of every month would be Anything Can Happen Thursday.

name: Sheldon
line: Well apparently the news didn't reach my digestive system, which, when startled, has its own version of Anything Can Happen Thursday.

name: Howard
line: Come on, the whole idea behind Anything Can Happen Thursday is to get out of this rut we've been in lately.

name: Sheldon
line: Rut? I think you mean consistency. And if we're going to abandon that, then why even call it Thursday? Let's call it Quonko Day and divide it into 29 hours of 17 minutes apiece, and celebrate it by sacrificing a goat to the mighty god Ra.

name: Raj
line: I could go for some goat.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, we agreed we'd do something different tonight.

name: Sheldon
line: All right. Let's go to the comic book store.

name: Raj
line: We went to the comic book store last night.

name: Sheldon
line: Last night was Wednesday. Wednesday is comic book night. Tonight, we'll be going on Thursday, because it's Anything Can Happen Thursday.

name: Leonard
line: Way to think outside but pressed right up against the box, Sheldon.

name: Raj
line: So what are we going to do tonight?

name: Howard
line: If I may proffer a suggestion, in bars all across this great nation of ours, Thursday night is Ladies' Night. Which means, as the evening progresses, we will get better looking courtesy of 99 cent margaritas and two-for-one Jell-O shots.

name: Leonard
line: Come on, Howard, the odds of us picking up girls in a bar are practically zero.

name: Howard
line: Really? Are you familiar with the Drake Equation?

name: Sheldon
line: The one that estimates the odds of making contact with extraterrestrials by calculating the product of an increasingly restrictive series of fractional values such as those stars with planets, and those planets likely to develop life? N equals R times FP times NE times FL times FI times FC times L?

name: Howard
line: Yeah, that one. You can modify it to calculate our chances of having sex by changing the formula to use the number of single women in Los Angeles, the number of those who might find us attractive, and what I call the Wolowitz Coefficient.

name: Raj
line: The Wolowitz Coefficient?

name: Howard
line: Neediness times dress size squared. Crunching the numbers, I come up with a conservative 5,812 potential sex partners within a 40-mile radius.

name: Leonard
line: You're joking.

line: I'm a horny engineer, Leonard. I never joke about math or sex.

line: Well, what are we waiting for? Let's bounce, bitches.
