name: Leonard
line: Okay, well, this time it's going to be different. Because I am like a romance ninja. You don't see it coming, and then bam, romance, watch out, hearts, kisses, love, ooh-ya!

line: You know, sometimes I think I've made you so much cooler than you used to be, and then you go and do that.

name: Sheldon
line: So, in conclusion, I believe the painful sensation felt after passing a meal of spicy chillies is proof that the rectum does possess the sense of taste.

line: Oh, you caught that, did you?

line: Ah, Alex, excellent. I have a research problem that I believe you can help with.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, I guess those chaps will have to have someone else buy their girlfriends presents. Now, here is, let's see, this is, this is about two thousand dollars, um, I think she likes monkeys and the colour grey. Contribute to my work. Ah, kids say the darnedest things.

line: You can't find a card that says that?

line: Check it out. I used the atomic force microscope in the material science lab and wrote our initials in a heart one one-thousandth the size of a grain of sand.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, that's cool.

line: From her micro-husband. That is amazing. How long did this take you?

line: Oh, wow.

line: Oh, I'm going to take her to a nice restaurant for dinner.

line: Okay. Amy will be here shortly, expecting the perfect Valentine's gift, so, you're up kid. Dazzle me. Go.

name: Alex
line: Okay, I think I have some really great choices. I went on Amy's Facebook page and read up on her interests.

name: Sheldon
line: Now, see, I never would have thought to do that. Clearly, I made a good choice farming this out to you. But I am telling you, Amy hit the boyfriend jackpot. Anyway, my socks are on. Let's knock them off.

name: Alex
line: Well, um, I know she loves playing the harp, so I found this beautiful music box that plays one of her favourite songs.

line: Now, Amy already has a real harp. And it can play any song. What are you trying to pull here?

name: Alex
line: No, I just thought it would be...

name: Sheldon

name: Alex
line: Okay. Um, I know she's a fan of The Canterbury Tales.

name: Sheldon
line: Mmm.

name: Alex
line: So I found this cool map that illustrates the character's journey through England. I thought we could put it in a really nice frame.

name: Sheldon
line: But she's got Google Maps on her phone.

name: Alex

name: Sheldon
line: Well, I hope it's with a third good option, because these first two, buh.

name: Alex
line: Okay. Well, uh, luckily, I saved the best for last. Since Amy's a neuroscientist, I did some research and found out that Santiago Ramon y Cajal, the father of modern neuroscience, did lots of hand drawings of brain cells. And I managed to find this signed print.

name: Sheldon

line: She hid my Xbox like I'm a child. Yeah, and my mom got me that for my birthday, so if you don't give it back, I'm telling.

line: I said I'm sorry.

name: Amy

line: Yes, and as you know, I planned to pretend to enjoy it. I've been working on this facial expression all day.

name: Amy

line: Well, I thought, if I have a stroke or a kidney stone, who would I want to share that with?

name: Sheldon

name: Amy

name: Penny

line: Yep. You know what? That was pretty crappy of you. I mean, all I wanted to do was give you a great night, and it's like you-you went out of your way to destroy it.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, you're gonna have to make a lot more sense than that.

name: Penny

name: Leonard
line: Glaringly obvious. Go on.

name: Penny
line: As long as things keep going great between us, you'll keep asking me to marry you, and eventually I'm gonna end up saying yes, and then we're gonna be married forever, and the whole thing just freaks me out.

name: Leonard
line: Okay. I know I propose a lot. So how about this? I promise I will never ask you to marry me again.

name: Penny

name: Leonard
line: And I'm cool with surprises. But nothing on a Jumbotron. I don't want to cry on a big screen like that.

name: Penny

name: Raj
line: I got to tell you, we've got to stop beating ourselves up like this. Excuse me, everybody. Can I have your attention, please? We're all here tonight because we have no one to be with. But that doesn't make us mutants. The only mutants here are in these comic books. We've got to stop defining our self-worth by whether or not we're in a relationship. You know what I see when I look around? I see a room full of great people. So let's give ourselves a break. We are a community, and as long as we have each other, we're never truly alone.

Sheldon, I am not driving over there again. Because I drove over there yesterday for a brain tumour that turned out to be an ice cream headache. Yes, I still want to be your emergency contact. Yes, you can eat your ice cream too fast and also have a brain tumour. I'm on my way. Brain tumour would explain a lot.

name: Raj
line: So then I went to Cambridge, which was wonderful not only because it's a good school but because it totally looks like Hogwarts. That's where I fell in love with astronomy, and now I'm an astrophysicist at Caltech, so I guess you could say, uh, Raj is my name and stars are my game. And rhyming is also my game. So, uh, two games. Uh, anyway, that, that's enough about me. I want to hear everything about you.

name: Girl
line: I have to go to the bathroom.

name: Raj
line: I go to the bathroom, too. Sometimes more frequently than I care to admit. Oh, I've had it checked out, it's nothing. Hmm. This is going great. Mmm, can I have a refill on my chai tea? Yes, I have a good feeling about this.  I should have bought condoms.

name: Sheldon
line: Hello, I'm Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Welcome to Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. My apologies that this episode is coming late. I did shoot one last week, in honour of Black History Month, but I was informed by my roommate that my spot-on portrayal of George Washington Carver could be considered wildly racist. My heart goes out to the members of the African-American community, who, like me, have been kept down by The Man. Now, Fun with Flags is not just for the flag aficionado, it's also for the flag novice, so, to help me with that, please welcome my friend, neighbour, and flag virgin, yeah, not a real virgin. She's had coitus many times. Sometimes within earshot of this flag enthusiast. Once while he was trying to watch The Incredibles. Penny.

name: Penny
line: Hello.

name: Sheldon
line: So, Penny, I understand you would like to learn more about flags.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, I can't tell you how many times I've been at a party where everyone's talking about flags and I just couldn't join in.

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah. Well, you came to the right place.

name: Penny
line: Uh, I'm sorry, can we just pause for a minute?

name: Sheldon
line: What's wrong?

name: Penny
line: I just think it might look more natural if you talked to me instead of the camera, you know, like, like a real conversation. It's something we work on in my acting class.

name: Sheldon
line: Interesting. A few people in the comments section have said that my delivery is robotic. Perhaps that isn't the compliment it sounds like.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, let's try it again, and maybe, this time, you could work on your body language a bit. You know, when you're all hunched like that, you're shutting the audience out, but when you're relaxed and open, you're inviting them in.

name: Sheldon
line: Right. And which one do I want?

name: Penny
line: Let's try open.

name: Sheldon
line: If our friend, the flag, has taught me anything, it's to go where the wind takes you. As long as you remain firmly attached to a rigid pole. And, action. So, Penny, what sort of flag questions keep you awake at night?

name: Penny
line: Um, well, I'm from Nebraska. So what can you tell me about the state flag?

name: Sheldon
line: Gosh, Penny, what'd you have for breakfast? A big glass of good question juice? The Nebraska state flag is simply the state seal on a field of blue. Spread your legs, invite them in.

line: I'm telling you, something's wrong. I can always feel it when Raj is in trouble.

name: Leonard
line: Whoa.

name: Leonard

line: Oh, you poor baby.

line: We could go to Red Lobster and talk about it. We're all thinking it. I just had the decency to wait for him to leave.

line: Hello, Sheldon.

line: Hello. How's the final stage of your nicotine addiction study going?

name: Amy
line: Fine. Just hold on. Mommy's on the phone! Sorry. We've cut the monkeys down to one cigarette a day, so things are a little intense. Makes me miss my marijuana-abusing flatworms. Those guys were mellow.

line: Good news. Uh, the latest episode of Fun with Flags is online.

line: Oh, that's right. How'd it go with Penny?

line: Much better than I expected. She even gave me some helpful tips about acting and body language. Watch. Welcome to my world. Not welcome to my world. Welcome. Not welcome.

line: You need me to shut the door so you can do your knocking thing?

name: Sheldon
line: No. I didn't start yet, it's fine.

name: Penny
line: Okay. So, what do you need?

name: Sheldon
line: Well, I was thinking about you helping me out last night  Penny. And I just wanted to tell you  Penny, that the answer to the question, who did a great job? is you,  Penny.

name: Penny
line: Really?

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, you were very natural in front of the camera, and I found your suggestions extremely helpful.

name: Penny
line: Aw, sweetie, you just made my day.

name: Sheldon
line: Okay.

name: Penny
line: Hey, my acting class is putting on a play Friday night. I could put you and Amy on the guest list.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, that sounds terrible. Why would I want to do that?

name: Amy
line: That's right. They're no good without the lighter.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, so much for your advice on complimenting Penny.

name: Amy
line: Why? What happened?

name: Sheldon
line: She tried to rope us into going to her acting class to see a play. Don't worry. Luckily, I had the good sense to drown that kitten in the river.

name: Amy
line: Sheldon, that's very rude. She helped you with your show. The right thing to do is reciprocate by going to see her play.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, so many crazy rules.

name: Amy
line: That better be Tootsie Rolls you're throwing at me!

name: Sheldon
line: Penny.  Penny.  Penny. Oh yeah, much better.

name: Penny
line: What?

name: Sheldon
line: Amy pointed out to me that since you did something nice for me, I'm obligated to do something nice for you. So, yes, I'll go to your dopey play.

name: Penny
line: Hey, I don't want you to go any more.

name: Sheldon
line: Why not?

name: Penny
line: You should go 'cause you want to go, not because you have to.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, Dear Lord, more rules? Where does it stop? Can I want to go because I have to want to go?

name: Penny
line: Okay. Do whatever you want.

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, but now, wait. Do whatever I want? Or whatever I have to want?

name: Penny
line: Oh, for God's sake, just come to the play.

name: Sheldon
line: All right. I don't want to, but at least that makes sense.

name: Sheldon
line: You know, I haven't seen Raj in several days. Is he no longer a part of our social group? And if so, should we be interviewing for a replacement? Perhaps, this time, we go Latin.

name: Howard
line: He's just decided he's never leaving his apartment again.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, brilliant. I've been itching to pull that trigger.

name: Howard
line: He's upset because he can't get anywhere with women.

name: Sheldon
line: Would it help if I gave him some pointers? I'm just funnin' ya.

name: Girl
line: Hi. I don't know if you remember me, but I was here the other night at your party.

name: Stuart
line: Oh, yeah, you left with Raj.

name: Girl
line: Uh, yeah.

name: Howard
line: You're the one? Okay, let me tell you something. That guy you blew off happens to be my best friend. Okay? He was devastated.

name: Girl
line: Sorry. Can you just give him this?

name: Howard
line: Okay. But I gotta warn you, Raj is a proud, passionate man. If you go running out on him again, you're only gonna get, like, three or four more chances before you are history.

name: Howard
line: Come on, she came back. This is good news. You should celebrate.

name: Raj
line: I don't want to celebrate.

name: Howard
line: Not even a little? I mean, we could have a pants party. Go put some on.

name: Raj
line: Why would I want her number? I don't want anything to do with this woman.

name: Howard
line: Oh, come on, Raj.

name: Raj
line: No, you don't get it. I want nothing to do with any woman. My heart is stone. From now on, I'm a monk. I renounce all worldly pleasures. Except for lobster. And garlic butter.

name: Howard
line: Boy, I want to tell you it's her loss, but you are not making it easy.

name: Raj
line: You're, you're a good friend for trying to help, but, I've made my choice.

name: Howard
line: All right. Well, I'll see you around.

name: Raj
line: See you. No, wait, take her number. I don't want the temptation.

name: Howard
line: Okay.

name: Raj
line: I must be strong so I don't stray from my true purpose, the study of the universe.

name: Howard
line: All right. Thanks for ruining lobster for me.

name: Raj
line: Wait! Give me the number! Give me the number! Give me the number!

name: Leonard
line: So, Amy, what's going on with your addiction study?

name: Amy
line: Sadly, I'm no longer associated with that project.

name: Leonard
line: Why? What happened?

name: Amy
line: Typical bureaucratic nonsense. You can get animals addicted to a harmful substance, you can dissect their brains, but you throw their own faeces back at them and suddenly you're unprofessional.

name: Leonard
line: I'm sorry. That I asked.

name: Sheldon
line: All right, let's get this stupid play over with.

name: Leonard
line: Uh, hang on. Empty your pockets.

name: Sheldon
line: Why?

name: Leonard
line: You know why. The Nintendo DS. And the PSP. Now the Gameboy.

name: Sheldon
line: Aw, for Pete's sake. Can we go now?

name: Leonard
line: Well, is that all of it?  Just set it down.

name: Amy
line: Just so you know, this is not a stupid play. A Streetcar Named Desire is an American classic.

name: Sheldon
line: It's about streetcars? Oh, great. I won't need this.

name: Raj
line: Just a sec. Oh, who says just a sec? I hate myself. Hello.

name: Girl
line: Hi.

name: Raj
line: Uh, would you like to come in?

name: Girl
line: Oh, no, I can't stay.

name: Raj
line: Oh.

name: Girl
line: I just wanted to say, I'm sorry for running out of the coffee shop. That wasn't cool. So, uh, yeah. I'm sorry.

name: Raj
line: Wait. Can you at least tell me what went wrong? It's okay. I can take anything. Unless it's something I did, or said, or am. ‘Cause those are, like, my buttons.

name: Girl
line: No, it's not any of that. It's just, I kind of have a hard time around people I don't know.

name: Raj
line: Really? Then what were you doing at the comic book store that night?

name: Girl
line: I've been trying to force myself into situations that I'm not comfortable with. I saw the flyer in the store window, and I made myself go in. I don't even like comic books.

name: Raj
line: Yeah, me neither.

name: Girl
line: Then what were you doing there?

name: Raj
line: I lied. I love them. I only said that so you'd go out with me.

name: Girl
line: Oh, you don't want to do that. I'm kind of broken.

name: Raj
line: That's great. I'm broken, too.

name: Girl
line: Oh, no, you're not.

name: Raj
line: Oh, I totally am. If it wasn't for this beer, I couldn't even talk to you right now. I'm a wreck. There are many things seriously wrong with me. And not quirks, either. Like, diagnosable psychological problems. Maybe brain damage.

name: Girl
line: Well, how do I know you're not just saying that?

name: Raj
line: Go out with me on one date, and I promise you, you'll see.

name: Girl
line: Okay. Text me. Bye.

name: Raj
line: You won't regret it. I'm the most pathetic guy you've ever met. And that, boys and girls, is how it's done.

name: Penny
line: You love her very much, don't you?

name: Actor
line: Yes.

name: Penny
line: I think you have a great capacity for devotion. You'll be lonely when she passes on, won't you? I understand what that is.

name: Actor
line: To be lonely?

name: Leonard
line: She's pretty good, huh?

name: Sheldon
line: She is. But when do they get to the part about streetcars?

name: Penny
line: ...when I was a very young girl. When I was 16 years old, I made the discovery, love. All at once, and much, much too completely. It was like you suddenly turned a blinding light on something that had always been half a shadow. That's how it struck the world for me. But I was unlucky. Deluded.

name: Sheldon
line: She's remarkable.

name: Leonard
line: She really is.

name: Amy
line: Our Penny's a star.

name: Sheldon
line: How can she remember all those lines, but as a waitress, she can't remember no tomato on my hamburger?

name: Leonard
line: Look, I know you guys don't want to do this, but we have no choice. So, you can either bitch and whine or we can just get it over with.

name: Howard
line: I got whine.

name: Sheldon
line: I got the B word.

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, well, it's in our contract to serve on a university committee. And frankly, this is one I believe in. Okay, here we go. Encouraging more women to pursue a career in the sciences.

name: Howard
line: Come on, if I was any good at convincing women to do stuff, I wouldn't have spent so much of my twenties in the shower.

name: Sheldon
line: If you ask me, this whole thing is a waste of our time.

name: Leonard
line: Helping women? Y

name: Sheldon
line: Helping anyone. People should take care of themselves.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, like yesterday, when you made me drive you to the dry cleaners, the pharmacy and the post office?

name: Sheldon
line: I'm not saying people can't use tools. Even an otter picks up a rock when he wants a clam.

name: Leonard
line: You don't think it's worthwhile to try to get more women working in science.

name: Sheldon
line: I think that's incredibly sexist of you. I believe in a gender-blind society like in Star Trek, where women and men of all races and creeds work side by side as equals.

name: Leonard
line: You mean where they were advanced enough to invent an interstellar warp drive, but a black lady still answered the space phone?

name: Howard
line: Oh, I did spend a lot of my shower time with Lieutenant Uhura.

name: Sheldon
line: Howard's disturbing recollections aside, I don't appreciate being forced to do banal committee work.

name: Leonard
line: Yes, I know, you're too smart for this.

name: Sheldon
line: Exactly. It's like asking the Human Torch to heat up your frozen burrito.

name: Leonard
line: Got it. All right, I'm thinking one way to counter bias in the peer-review process, is for papers to be submitted under gender-neutral names. Like S. Smith instead of Samantha Smith.

name: Sheldon
line: I suppose there is a history of professional women using their initials so as not to be pre-judged. Harry Potter's J.K. Rowling, uh, Star Trek's D.C. Fontana.

name: Howard
line: Van Nuys pole-dancer D.D. Melons. All right, I think we've really helped women today. Let's fire up the old Xbox.

name: Leonard
line: Guys, please don't make this a school project where I'm the smart kid doing all the work while the slackers sit back and watch.

name: Sheldon
line: We're not. This time you're the smart kid doing all the work while the even smarter kids sit back and watch.

name: Howard
line: So, you think I'm one of the smarter kids?

name: Sheldon
line: No, you're a tool I was using to make my point.

name: Leonard
line: Guys, our topic is encouraging women in science, can you at least play a less sexist game

name: Sheldon
line: How is it sexist? My character wields a battle axe as well as any man.

name: Howard
line: Not to mention she has mammary glands that could nurse a family of 30. And have enough milk left over to open a Baskin Robbins.

name: Sheldon
line: Mother, warrior-princess, franchise owner, I hear glass ceilings shattering all over town.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, you're always saying how much smarter you are than me. Spend five seconds and come up with one idea on how to get more women into science.

name: Sheldon
line: All your ideas address the issue at a university level. By then it's too late. You need to design an outreach program that targets girls at the middle school level and sets them on an academic track towards the hard sciences.

name: Leonard
line: That's actually good. Why didn't I think of that?

name: Sheldon
line: Some people are otters, some people are rocks.

name: Leonard
line: I wonder if there's a way we could give the idea a trial run.

name: Howard
line: Maybe I could call my old middle school, see if we can talk to some of the female students.

name: Leonard
line: That's great, try to set up something for the three of us to go over there.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, hold on. While I'm comfortable speaking about science, I'm not sure I know how to spark the interest of schoolchildren. Better Google it.

name: Howard
line: What exactly are you looking up?

name: Sheldon
line: How do I get 12-year-old girls excited.

name: Leonard and Howard
line: No!

name: Raj
line: Thanks again for letting me crash girls' night.

name: Penny
line: Are you kidding? You brought fancy wine and made fondue. I've slept with guys for less. It's a joke. Based on real events.

name: Raj
line: Anyway, I was hoping I could, uh, pick your brains a little. I'm supposed to take Lucy out Friday and I need a killer first date.

name: Amy
line: Well, evolutionary biology says that women are attracted to a man who is steady n the face of danger, so I recommend an unsafe environment. Seedy bar on the wrong side of the tracks, picnic near a lunatic asylum, a wine tasting on Skid Row.

name: Raj
line: Uh, Lucy has some, uh, social anxiety issues. Maybe we could start with something simpler.

name: Bernadette
line: Why don't you take her to Disneyland? You go on Space Mountain, you're in the dark, she's holding onto you.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, but you just have to remember, that ride is shorter than you think and they take a picture of you at the end, so make sure you got your clothes back on. It's a joke. Based on real events.

name: Raj
line: Mm, Disneyland? I don't know. With all the crowds and the weird characters walking around, just reminds me too much of India.

name: Amy
line: I haven't been to Disneyland since I was a kid. We should definitely go one weekend.

name: Bernadette
line: Weekends are too crowded.

name: Penny
line: So, blow off work, go on a weekday.

name: Amy
line: Hooky? I've never played hooky in my life. My mom said that's how girls end up addicted to reefer and jazz music.

name: Penny
line: It's more like how girls end up at a Best Western hotel with a 34-year-old guy named Luther.

name: Bernadette
line: Joke?

name: Penny
line: I can laugh about it now.

name: Bernadette
line: So, what do you say? This Friday we ditch work and go to Disneyland?

name: Penny
line: I'm in.

name: Amy
line: Me, too.

name: Raj
line: Excuse me, I thought we were trying to solve my problem?

name: Penny
line: Oh, yeah, right. Wait, what was your problem again?

name: Raj
line: I am a man who can't talk to women, trying to figure out how to go on a romantic date with a girl who suffers from such crippling social anxiety she can't be around other people.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, that's a toughie.

name: Bernadette
line: Let's think.

name: Amy
line: Hmm. We doing just Disney or California Adventure, too?

name: Leonard
line: It's nice of your old school to let us try out our science talk on some female students.

name: Howard
line: Well, they're actually pretty excited. I'm their most famous alum. If you don't count the serial killer who ate all those prostitutes.

name: Sheldon
line: This must feel pretty good for you, coming back to your alma mater as an astronaut.

name: Howard
line: Yeah, last time I was here, I was just a scrawny little nerd.

name: Leonard
line: And now you're also an astronaut.

name: Howard
line: So many memories. I mean, how many times in these hallways was I tripped, punched and spit on? Oh, look, here's my old locker. I have a masters in engineering and I still can't figure out how Scott Kapinski got me and my briefcase to fit in there.  Hey.

name: Kid
line: What?

name: Howard
line: Nothing.

name: Sheldon
line: Smart. We don't want any problems.

name: Amy
line: I can't believe I ditched work for Disneyland.

name: Bernadette
line: What did you tell your boss?

name: Amy
line: Oh, I was very clever, I did it in stages. At seven o'clock last night, I called about a problem at the lab and casually mentioned I was going out for seafood. At nine thirty, I called and told him that one of my scallops tasted weird. At eleven thirty, I called and said I was throwing up like a fire hose. At twelve forty-five, I called and made nothing but dry heaving sounds, and now I'm going to Disneyland.

name: Bernadette
line: Penny, what did you say?

name: Penny
line: I work at the Cheesecake Factory, I said bye.

name: Amy
line: So, what are we gonna do first?

name: Bernadette
line: I don't know about you guys, but I'm gonna make a beeline for the place that gives you a princess makeover.

name: Amy
line: Ooh, that sounds like fun.

name: Penny
line: You're kidding, right? We're not just gonna get drunk and go on rides?

name: Amy
line: Come on, do it with us.

name: Penny
line: All right, whatever. How does it work?

name: Bernadette
line: Okay, so, you pick your princess, Sleeping Beauty, Snow White, Cinderella, they give you hair, makeup, the works.

name: Penny
line: Guess it would be fun to be Cinderella.

name: Amy
line: Oh, I want to be Cinderella, too.

name: Penny
line: Yeah.

name: Bernadette
line: We can't all be Cinderella.

name: Amy
line: Then how do we decide?

name: Bernadette
line: Well, it's simple. This was my idea. I'm driving. I'm Cinderella. You bitches got a problem with that, we could stop the car right now.

name: Raj
line: Excuse me, I'm meeting a girl here. It's kind of our first date.

name: Man
line: In a library?

name: Raj
line: She and I are both a little awkward in social situations, so this seemed like a good idea.

name: Man
line: People say I'm a little awkward, too. May I join you?

name: Raj
line: No, you can't join us. Just go, go climb back up whatever beanstalk you came down from.

name: Man
line: You can do better.

name: Lucy
line: Oh, we're eating here?  We're having a texting date?  I love that.

name: Raj
line: As you're reading, it will help to remember I have an adorable accent.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, who's ready for some science? Me, too. Okay, I am Dr. Leonard Hofstadter. I am here with my friends Dr. Cooper and real-life astronaut Howard Wolowitz, and we are going to show you girls how cool a job in science can be. How cool, you ask? Well, how about negative 273 degrees, 'cause that's the temperature at which entropy reaches its minimum value. Did I just learn something new and have fun doing it? What? All right. So now let's bring out theoretical physicist Dr. Sheldon Cooper.

name: Sheldon
line: Hello, female children. Allow me to inspire you with a story about a great female scientist. Polish-born, French-educated Madame Curie. Co-discoverer of radioactivity, she was a hero of science, until her hair fell out, her vomit and stool became filled with blood, and she was poisoned to death by her own discovery. With a little hard work, I see no reason why that can't happen to any of you. Are we done? Can we go?

name: Howard
line: The thing to remember is you can go to outer space, too. I mean, look at me. I went to this very school. Those desks you're sitting in, I was once superglued to one of them.

name: Girl
line: Did you go to the moon?

name: Howard
line: No, but I did go to the International Space Station.

name: Girl
line: Did you fly the rocket?

name: Howard
line: No, but I was in the rocket. I didn't actually...

name: Girl
line: So you just flew around? That's kind of like my uncle. He's a flight attendant.

name: Howard
line: No, I'm an American hero. Your uncle brings people nuts, okay?

name: Leonard
line: Alright, alright. Boy, we are learning a lot here, huh? Thank you, astronaut Howard. Um, I am what's called an experimental physicist, which is super-fun, because I get to test theories and work with lasers. Yes?

name: Girl 2
line: How did you decide to become a scientist?

name: Leonard
line: Uh, excellent question. Um, I suppose I've always been into science, you know. My mother and father are scientists, so I was kind of led in that direction. Uh, pushed might be a better way to describe it. To be honest with you guys, when I was your age, I wanted to be a rap star. Like Snoop Dogg, but with a healthy respect for the police. Yeah, no, sure, you laugh. Just like my mother did. After I confided, I was derided and chided, my moms and I collided. She said my dreams were misguided. That's just a little freestyle.

name: Raj
line: My dad's a gynaecologist in India, so if you're over there and need a check up, as he likes to say, he's at your cervix.

name: Lucy
line: That's terrible. Your dad should be sent to the pun-itentiary.

name: Raj
line: That's a fitting pun-ishment. I still don't know what you do for a living.

name: Lucy
line: Web design.

name: Raj
line: Anything I might have seen?

name: Lucy
line: I don't know. You ever look at porn Web sites?

name: Raj
line: No, never. What is porn?

name: Lucy
line: Sorry. Autocorrect. That was supposed to say prom Web sites.

name: Raj
line: Ooh, fun. I love prom. The romance, the gowns, it's like a fairy tale come to life. Sorry. Autocorrect. That was supposed to say, I like sports.

name: Leonard
line: I never wanted to play the cello. How do you meet girls playing the cello? Hey, you want to come over to my house and listen to me play an instrument that sounds like a suicidal bumblebee?

name: Howard
line: Quick, pull the fire alarm. Let's get out of here.

name: Sheldon
line: Uh, hello again. Um, yeah, I don't know if women in general have been actively discouraged from pursuing the sciences, but it's clear you young women here, today, have been. While I was listening to my colleagues waste your time, it occurred to me that it might be much more meaningful to hear about women in science from actual women in science, and, uh, I happen to know two brilliant examples who have agreed to speak to you on the phone right now. Uh, Dr. Rostenkowski, Dr. Fowler, are you there?

name: Amy
line: We're here.

name: Sheldon
line: Thank you for taking time out of your very busy schedule to enlighten these young women.

name: Amy
line: It's our pleasure. I'm Dr. Fowler, and I'm a neuroscientist.

name: Bernadette
line: And I'm Dr. Rostenkowski Wolowitz, and I'm a microbiologist.

name: Amy
line: The world of science needs more women, but from a young age, we girls are encouraged to care more about the way we look than about the power of our minds.

name: Bernadette
line: That's true. Every one of you has the capacity to be anything you want to be.

name: Penny
line: Unless you want to be Cinderella.

name: Bernadette
line: Come at me. See what happens.

name: Raj
line: This was really fun.

name: Lucy
line: My battery's dying, so I'm just gonna talk. Thanks for today. I've been trying to do more things that scare me, and coming here was definitely one of them. But it was also really nice. So thanks, and, um, I'm gonna go. Maybe I could do one more scary thing before I go and give you a kiss good-bye? You know, if that's okay. Okay. Panic attack. Maybe next time.

name: Raj
line: I'm counting that as foreplay.

name: Howard
line: Bernie, I'm home. You have fun today?

name: Bernadette
line: Yes, and I have a surprise for you.

name: Howard
line: Please be Cinderella. Please be Cinderella.

name: Bernadette
line: Well, hello, Prince Charming.

name: Howard
line: Milady.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, how was your... what?

name: Penny
line: I can explain. I played hooky with the girls, then we all went to Disneyland and got... What are you doing?

name: Leonard
line: Disneyland. Go on, I'm listening.

name: Amy
line: Sheldon, all Snow White needs is one little kiss to wake up.

name: Sheldon
line: Heard you the first time.

name: Bernadette
line: What you doing?

name: Howard
line: You said clean up. I'm cleaning up.

name: Bernadette
line: You can't just throw everything in the closet.

name: Howard
line: Hey, you can tell me what to do or you can tell me how to do it, but you can't do both. This isn't sex.

name: Bernadette
line: What if someone looks in there?

name: Howard
line: They're just coming over for dinner. No one's gonna look in the closet.

name: Bernadette
line: Well, you don't know that. What if someone's looking for the bathroom and they open that door?

name: Howard
line: Could work out. For all we know there's a toilet in there somewhere.

name: Bernadette
line: Fine. But after tonight we need to get a handle on this mess.

name: Howard
line: You know what we should do? We should show the closet to Sheldon.

name: Bernadette
line: Why?

name: Howard
line: Are you kidding? He's like a savant at organizing. Everything in his apartment has a label on it. Including his label maker, which has a label that says label maker. And if you look really close at that label maker label, you'll see a label that says label.

name: Bernadette
line: He's our guest, we can't just ask him to straighten our closet.

name: Howard
line: No, we wouldn't ask him. We'd just show him the closet and let the goblins in his head take it from there.

name: Howard
line: Hey, guys, come on in.

name: All
line: Hi.

name: Penny
line: Ooh, it smells good.

name: Bernadette
line: Thanks. And, Sheldon, I know tonight's the night you eat Thai food, so I went to the Asian market, got all the ingredients and made it from scratch.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, you shouldn't have.

name: Bernadette
line: Oh, it's my pleasure.

name: Sheldon
line: No, you really shouldn't have. I brought my own.

name: Bernadette
line: You stopped and got him takeout?

name: Leonard
line: I had no choice. He kept kicking the back of my seat.

name: Bernadette
line: Sheldon, I've been cooking all day.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, now don't you feel silly.

name: Bernadette
line: Show him the closet.

name: Raj
line: These spring rolls are amazing. Good job, Bernadette.

name: Bernadette
line: That's the takeout that Sheldon brought.

name: Raj
line: Oh, well, I'm sure they wouldn't have tasted nearly as good if I hadn't tried your food first.

name: Sheldon
line: Howard, did you want your clothes arranged seasonally or by colour?

name: Howard
line: Colour's fine.

name: Sheldon
line: Wrong, they'll be arranged seasonally.

name: Penny
line: Sheldon, aren't you gonna spend a little time with Amy?

name: Amy
line: Oh, it's okay, I'm used to it. The other day at Whole Foods, he spent an hour optimizing the cheese aisle.

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, and some thanks I got. The assistant manager chased me out with an artisanal salami.

name: Amy
line: His quirks just make you love him more. Someone please agree with me.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, come on. It's getting late. Time to go.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, five more minutes.

name: Leonard
line: That's what you said five minutes ago. Amy and Penny are already in the car. Let's move it.

name: Sheldon
line: How come I never get to do anything I want to do?

name: Howard
line: You know, if he really wants to stay and finish, I can give him a ride home.

name: Sheldon
line: Please, Leonard, he said it's okay.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, it's, wait, I can go home without you? Bye.

name: Sheldon
line: Howard, I have a few questions. I found three bowling pins. Now, do you juggle these, or are you missing seven?

name: Howard
line: Juggle.

name: Sheldon
line: You health nuts kill me.

name: Bernadette
line: Oh, my God, it's beautiful. Look, he found the juggling pins I hid.

name: Sheldon
line: Uh, just a couple more items. Howard, I found this letter from your dad in a box. Now, based on the content, it could either be filed...

name: Howard
line: Whoa, you opened this?

name: Sheldon
line: Well, I had to find out if it was personal correspondence or memorabilia. Now, as I was saying, based on the content...

name: Howard
line: I couldn't be less interested. Now, come on, I'll take you home.

name: Bernadette
line: Howard, don't you want to know what's in the letter?

name: Howard
line: If I wanted to know, I would've opened it years ago. The closet looks great. Let's get out of here.

name: Sheldon
line: Wait, can I bring this box of extra shirt buttons to sort on the ride?

name: Howard
line: Do whatever you want.

name: Sheldon
line: Thanks. Oh. Great party.

name: Leonard
line: You know, when I first met Howard, he would pull his scrotum out of his shorts and say, aw, I sat in gum.

name: Penny
line: What is your point?

name: Leonard
line: Well, it's just kind of weird how grown up he is now. Happily married guy throwing dinner parties.

name: Penny
line: Really? You couldn't just say that? You had to tell the scrotum story?

name: Leonard
line: Trying to paint a picture.

name: Penny
line: It was a nice change of pace not eating takeout around a coffee table.

name: Leonard
line: Mm, you know, we could throw a dinner party, too. Maybe even ask everyone to get dressed up.

name: Penny
line: Sure. Just, when you say dressed up, you mean nice clothes, right? Not, like, capes and tights and crap?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah. Although...

name: Penny
line: No.

name: Bernadette
line: Howie, you okay?

name: Howard
line: Yeah, I just couldn't sleep.

name: Bernadette
line: Told you you shouldn't have espresso after dinner. I know the little cups make you feel big, but it's not worth it.

name: Howard
line: It's this stupid letter.

name: Bernadette
line: Did you read it?

name: Howard
line: No.

name: Bernadette
line: You must be curious.

name: Howard
line: Of course I'm curious. I haven't seen the man since, oh, I was a little kid. And a letter shows up on my 18th birthday? What's that about?

name: Bernadette
line: Why don't you read it? Maybe he apologizes or explains why he left.

name: Howard
line: He abandoned me and my mother. Why does he deserve a chance to explain anything?

name: Bernadette
line: I get that. So, what do you want to do with it?

name: Howard
line: Something I should have done a long time ago.

name: Bernadette
line: Really? Are you sure?

name: Howard
line: Yep.

name: Bernadette
line: Feel better?

name: Howard
line: I do.  Great. Neither one of us is tall enough to reach that.

name: Amy
line: I can't believe he set it on fire.

name: Bernadette
line: Yeah, just seeing that letter really freaked him out. And he was already having a tough day 'cause he accidentally wore my pants to work. I don't know why he was upset. They were bigger on him than me.

name: Amy
line: Boy, I'm really curious what was in that letter.

name: Bernadette
line: Me, too, but I guess now we'll never know.

name: Amy
line: Well, you said Sheldon read it. Why not ask him?

name: Bernadette
line: I can't do that. What kind of wife would I be if I didn't respect my husband's privacy?

name: Penny
line: What if I ask Sheldon, you just happen to be in the room?

name: Bermadette
line: That works.

name: Penny
line: Okay.

name: Sheldon
line: Bleuch. Like cleaning out the entire building's belly button.

name: Penny
line: Hey, Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, hello. What can I do for you ladies?

name: Amy
line: You have something we want.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, dear. My mother warned me this is what happens to pretty boys in the big city.

name: Penny
line: No, we just want information.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh. Oh, I've got that in spades. Ravage me.

name: Penny
line: We heard you read the letter from Howard's father.

name: Sheldon
line: I did.

name: Penny
line: What did it say?

name: Sheldon
line: I can't tell you that. I'm bound by closet organizer/organizee confidentiality.

name: Amy
line: Sheldon, that's not a real thing.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, neither is the rule that you have to hold your girlfriend's hand at the movies. You know. That doesn't stop you from pawing at me like you're a bear and I'm a trash can full of sweets.

name: Penny
line: Why do you even care? Just tell us what it says.

name: Sheldon
line: Control over the information contained in that letter belongs to Howard. By happenstance, I came to know it. That doesn't give me the right to disseminate it freely.

name: Penny
line: Come on. Look, the letter was found in Bernadette's closet. Doesn't that count for something?

name: Sheldon
line: Are you pointing out that California is a community property state, and since Howard and Bernadette are married, the intellectual property contained in that letter is jointly owned by the two spouses?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, obviously.

name: Sheldon
line: Well played. Sometimes I don't give you enough credit, Penny.

name: Raj
line: Dude, you made the right choice coming to me for help with this party.

name: Leonard
line: Actually, all I did was invite you.

name: Raj
line: Well, put your mind at ease. I'm here to make sure your dinner party kicks Howard's dinner party's ass. Now, the first thing we need is a theme. I'm thinking, ah, turn-of-the-century Moulin Rouge.

name: Leonard
line: I'm thinking you need a testosterone patch. Penny and I just want to do something low-key. You know, cocktails, light jazz music, hors d'oeuvres.

name: Raj
line: So your theme is I saw a rerun of Mad Men and bought some crab puffs from Trader Joe's? Hate to miss that.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, where have you been?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, Leonard. If I was prone to sarcasm, I'd say I was pulling off a major heist at the museum of laundry baskets.

name: Leonard
line: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten. I meant, golly, Sheldon, you've been gone a long time.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh. Yeah, well, I was waylaid by Penny, Bernadette and Amy. They made me reveal confidential information about Howard's father.

name: Leonard
line: What information?

name: Sheldon
line: I can't tell you that. I am bound by closet organizer/organizee confidentiality.

name: Raj
line: Well, come on, we won't tell anyone.

name: Sheldon
line: Sorry, badgering me won't work. What you should have said is, It's pointless to keep this a secret because Penny will tell us.

name: Leonard
line: Fine, then that.

name: Sheldon
line: All right, I'll tell you. My goodness, everyone's on their game today.

name: Amy
line: This is really fun.

name: Raj
line: Yeah, it's nice to get dressed up once in a while.

name: Penny
line: Yeah, and the hors d'oeuvres are delightful.

name: Leonard
line: As is the company.

name: Penny
line: Aw.

name: Sheldon
line: My shirt is itchy and I wish I were dead.

name: Leonard
line: Hey, uh, listen, everybody. Before Howard gets here, et's all just agree to not bring up the letter from his father.

name: Raj
line: Of course.

name: Penny
line: Sure.

name: Amy
line: Absolutely.

name: Sheldon
line: If I say yes, can we turn off that Latin orgy music?

name: Howard
line: Ridiculous that we still have to walk up all these flights of stairs.

name: Bernadette
line: Yeah, try doing it in heels.

name: Howard
line: I am.

name: Bernadette
line: Wait. There's something I have to tell you.

name: Howard
line: What?

name: Bernadette
line: I know what was in your dad's letter.

name: Howard
line: Sheldon, I swear to God, I'm gonna kill you.

name: Amy
line: Hey.

name: Bernadette
line: I made him tell us.

name: Howard
line: What? Us? Who else knows?

name: Penny
line: I know.

name: Amy
line: Me, too.

name: Leonard
line: Same here.

name: Raj
line: Shame on all of you.

name: Leonard
line: You know, too.

name: Raj
line: Couldn't leave him one friend, could you?

name: Howard
line: So everybody knows what's in that letter except for me?

name: Sheldon
line: Yes, it's six against one. Stand down, sir.

name: Howard
line: How could you do this?

name: Bernadette
line: I'm sorry.

name: Raj
line: If you want, we could tell you.

name: Howard
line: No, I don't want to know. I mean, I do, but... I got to go.

name: Amy
line: Use me as a human shield!

name: Sheldon
line: I panicked. He looked taller than usual.

name: Bernadette
line: Howard?

name: Howard
line: In here.

name: Bernadette
line: I'm sorry. I should have left it alone.

name: Howard
line: It's okay. Sorry I ran off like that.

name: Bernadette
line: What are you looking at?

name: Howard
line: Uh, pictures of my dad and me when I was a kid.

name: Bernadette
line: That's nice.

name: Howard
line: I got to tell you, as angry as I am at Sheldon for blabbing, he did a hell of a job organizing this closet. Look at this. Photos of Wolowitz family before father left forever. Check out nine-year-old Howie with cornrows. Neither race was happy to see me with those.

name: Bernadette
line: Think you could take a break?

name: Howard
line: Why?

name: Bernadette
line: Got a little surprise for you. Come on.

name: Howard
line: Oh, honey, I am in no mood to have sex tonight. I'll lay there if you absolutely have to have it, but... Oh. What are you guys doing here?

name: Leonard
line: When you left, you weren't sure whether or not you wanted to know what was in your dad's letter, so we came up with kind of a cool solution.

name: Howard
line: Oh, yeah, what's that?

name: Sheldon
line: It's simple, really. It occurred to me that knowing and not knowing can be achieved by creating a macroscopic example of quantum superposition. The, the principle that a physical system exists partially in all its possible states at once.

name: Penny
line: We were all thinking it, really. It was kind of the elephant in the room, so...

name: Sheldon
line: Anyway, um, I realized that if we each present you with an account of what your father wrote to you, only one of which is true, and then we don't tell you which one it is, you will forever be in a state of epistemic ambivalence.

name: Penny
line: Yeah. And I said if it wasn't epistemic, we might as well not do it.

name: Bernadette
line: Sit down, honey.

name: Leonard
line: Raj, you're up.

name: Raj
line: Okay, um, It was a card for your 18th birthday. Inside it said, Happy birthday, Howard. I love you. Dad. Oh, and it was a Far Side card, the one where the frog has its tongue stuck to the underside of an airplane. Thinks it's a fly. Silly frog. So funny.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: It was a map leading to the lost treasure of famous pirate One-Eyed Willy.

name: Howard
line: Nice try. That's the plot for Goonies.

name: Amy
line: Told you.

name: Sheldon
line: Don't.

name: Leonard
line: Amy.

name: Amy
line: You didn't know it, but your father was in the auditorium at your high school graduation. And he cried because he was so proud of you.

name: Howard
line: Really?

name: Sheldon
line: Or that's complete poppycock which Amy made up. It still could be the map.

name: Leonard
line: Penny.

name: Penny
line: It was a letter explaining that your dad wasn't who he said he was. Eventually, his other life caught up to him, and the only way to keep you and your mom safe was to leave.

name: Sheldon
line: I would like to change mine. The pirate's name was Peg-Leg Antoine. Now it's completely different from Goonies.

name: Amy
line: No, it's not.

name: Sheldon
line: Don't.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, my turn. Your dad wrote about how family is the most important thing, and that you should never throw it away like he did.

name: Howard
line: Hmm.

name: Leonard
line: Bernadette.

name: Bernadette
line: Inside the envelope was a picture of your dad holding you the day you were born. On the back he wrote Howard, my son, my greatest gift. You okay?

name: Howard
line: Yeah. I'm terrific.

name: Leonard
line: So, which one do you think it is, matey?

name: Howard
line: Actually, I don't want to know. I want all of them to be true.

name: Leonard
line: Well, one of them is.

name: Howard
line: That's pretty cool. Thank you, guys.

name: Penny
line: Hey, it's still early. Why don't we go back and have that party?

name: Raj
line: Yeah,

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, cool.

name: Amy
line: Okay.

name: Sheldon
line: You know, surprisingly, uh, the letter from your father wasn't the most interesting thing I read in the closet. Bernadette's diary has some saucy passages.

name: Bernadette
line: Sheldon, don't you dare.

name: Sheldon
line: There's nothing to worry about. Your secret's safe with me.

name: Bernadette
line: That's more like it.

name: Sheldon
line: Although copyright law would allow me to quote snippets in the context of a review.

name: Bernadette
line: Glad you're feeling better.

name: Howard
line: Me, too. If I'd known we were gonna be dancing, would have worn my flats.

name: Penny
line: This turned out pretty well, huh?

name: Leonard
line: Yeah, I think so.

name: Raj
line: I agree. That is, if you've never been to or heard of a party before.

name: Amy
line: If you'd let me pierce your brain with a hot needle in the right place, you'd be happy all the time.

name: Sheldon
line: Uh, Penny, I, I have a couple of questions about your closet. Is there any reason you're keeping this dead goldfish?

name: Penny
line: Damn, I forgot to feed him. And that I had him.

name: Sheldon
line: Well, now, did you also have a dog? Because I found what appears to be a battery-operated chew toy.

name: Penny
line: Party's over! Party's over!

name: Bernadette
line: And the next wedding gift is a gravy boat.

name: Penny
line: Ooh, one gravy boat.

name: Amy
line: That's from Sheldon. He told me he had it engraved.

name: Bernadette
line: In the event of a divorce, please return to Sheldon Cooper.

name: Penny
line: One inappropriate, yet I wish I thought of that gravy boat.

name: Amy
line: When I get married I'm going to register at the UCLA Cadaver Lab.

name: Penny
line: Ew, why?

name: Amy
line: ‘Cause I've always wanted a whole human skeleton and they are really spendy.

name: Bernadette
line: So, you actually see you and Sheldon getting married someday?

name: Amy
line: Not just someday. In exactly four years. But don't tell Sheldon. He's still a flight risk.

name: Bernadette
line: What about you, Penny?

name: Penny
line: What about me what?

name: Bernadette
line: Do you think you and Leonard might ever get married?

name: Penny
line: Oh, well, you know, Leonard is great.

name: Bernadette
line: But do you think you'll ever get married?

name: Penny
line: He's a sweetie.

name: Amy
line: You're not answering the question. Do you love him?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, sure, of course I love him.

name: Bernadette
line: It doesn't sound like it.

name: Penny
line: Well, I do.

name: Bernadette
line: Do you tell him that?

name: Penny
line: No, he'd just take it the wrong way.

name: Amy
line: What does that mean?

name: Penny
line: It means he is special and smart and nice and...

name: Bernadette
line: Are you gonna break up with him?

name: Penny
line: No. Maybe. I don't know.

name: Bernadette
line: I had no idea you were unhappy.

name: Penny
line: That's the thing, I'm not. I'm not unhappy at all. It's just, I don't know, I, I've been in love before, but it felt different. But maybe this is a new, better, boring kind of love. Do you ever feel that way about Howard?

name: Bernadette
line: Oh, that's not really a fair comparison. I'm basically married to a sexy Buzz Lightyear.

name: Penny
line: Amy, you?

name: Amy
line: Can't help ya, kid. Whenever I'm around Sheldon, I feel like my loins are on fire. In the good way. Not the urinary tract infection way.

name: Raj
line: Hey, buddy, how's it going up there?

name: Howard
line: You don't have to shout, Raj. It's not like I'm an astronaut floating around in outer space. Oh, wait, I am.

name: Leonard
line: So, is it everything you hoped it would be?

name: Howard
line: It's better. I wake up every morning and I just can't believe I'm on this incredible adventure.

name: Dimitri
line: Hey, Froot Loops, did you clean the space toilet?

name: Howard
line: Excuse me. I'm talking to my friends.

name: Mike
line: You know the rules, new guy scrubs the toilet.

name: Dimitri
line: If you do good job, next time we give you brush.

name: Howard
line: Funny. We're always giving each other a hard time up here. It's kind of like being in a frat. You know, joking, kidding around, hurting feelings.

name: Sheldon
line: Okay, my turn. Let me talk to him.

name: Leonard
line: Go ahead.

name: Sheldon
line: 2311 North Los Robles Avenue, Pasadena, California to International Space Station. Can you read me? Over.

name: Howard
line: Yes, I read you, Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Copy that. Over.

name: Leonard
line: What are you doing?

name: Sheldon
line: I am talking to a man in space. If you don't have the  then he might as well be at the Coffee Bean over on Lake Street.

name: Howard
line: You're out of your mind,Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: That's a negative. My mother had me tested. Over.

name: Mike
line: Come on, scrub it up, Loops.

name: Howard
line: All right, all right. I gotta go. There's a meteor shower.

name: Mike
line: You want to see a meteor shower? Take a look at what Dimitri just left you in the toilet.

name: Howard
line: Bye.

name: Sheldon
line: Over and out.

name: Raj
line: Bye, buddy!

name: Stuart
line: Hello.

name: Raj
line: Hey, Stuart, come on in.

name: Sheldon
line: What are you doing here?

name: Stuart
line: Um, Raj invited me to go to the movies with you guys.

name: Sheldon
line: Excuse me. I didn't authorize this.

name: Leonard
line: Sheldon, you are not in charge.

name: Sheldon
line: That's mighty sassy for a man with a roommate performance review around the corner.

name: Raj
line: What's the big deal? You guys are bringing your girlfriends. I didn't want to sit by myself.

name: Sheldon
line: The big deal is I was expecting us to be an intimate group of five. Now, we're going to be a faceless mass of six.

name: Leonard
line: It'll be fine. Just, uh, pretend he's Wolowitz.

name: Sheldon
line: Hmm. Do you like Raisinets?

name: Stuart
line: I can take them or leave them.

name: Sheldon
line: At the movies, Wolowitz always eats Raisinets.

name: Stuart
line: Would you feel more comfortable if I ate Raisinets?

name: Sheldon
line: Well, it's hardly my business what you eat, as long as it doesn't crunch during the film and it's Raisinets.

name: Stuart
line: Okay. Should we go?

name: Sheldon
line: Yuh-uh, one more question, if you're going to replace Wolowitz, I need to know a little more about you.

name: Stuart
line: All right.

name: Sheldon
line: Wolowitz went to MIT. What's your educational background?

name: Stuart
line: I went to art school.

name: Sheldon
line: Equally ridiculous. Let's go.

name: Sheldon
line: This insistence on hand-holding is preposterous.

name: Amy
line: Well, I like it.

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, of course you do. You're a girl. You like all kinds of hippy-dippy things.

name: Amy
line: Just watch the movie.

name: Sheldon
line: It's not fair. Penny isn't making Leonard hold hands.

name: Amy
line: There might be a reason for that.

name: Sheldon
line: Sweaty? Unhygienic? Looks dumb? Take your pick.

name: Amy
line: Penny said she's not sure she wants to be Leonard's girlfriend anymore.

name: Sheldon
line: Wrong. She just took a sip from his Diet Dr. Pepper.

name: Amy
line: So?

name: Sheldon
line: So, if she wants to end her pair-bond with Leonard, why on earth would she guzzle a witches' brew of his soda and spit?

name: Amy
line: It's complicated.

name: Sheldon
line: String theory is complicated. That's just yucky. Don't get any ideas. All right, for the sake of argument, let's say that's true. Why doesn't Penny just end the relationship?

name: Amy
line: She's not sure how she feels.

name: Sheldon
line: How can she not be sure how she feels? You know, when I have a feeling, I know it. Trains? Love them. Swordfish? I love them, too. They're fish with a sword for a nose.

name: Amy
line: Regardless, don't say anything to Leonard.

name: Sheldon
line: Now you're asking me to keep a secret from my best friend, colleague, and roommate?

name: Amy
line: Yes, please, Penny will kill me.

name: Sheldon
line: Uh, fine. FYI, secret-keeping? Hate it. Hand-holding? Not a fan. Hammerhead shark? I love that thing. Yeah, it's another fish with a tool on its head.

name: Stuart
line: Raisinet?

name: Sheldon
line: Shh, we're trying to watch the movie. This is not working out with him.

name: Leonard
line: What are you doing?

name: Sheldon
line: I think I might have tartar buildup. My tongue won't go as far forward as it used to.

name: Leonard
line: Maybe your tongue is shrinking.

name: Sheldon
line: Nope. Oh, you have no idea how annoying this is.

name: Leonard
line: I'm starting to get a sense of it. Don't worry. I'll take you to the dentist tomorrow.

name: Sheldon
line: Thank you. I appreciate that. You're good people, Leonard. There's something I need to tell you.

name: Leonard
line: Okay.

name: Sheldon
line: I can't tell you.

name: Leonard
line: Why?

name: Sheldon
line: I can't tell you why I can't tell you. So I guess there's two things I can't tell you.

name: Leonard
line: I wish there were more.

name: Sheldon
line: Good night. I'm sorry. This is really important.

name: Leonard
line: What is it?

name: Sheldon
line: I like The Transformers. Do you like The Transformers?

name: Leonard
line: Where exactly did your mother have you tested?

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard, the Transformers teach us that things are not always what they appear to be. You know, like, uh, a semi truck might be an alien robot, or, uh, someone in a romantic relationship, uh, might feel differently than they appear to. Or a conversation about The Transformers might actually be about someone in this room. I'm going to pause to let that sink in.

name: Leonard
line: Okay, I think I understand.

name: Sheldon
line: You do?

name: Leonard
line: The guy who seems like an emotionless robot is you, but your relationship with Amy is causing you to transform into a red-blooded man with sexual desires.

name: Sheldon
line: That is literally the stupidest thing I've ever heard.

name: Sheldon
line: Leonard?  Leonard?  Leonard?

name: Leonard
line: What?

name: Sheldon
line: Are you sleeping?

name: Leonard
line: I was. Now I'm having a nightmare. What do you want?

name: Sheldon
line: Never mind. I still can't tell you.

name: Sheldon
line: Penny?  Penny?  Penny?

name: Penny
line: Oh, my God. Sheldon?

name: Sheldon
line: You frightened me.

name: Penny
line: What are you doing in my bedroom?

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, well, I knocked on the front door, but you didn't hear it.

name: Penny
line: How did you even get in, you weirdo?

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, really? I've seen strange men traipsing in and out of here for years, but when I do it, it's weird?

name: Penny
line: What do you want, Sheldon?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, I was having a little trouble sleeping and I just thought, uh, seeing as you're up, we could talk.

name: Penny
line: Talk about what?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, I don't know, uh, weather, uh, fish you could do carpentry with, why Leonard is such an attractive and desirable boyfriend. Yeah, pick one, your choice.

name: Penny
line: Sheldon.

name: Sheldon
line: Did you know that Leonard has a perfect driving record and enjoys the insurance discounts that go along with that? Hubba-hubba.

name: Penny
line: Okay, go home, crazy man.

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah. Did you know that while Leonard is not considered a tall fellow in our country, in today's North Korea, he's downright average. Hey, talk about a keeper.

name: Penny
line: Okay, what did Amy tell you?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, very well. I can't keep up this clever charade any longer. She told me that you were thinking of ending it with Leonard.

name: Penny
line: Okay, you listen to me. I think it's really sweet you're trying to protect your friend, but this is none of your business. Got it?

name: Sheldon
line: Excuse me. This is not about protecting my friend. I'm a big fan of homeostasis. Do you know what that is?

name: Penny
line: Of course not.

name: Sheldon
line: Homeostasis refers to a system's ability to regulate its internal environment and maintain a constant condition of properties like temperature or pH.

name: Penny
line: Worst bedtime story ever.

name: Sheldon
line: My point is I don't like when things change. So, regardless of your feelings, I would like you to continue dating Leonard. And also, while we're on the subject, you recently changed your shampoo. I'm not comfortable with the new scent. Please stop this madness and go back to green apple.

name: Penny
line: Okay, honey, I have a lot to figure out, and until I do, you are not to say a word to Leonard. Do you understand?

name: Sheldon
line: I do. You clear on the shampoo issue?

name: Penny
line: Get out.

name: Sheldon
line: Penny?

name: Penny
line: What?

name: Sheldon

line: With all the TV Sheldon was talking about, I had the greatest idea ever. It even blows away my idea for a Star Wars themed coffee shop called Brewbacca's. You need to watch Buffy the Vampire Slayer. It is the perfect show for the two of us. It's got action and jokes and hot vampires and romance. I cannot oversell this. What do you say?

name: Penny
line: It's six thirty in the morning.

name: Leonard
line: I thought you grew up on a farm.

name: Sheldon
line: Hello, SyFy Network? Yeah, this is your vice president of programming. Now, we have made a horrible mistake regarding Alphas. Yeah, we need to uncancel it immediately. Well, you just put me through to the people who handle that, you tell them it's me, and I don't want to answer a lot of questions about if I really am who I say I am, you know? I just. I want this done. No, I am not the person who just called. That man was clearly a cowboy. Yeah, who was plumb concerned about y'all cancelling his favourite show. Why do they keep hanging up on me?

name: Amy
line: I'm sorry you're upset. You know, Sheldon, sometimes people seek the comfort of physical contact in moments like this.

name: Sheldon
line: I am not flying back to Texas just so my mom can give me a hug.

name: Amy
line: Okay. Well, what I think is going on here is you have a pathological need for closure.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, that's nonsense. I mean, you tell me stories about your day all the time. I don't care how they end.

name: Amy
line: You know, I might be able to help you with this. There's a whole field of behavioural neuroscience that examines ways to retrain your neural pathways so stuff like this bothers you less.

name: Sheldon
line: Yeah, but I just told you, I don't have a problem with closure.

name: Amy
line: You sure about that?

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, quite sure.  That proves nothing.

name: Howard
line: Ready to go to lunch?

name: Raj
line: Do you think I'm feminine?

name: Howard
line: Yeah. Let's go.

name: Raj
line: Thanks a lot.

name: Howard
line: What's going on?

name: Raj
line: I broke down, and I read Lucy's blog, and in one of the entries she said, when we first met, I struck her as a little feminine.

name: Howard
line: Just a little? That's great.

name: Raj
line: I have to talk to her about this.

name: Howard
line: Oh, geez, why do you girls always want to talk about things? Listen to me, if she's writing about your relationship, use it to your advantage. Rig the game.

name: Raj
line: Well, that doesn't seem fair.

name: Howard
line: Is it fair that girls like confident, normal guys more than nervous weirdos?

name: Raj
line: No, it's not. I've always thought that was unfair.

name: Howard
line: So take what's in that blog and use it to get her pants off.

name: Raj
line: Why do you have to make everything so filthy? Why couldn't you just say the blog is like her giving me the key to her heart?

name: Howard
line: The key to her heart. That's nice. Were you quoting someone or is it tattooed on the small of your back?

name: Raj
line: I was quoting a man who knows a thing or two about women, Sir Elton John.

name: Leonard
line: So, did you love it? Of course you loved it. How could you not love it? Tell me how much you loved it.

name: Penny
line: It was cute.

name: Leonard
line: Oh, don't say cute. That's the worst.

name: Penny
line: What's wrong with cute?

name: Leonard
line: It just makes things seem small. It diminishes them.

name: Penny
line: So you want me to stop calling your little tushy cute?

name: Leonard
line: You can try, but nobody's gonna believe you. I just, I don't understand how you can watch a show that great and not be excited by it.

name: Penny
line: I liked it. I'm excited.

name: Leonard
line: Well, then, tell your face.

name: Penny
line: What do you want from me?

name: Leonard
line: You know what? Never mind. We gave it a shot. Let's just see what else is on.

name: Penny
line: Oh, come on, don't be like that.

name: Leonard
line: Well...

name: Penny
line: I'm sorry I called it cute. Let's watch another one.

name: Leonard
line: Really?

name: Penny
line: Yeah, it was fun. Kind of reminded me of my high school. But instead of vampires, we had meth heads. But both came out at night and had messed up teeth.

name: Leonard
line: All right, cool. I think you'll like the next one better. All the cheerleaders are suffering from an evil curse.

name: Penny
line: Oh. Well, that's like my high school, too. But instead of a curse, it was crabs.

name: Amy
line: I've come up with a series of exercises to help with your compulsive need for closure.

name: Sheldon
line: I take issue with the word compulsive.

name: Amy
line: All I'm saying is, we live in a world where closure isn't always an op...

name: Sheldon
line: ...tion. Okay. For the sake of argument, let's say I have a problem. What would be your plan for addressing it?

name: Amy
line: I'm going to recondition your brain so that the need for completion isn't so overwhelming.

name: Sheldon
line: By playing tic-tac-toe?

name: Amy
line: Yep. Your turn.

name: Sheldon
line: Oh, Amy. And you wonder why people think neuroscience is nothing but a goofy game for diaper babies. Tic-tac-toe can only end in win, lose or draw, none of which will deny me closure. Especially since I'm about to win.  B-But we didn't finish.

name: Amy
line: Exactly. How does that make you feel?

name: Sheldon
line: The same way any normal person would. I feel like I want to peel off my own face and tear it in two and then again and again until I have a handful of Sheldon-face confetti.

name: Amy
line: And that's exactly the feeling we want to address with this course of treatment.

name: Sheldon
line: Or you could pitch in, grab a nostril and help me get this face off.

name: Amy
line: Come on, you can do this.

name: Sheldon
line: You don't know what it's like to feel completely frustrated. To have a desire build up within you and be denied any opportunity for release.

name: Amy
line: Yeah, sounds like a drag.

name: Penny
line: Okay, help me out here. Why does he love this show so much?

name: Bernadette
line: Well, there was action, it was funny. I mean, you do get that usually the monster chases the pretty girl, but this time the pretty girl chases the monsters?

name: Penny
line: Yippee, it's backwards. I get it.

name: Bernadette
line: Why does this bother you so much?

name: Penny
line: I don't know. It's just, he's so passionate about so many different things. I just don't get that way. Do you?

name: Bernadette
line: Well, sure. I'm pretty passionate about science. I remember the first time I looked through a microscope and saw millions of tiny microorganisms. It was like a whole other universe. If I wanted to, I could wipe it out with my thumb like a god.

name: Penny
line: See? I wish I had some of that fire in my life. I mean, I want to care about things and get excited like you guys.

name: Bernadette
line: Well, there's no reason you can't.

name: Penny
line: You think?

name: Bernadette
line: Absolutely. All we need to do is spend a little time and find something you're passionate about.

name: Penny
line: Ugh, that sounds like a lot of work.

line: Hey, what's up?

line: Just tell me which one you think is more manly. This hockey jersey or this football jersey.

line: Good, black is more slimming. Oh, that's her. I got to go be butch. Toodles. Hey.

line: Okay, Sheldon, make a wish and blow out the candles. Oops, missed one. Now your wish can't come true.

line: Lucky for you, 'cause I wished you were dead.

line: Thanks. I love hockey.

name: Lucy
line: Oh, cool. So does my dad. We watched it all the time growing up. Who's your favourite player?

name: Raj
line: Not Brian Boitano, that's for sure. How's your burrito?

name: Lucy
line: Well, you're acting all weird, and I'm pretty weird, so I think I know what I'm talking about.

line: I don't know. Maybe it's all those steroids I've been taking.

name: Lucy
line: I think I'm gonna go. Thank you for the burrito and the pork rinds and the 20-minute lecture on why monster trucks are better than regular trucks.

line: Wait, wait. I, I found your blog here you wrote about me.

name: Lucy
line: Oh. I kind of just write that for myself. I didn't think anybody actually read it.

name: Raj
line: No kidding. You didn't make it easy to find. I spent hours digging around online. For the record, you have excellent credit scores. And your diabetic aunt seems to be adjusting to her new leg just fine.

name: Lucy
line: Why were you acting so strange tonight?

name: Raj
line: You called me feminine. And I, I wanted you to think I was more manly.

name: Lucy
line: Raj, I didn't say feminine was a bad thing. I meant that you're sweet and thoughtful and your skin looks so much like caramel, I just want to dip an apple in your face.

name: Raj
line: I do have a pretty balls-to-the-wall moisturising regimen.

line: So, I was thinking how excited you get about stuff like Buffy or science or which TV remote you and Sheldon should buy.

line: The Harmony One was fine. We didn't need to upgrade to the eleven hundred, which he knows is too big for my hand.

line: See, that's the kind of passion I didn't think I had. But then I realized I'm passionate about you.

line: Oh, my cute little tushy strikes again.

line: No, I'm serious. Look, I've always had these plans. I was gonna be in movies and live this glamorous life, and anything less than that just wasn't worth getting excited about.

line: Those things can still happen.

name: Penny
line: Oh, obviously it's gonna happen. Yeah, a psychic at a bachelorette party told me so. Anyway, what I meant was, I shouldn't wait, you know? I've got you, I've got Sheldon, all these wonderful friends. My life is exciting right now.

line: That's a big deal.

line: Leonard, I had an epiphany, not a stroke.

line: Amy, I must say, I was sceptical at first, but this has truly been a transformative evening.

line: Hello. Uh, is this the Bruce Miller who wrote the season finale of Alphas? Oh, smashing. Yeah, you already sound nicer than the last Bruce Miller who suggested I have sexual relations with myself. Now, down to business. Um, your show ended on a cliffhanger. Could you please tell me how you planned to resolve it? Uh-huh. Mm-hmm. I see. Well, that all stinks. No wonder you got cancelled. Bye.

line: The interface is pretty simple. You put your horizontal X coordinate here, vertical Y coordinate here. When you're happy with those, you press this button.

line: It's very simple. For breakfast, she has an egg-white frittata. Feel free to give her a choice of home fries or an English muffin, but not both. We're watching our weight. Uh, for dinner, something simple, a veal chop, some scampi, whatever you like.

line: Professor Proton, it's an honour to meet you.

line: You're the genius.

line: What, what has it ever gotten me? I mean, I'm, I'm an 83-year-old man who has potatoes in, in his suitcase. Other scientists think, think I'm a joke. And the, the puppeteer who did, who did Gino, well, he also did my wife.

line: I'm sorry to hear about your troubles.

line: I wrote a fan letter to you when I was a child in Texas, and you sent this autographed picture back to me. Do you remember that?

line: No, I, I get that.

line: But, um, I did have you. And every day at four o'clock, you'd come to my house on Channel 68, and we'd do science together. If it hadn't been for you, well, who knows what would've become of me? You know? Instead of a world-class physicist, I could've wound up as a hobo. Or a surgeon.

name: Leonard
line: I bet there are important discoveries being made every day because you inspired millions of kids to pursue science. In a way, their discoveries are your discoveries.

line: Yeah, it's true. A generation of young scientists are standing on your shoulders.

line: Well, thank, thank you, guys. That, that, that means a lot.

line: Uh-oh.
